loans.name: William De Los Reyes

texts.es: El señor William tiene 38 años. El se dedica a la venta de medicamentos. Cabe señalarse, sus productos los compra en Managua al por mayor para obtener mejores precios y obtener mayores ganancias. Esta no es la primera vez que solicita financiamientos, pues ha sido de gran ayuda, inicio a su negocio hace 6 años, buscando una fuente alternativa de ingresos para brindarle manutención a su familia. Pues con muy poco capital de trabajo ha salido adelante. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de medicamentos.
texts.en: Mr. William is a 38-year-old man who sells medicine for a living. It should be pointed out that he purchases his products wholesale in Managua so that he can obtain the best prices and bigger profits. This is not the first time that he requests a loan, as they have been a big help. He started his own business 6 years ago in an attempt to find an alternative source of income to support his family. He has managed to get ahead with just a little capital. The loan that he is requesting will be used to purchase medicine.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Marlene Yolanda

texts.es:
la sra. Marlene Yolanda V. M. tiene 29 años de edad, vive en el caserio el Cedrito, el Triunfo Choluteca, Marlene se dedica a la fabricacion de piñatas y coronas, sus productos los fabrica en su casa de habitacion.
Marlene es madre de 2 hijos los cuales los tiene estudiando en la escuela de su comunidad.
Marlene y su esposo trabajan duro para sacar adelante a sus hijos. 
Marlene se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para empezar a fabricar sus piñatas y coronas, sus tiempos libres lo dedica a su familia.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales para la fabricacion de las piñatas y coronas, en esta epoca muchas personas revientan piñatas, tiene varios pedidos.
su meta es poder crecer mas con su negocio y que las ganancias sean buenas.
texts.en:
Marlene Yolanda V. M., age 29, lives in the Cedrito settlement in the El Triunfo municipality, Choluteca department.  Marlene makes piñatas and funeral wreaths in her house.

Marlene has two children who attend the community school.  Marlene and her husband work hard in order to get their children ahead.  Malene gets up at five every morning to start making her piñatas and funeral wreaths.  She devotes her free time to her family.

She will use the loan to buy materials to make piñatas and funeral wreaths.  During this season many people crack open piñatas, and she has various orders.  

Her goal is to be able to grow more with her business and that she gets good earnings.

loans.use: To buy materials to make piñatas and funeral wreaths

loans.name: Mario Del Carmen

texts.es:
El Señor Mario C., tiene 27 años de edad, vive en la Comarca Namanji, en Estelí, con más de 10 años de experiencia en el sector agrícola.
El recuerda que empezó desde los 10 años de edad ayudando a sus padres a limpiar frijoles. Dejo de estudiar cuando apenas estaba en 2do grado de primaria; Luego su padre falleció cuando el tenia 13 años de edad y tuvo que seguir trabajando duro para ayudarle a su mama.
A los 20 años de edad se caso, pero siguió viviendo con su Mama para ayudarla, fueron sembrando poco a poco repollo, cebolla, chiltoma, y recogiendo dinero para seguir mejorando. A invertido en algunas maquinarias como: pozo, regaderos… etc.
Realizo este crédito para la siembra de cebolla en especial, pero desea mejorar poco a poco la variedad de cultivo. Espera obtener buenos resultados de esta siembra, en especial que el producto sea de mayor calidad para venderlo a un mejor precio.
Sus metas son seguir mejorando su calidad de vida y ayudar a sus hijos a que sigan estudiando y puedan tener un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Mario C. is 27 and lives in Comarca Namanji, in Esteli, he has more than 10 years of experience in the agriculture industry.

He remembers starting when he was 10 years old helping his parents clean beans.  He quit studying when he was only in 2nd grade of elementary, his dad passed away when he was 13 and he had to work hard to help his mom.

When he was 20 he got married, but continued to live with his mom to help her, they started growing little by little, cabbage, onion, 
sweet pepper, making some money for betterment. He has invested in some technology such as a well, irrigation system, etc.

He requested this loan to particularly grow onion, but he wants to improve the variety of his crops little by little.  He hopes to get good results from this crop and get a better quality product so he can sell it at a higher price.
His goals are to continue improving his quality of life and help his children study so they can have a better future.

loans.use: To grow onion

loans.name: Luciano Evaristo

texts.es:
Luciano Evaristo V. V. tiene 57 años de edad. Vive en unión Libre con la compañera y con los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia Los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. 26 DE NOVIEMBRE  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Las blancas Perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Luciano Evaristo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz desde hace 5 años. Compra sus productos en Agripac, y  vende en la feria en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, arroz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es poder construir una casa.

Le gusta el deporte.
texts.en:
Luciano Evaristo V. V. is 57. He is in a common-law marriage and lives with his partner and children in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios Province. He has 2 children.

The members of the V.R.C. 26 de Noviembre ["November 26th"] are located in the Las Blancas neighbourhood belonging to the Ventanas Canton. The members of this bank have long worked in short-cycle agricultural labour, sowing corn and rice.

Luciano Evaristo has worked in agriculture, sowing corn and rice, for five years. He buys his products in Agripac and sells them in the market in Ventanas.

He is requesting this loan to purchase agricultural tools and fertilizers for cultivating corn and rice. In supporting this loan, you will help him economically to supply his needs. He confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. His dream is to be able to build a house.
He enjoys sports.

loans.use: the purchase of agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Felicisima

texts.en: Felicisima is a married woman who lives in Toledo City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: firewood, used clothing and pig fattening. Her 58-year-old husband, Julio, works as a farmer to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have five children who are between 23 and 32 years old. Felicisima joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past two loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Felicisima has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 3,900, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her third loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000, which she intends to use to buy new equipment for farming so that she can continue to save up for the future improvement of her business. Felicisima is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable) woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team: http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: Purchase new equipment for farming

loans.name: Book Jom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BOOK JOM est créé depuis un an et demi. Il est composé de 25 femmes qui sont du même village. Elle se sont regroupées par voisinage et par affinité. Le petit commerce est leur activité principale. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de THIEO ADI

Madame Jeanne D. debout à l'extrême droite de la photo, levant la main, est responsable du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de deux autres enfants qui lui sont confiés par des parents. 

Elle développe une activité de petit commerce. Elle vend des tissus. Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de renforcer son activité en augmentant son niveau d'approvisionnement.

Avec les bénéfices qu'elle réalise à partir de son activité elle paye de cours de renforcement pour son fils qui se prépare à faire un exement. Elle participe également à la prise en charge de certaines dépenses de la famille
texts.en:
The solidarity group Book Jom was created a year and half ago. It is made up of 25 women who come from the same town. They formed the group through neighbourhood and social connections. Their main activity involves running small businesses. The group belongs to the Village Loan Group of Thieo Adi.

Ms. Jeanne D., standing all the way on the right in the photo with the raised hand, is responsible for the group. She is married and has two children. She also has two other children in her care, who were entrusted to her by their parents.

She has developed a small business selling fabric. Her new loan will allow her to strengthen her business by raising her ability to buy supplies.

With the profits that she draws from her business, she pays for a review course for her son, who is preparing for an exam. She also contributes to paying for certain household expenses.

loans.use: To buy fabric for resale

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is a married woman who lives in the municipality of Dalaguete, Cebu. She earns her living by operating three business ventures:  soft drinks retailing, motorcycle transport and farming. Her husband Fermin, who is 54 years old, works as a miner to earn his living.  They have 15 children who are between 18 and 42 years old. Merlinda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Merlinda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 13,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000 uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 12th loan, she is borrowing PHP 14,000 to buy additional goods for her business so that she can continue to save up for future family needs. Merlinda is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To purchase additional goods for her business

loans.name: Samina Maryam's Group

texts.en:
Samina maryam is a very supportive lady. She operates a decorative embroidery business to financially support her family. She receives orders from different members of her community and fulfills them on time to earn for her family. 

Her husband also involved in the same embroidery business. He operates his shop in the market and provides machine as well as hand embroidery services to his customers. He is very well known among his clients for his good quality work and receives regular orders every month. 

Samina has 2 sons. Both are still too young for school. Samina wants to enroll her eldest son in school in the near future and for that purpose she saves profits every month from her work. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who will buy embroidering material such as beads, colored thread and sketches in bulk quantity to offer better quality services to his clients. 

Samina is hopeful that an investment will help her husband to further improve his business and increase his monthly profits.

She lives with her family in the area of Kalar abadi which is a small residential area in Gujranwala. Gujranwala is a midsized city of Pakistan and known for its industrial importance.

Note: “In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Samina Maryam”.

loans.use: to buy embroidery material for embroidery business

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Family issues matter to Luzviminda M., 39, as much as matters pertaining to her own business. Minda, as she is called by friends, reached only high school and fervently wishes that her children will reach farther than she did. She is married to Ronald, a vendor. They have five children. Two are in high school, another two study in elementary, and the youngest is not yet of school age. They used to live in Pangasinan, but at present the whole family resides in Libertad, Pasay City.

Aside from the profits of their tricycle operations which go to their family's needs, Minda focuses on her food stall as another primary source of income. Everyday she prepares breakfast and snacks as part of the menu, serving the customers who are too busy to prepare their own meals or those who stay on the road too long and do not have enough time to go home to eat. Minda has her own space in the community's public market, and she has sold from there for thirteen years now. Ronald helps her with the daily tasks. Every month they are able to earn around $320.

To help her expand her food stall, Minda is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. She will use this money to purchase necessary ingredients for cooking, such as cooking oil, coconut, eggs and brown sugar, as well supplies such as spaghetti noodles and macaroni. Minda recognizes the big help the loan represents in her business, as it helps her augment her family's needs with increased profits.

According to Minda herself, daily sales become low during the rainy season. Another challenge to her comes as the result of her child's early marriage. This child of hers was not prepared to establish a separate home, and still lives with them. Minda prays that her child and her son-in-law will find a decent job to support themselves. For her other children, she prays that they would fulfill her dream of seeing them graduate from college. Minda wants to see her business grow and have good sales daily. She also dreams of having her own commercial space. 

As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase necessary ingredients for her food stall

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en:
Zaur A. is 27 years old. He is working together with his father who taught him best business practice. He is a small-business entrepreneur who sells different kinds of detergents, soap, shampoo, toothpaste, shaving cream and washing powder, and many foodstuffs in his store.  
 
Today, Zaur is requesting a loan of 900 AZN to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. Zaur’s main goal is to become successful entrepreneur, build his own house, and have his own family one day. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: purchase more items to increase his stock.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba Y. is married to a farmer. With 10 children, they have a rather large family to support. Aba makes a living selling kenkey, a Ghanaian staple made from fermented maize dough. It is usually served with pepper sauce and fish. The income Aba makes helps pay for their children’s school fees and some of the household expenses. 

As their family grows, so does the need to make ends meet. Aba wants to grow her kenkey business and needs a loan to purchase more maize so that she can prepare more kenkey. Additional profits she makes will be used to provide for her family and also reinvested back into her business for further growth. 

Aba is showing the soaked maize yet to be processed into corn dough to be used to prepare the kenkey.

loans.use: to buy more maize to make kenkey

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 37 years old and is married with three children, two of whom are in school.

Fe is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables and rice in the Philippines. Fe has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Fe has been farming vegetables and rice for five years now, and has borrowed from NWTF six previous times.

In the future, Fe would like to save enough money to buy more farm land and to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina is now 39 years of age and married with four school-aged children. Saturnina is a farmer working in the Philippines who earns PHP 5,000 per month. 

Saturnina is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for her corn farm. Saturnina has been growing corn for 15 years.

In the future, Saturnina hopes to have a large crop of corn in order to gain income to satisfy the daily basic needs of her family, most especially the educational needs of her children. She also believes that she can improve their status of living and start another kind of business through the continuous support and assistance of the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for her corn farm

loans.name: Hamilton Darwin

texts.es:
Hamilton Darwin tiene 19 años, es soltero vive con los padres. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama NARCISA DE JESUS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Temistocles, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Hamilton se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos y la variación del clima. Su sueño es ser profesional.

Le gusta hacer deporte y estudiar.
texts.en:
Hamilton Darwin is 19 years old and single. He lives with his parents in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The Communal Bank called “Narcisa de Jesus” is located in the neighborhood of Recinto San Temistocles, which is part of the canton of Ventanas. This Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn and rice.

Hamilton is a farmer who grows corn and rice. He buys his supplies in Ventanas each month and then sells at the fair located in the same area.

Hamilton is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, and compost. With the financial assistance provided through this loan, he will be to acquire needed supplies. The challenges he faces include pests, crop diseases, and changes in weather. His dream is to become a professional.

Hamilton enjoys playing sports and studying.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and compost.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
La Sra.Liliana, de 26 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr. Alberto de 27 años de edad,con quien tiene 2 hijas. Se encuentran viviendo la Ciudad de Itá ya hace unos años.
La Sra. se dedica a la costura. Actualmente posee un taller con 4 maquinas industriales, 1 overloock y una collareta, tanto ella como su cónyuge se dedican a la costura y confeccionas prendas de todo tipo, tanto para damas,caballeros y niños.
Solicitan el crédito para la ampliación de su taller de costura, ya que el espacio se esta volviendo demasiado pequeño para la cantidad de trabajo que realizan, ademas de esto necesitan los kits de costuras, también hilos y agujas. Creen que el credito les sera de gran ayuda para todos los planes que tienen respecto al taller.
texts.en:
Liliana is 26 years old and married to Alberto, who is 27, and they have two daughters.  They have lived in the city of Itá for a few years.

Liliana works as a seamstress.  She has a workshop with four industrial machines, one overlock sewing machine, and a sewing machine for collars.  Both she and her husband sew and make all types of clothing for women, men, and children.

She is asking for this loan to expand her sewing workshop, since the space is becoming too small for the amount of work that they do.  They also need sewing kits, thread, and needles.  They believe that this loan will be a big help to all of the plans they have for their workshop.

loans.use: to expand her sewing workshop and purchase materials.

loans.name: Claudia Elena

texts.es: La joven Claudia Elena tiene su negocio que es la venta de mercadería en general, desde hace más de 3 años, la experiencia que ha obtenido en su negocio ha sido muy reconfortante. La mayoría de sus clientes siempre le solicitan una gran variedad de productos. Claudia tiene 2 hijos a su cargo, siempre se ha hecho responsable por proporcionarle las cosas más básicas, a pesar de que ella no pudo terminar sus estudios quiere que su hija logra ser una profesional. Este crédito es para la compra de  perfumes, calzado, ropa en general, cosméticos, sabanas, entre otros.
texts.en:
Claudia Elena has a business selling general merchandise.  The experience she’s gained in business over the last three years has been very reassuring.  Most of her customers request quite a variety of products.

Claudia has two children in her care.  She has always been responsible for providing them with the basics despite not being able to finish her studies; she wants her daughter to become a professional. 

This loan is to buy perfume, footwear, clothing in general, cosmetics and sheets, among others.

loans.use: to buy perfume, footwear, clothing in general, cosmetics and sheets, among others.

loans.name: 67 Thieu Do Group

texts.en:
Mrs Chien has a retail business selling clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase clothing to resell.

Chien is 51 years old and is married with 2 children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents. Chien is the group leader of the 67 Thieu Do solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 

This is Chien's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Chien has been involved in this business for 7 years.
The main hardship that Chien faces in her business is lack of capital.

With her business profit, Chien hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to resell

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is 54 years old and married. He and his wife have been blessed with two children. The eldest is married and working while the youngest is still studying. 

Benjamin is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. He has managed this kind of business for ten years and is thankful because he is able to sustain his family. His wife helps with planting the rice. 

Benjamin would like to ask for a loan of 30,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to support him in his farming business. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer and insecticides, as well as to pay for labor. He hopes that he can increase his yield, which would allow him to save money for his security once he is too old to work.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Kision

texts.en: Kision is a thirty one year old married man with four children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been operating a retail shop for three years. He started with capital of 300,000 shillings from coffee savings and now he has capital of 3,000,000. His hardship is high inflation rates and his vision is having another retail shop. He also wishes to educate his children. Kision needs the credit facility to buy sugar, salt and drinks to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, salt and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Sry

texts.en:
Sry is a farmer working in Ornlong Veng District, Siem Reap Province of Cambodia. She grows rice and has been in this business for many years. She is married to Chen who also works. They have given birth to two kids who they support with their profit. Both of her children are attending school. 

From this business, Sry earns approximately $2 USD per day.  Sry would like to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farm materials but lacks the capital.  So, she wishes to have help from Kiva. She will use these funds to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farm materials to help her earn a living.  

Sry hopes that these funds will help her make more profit, and she is very grateful for all the lenders that help her family. She says that everything she does is for her family’s well-being because she’d like to give them a different lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm materials.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 38 years old, married,  and has two children.  She is a hardworking business woman who sells clothes to make a living. She has been in this business for 14 years. Alice has expanded her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained in business management. Her desire is to further expand her business within five years. Alice is requesting for a loan of 20,000 KES, which she will use to buy clothes.

loans.use: To purchase clothes.

loans.name: Hormiguitas De Palcoco Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “HORMIGUITAS DE PALCOCO” iniciará su décimo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva de la cual la señora Angélica es la presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Tienda de barrio, venta de colchones, venta de comida, venta de cerveza, venta de huevos, venta de carne.

La señora Angélica, indica es la primera ves que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora en la zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración y venta de tullmas (adornos para el trenzado de las mujeres de pollera) que viene trabajando has diez años atrás, aprendiendo el mismo de su mama.

El préstamo que sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de lana y máquina de hilar) que adquirirá de la feria 16 de julio y posterior a la elaboración de sus productos los venderá en las ferias de su comunidad. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Hormiguitas de Palcoco” (Little Ants of Palcoco) is starting its eleventh loan with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Community Center. This group consists of eight members who are led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Angélica, who is the president. The members of this Communal Bank engage in different businesses to get ahead such as managing a neighborhood store, selling bedspreads, selling food, selling beer, selling eggs, and selling meat.

Sra. Angélica says that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer. She joined the organization after being invited by a local promoter. Angélica currently has a business making and selling “tullmas” (decorations for the pleats on women’s skirts) for 10 years. She learned this skill from her mother.

The loan she is receiving will be used to increase her capital for buying wool and a spinning machine that she will acquire at the July 16th fair so that she can make her products to sell at the community fairs. Working in this manner has enabled her to generate income to support her family. Angélica is single and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Angélica said that she enjoys the health classes and the loans.

loans.use: to purchase wool and a spinning machine.

loans.name: Anaclita

texts.en:
Anaclita is 64 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past six years Anaclita has run a general store in the Philippines and she also earns an income from motorcycle rentals. She has borrowed and repaid 12 previous loans from NWTF.

Anaclita is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her store. She aspires to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell in her store

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 30-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are in the school. She has a clothes selling business in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for six years.
Mary requested this loan through BRAC, South Sudan, with the hope of expanding her business. She will use her profits to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Teresa De Los Angeles

texts.es: Teresa, originaria de LEON nos comparte su experiencia vivida con el primer prestamo que lo invirtio para en regrgas de minutos a celulares , compra para surtir su mini pulperia, le fue bien su venta ah crecido poco a poco, es por que esta muy agradecida con los prestamistas de kiva por ayudarle en su inciativa de salir adelante Ahora desea poner un cyber cafe es por ello que solicita este segundo credito para comprar computadoras,usada pero en buen estado e invertir en compra de telefonos porque siempre tiene en mente poner cabinas telefonicas para hacer llamadas internacionles. Siempre buscando la manera de progresar para sacar a su familia adelante.
texts.en:
Teresa is originally from León.  She shares the experience she had with her first loan with us.  She invested it in cell phone recharge minutes and bought stock items for her mini grocery store.  She did well with sales; she’s grown little by little.  Because of this she’s very grateful to Kiva lenders for helping her with her initiative to get ahead.

Now, she wants to open an Internet Café so is asking for her second loan to buy computers that are used but in good condition and to buy telephones because she’s also planning to install phone booths for international phone calls.  She’s always looking for ways to make progress and move her family ahead.

loans.use: to buy used computers and to buy telephones.

loans.name: Santos Bacilio

texts.es:
el sr. Santos Bacilio tiene 36 años de edad, esta casado y es padre de 2 hijos, Santos se dedica a la producción de café, tiene una experiencia en el manejo y cultivo de café de 10 años aproximadamente, tambien Santos pastorea, ya tiene más de 2 años de estar pastoreando una congregación cristiana en la comunidad de Bañaderos.
Don Santos utilizara el credito para comprar su propio sistema solar y poder gozar del servicio de energía ya que es lo que la familia a anhelado, gracias a esto mejoraran las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Santos Bacilio is 36, married, and the father of two children. Santos is a coffee farmer, and has around ten years experience growing coffee. He is also a pastor, and has been the pastor of a Christian congregation in the community of Bañaderos, for more than two years. 

He will use the loan to buy his own solar energy system, to be able to enjoy electricity service, as that is what his family has longed for. Thanks to this, they will improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a solar energy panel.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius, 34, is a resident and a farmer in the Nkubu area of Central Kenya, where he carries out farming as well as a transport business. He is married with two children, ages 9 and 7. He has been in active farming for 10 years and currently sells beans, maize and wheat produced locally.

Julius has requested for a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy dairy goats. He says these goats will be able to provide him with milk during dry seasons. He says the loan will help him improve his farming by buying dairy cows in the future and provide income to educate his children.

He sees rampant drought as the main challenge to farmers.

loans.use: to buy dairy goats.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 47 years old and is a married woman with six children. She has been engaged in farming for six years. Judith grows rice crops to sell to her community. She also runs a small sari-sari (variety) store business where she sells items like coffee, sugar, shampoo, soap and canned goods.

Judith is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and more items to sell like canned goods. Judith hopes to help improve her family's living situation through her income. She also hopes for her children to finish college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and more items to sell like canned goods.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy raw materials for detergent and floor polish making.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 39 years old and lives in Gango, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has two school-aged children. Arlene has a shop that sells canned goods, soap, toothpaste, and noodles, etc. She has had this business for two years. 

Arlene has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase more canned good, noodles, soap, etc to sell. She has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Arlene hopes to start another business.

loans.use: to purchase more canned good, noodles, and soap to sell.

loans.name: Hien

texts.en:
Hien is 22 years old and single. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City.

For the past three years, he has been earning a living operating an internet and game business at his house.

Hien would like to take out a loan to buy more computers and games for his business. He hopes the loan will help him to provide better services, generate more income to cover his family's living expenses, and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy more computers and games for his business.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Juliet is 35 years old and both of her children are in school.

Juliet has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Juliet requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of rice to sell.

Juliet has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Juliet would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Shahla

texts.en:
Shahla is a women of 42 years with 4 children. She started up her fruit sales business with her husband. 

In the beginning she sold only fruits. Since 2004 Shahla has been engaged in selling both fruits and vegetables. 

Now she needs a loan of $500 to futher develop her business,to remodel her working place and by  buying different sorts of fruits such as ananas, banana,kiwi to difersify their variety.

loans.use: Improve her business condition and diversify variety of fruits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Eunice Wangui intends to buy 20 baskets of vegetables to increase the stock

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
María is 45 years old, has 6 children, and has been separated from her husband for 8 years because he was abusive to her when he drank. Since then, María has supported her household by weaving napkins and placemats and selling them in the Santo Domingo market to tourists and people from the town. With the loan, she wants to buy thread at whole-sale price so that she can have more materials at home and thereby increase her production. She is part of the “Clouds Group 8”.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

MARIA TIENE 45 AÑOS ,6 HIJOS DESDE HACE 8 AÑOS ESTA SEPARADA DE SU ESPOSO A CAUSA DEL MALTRATO QUE LE DABA CUANDO CONSUMIA ALCOHOL. DESDE ENTONCES ELLA SOSTIENE SU HOGAR TEJIENDO A TELAR SERVILLETAS , INDIVIDUALES ARTESANALES PARA VENDER EN EL MERCADO DE SANTO DOMINGO A LOS TURISTAS Y GENTE DEL PUEBLO .CON EL PRESTAMO QUIERE COMPRAR HILOS AL POR MAYOR Y ASI TENER MAS MATERIA PRIMA EN CASA Y AUMENTAR LA PRODUCCION DE ARTESANIAS.PERTENECE AL GRUPO NUBES 8

loans.use: To buy thread at whole-sale price

loans.name: Enedina

texts.es:
Enedina is a very hard-working woman. She is married and has a daughter; her husband is an assistant in a workshop. In order to improve the quality of her family's life and offer her daughter a good education, Enedina began her own business seven years ago selling cosmetics. She started out by giving away samples; thanks to their high quality, her sales increased.

Thanks to the experience she's acquired thus far, Enedina knows that this is a very good time to increase her sales and is thus asking for a loan of $200. She will use it to buy merchandise so that she can offer her customers a greater variety of products. She is committed to repaying the loan within 3 months. Please decide to help Enedina and her family; they would be very grateful for your support.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Enedina es una mujer muy trabajadora, está casada y tiene una hija, su esposo es ayudante en un taller. Para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y ofrecerle a su hija una buena educación Enedina inició su propio negocio desde hace siete años con la venta de cosméticos, comenzó regalando muestras de sus productos y gracias a su buena calidad pronto fueron incrementando sus pedidos

Con la experiencia que ha adquirido Enedina sabe que esta es una muy buena temporada para incrementar sus ventas y está solicitando un préstamo de $ 200 dólares con los que comprara mercancía para ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes, ella promete devolver esta cantidad en 3 meses. Decídete a ayudar a Enedina y su familia, ellos agradecen mucho tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise

loans.name: Luísa Pedro

texts.pt:
Luísa Pedro S. is 39 years old and is the single mother of 3 children. She lives in the Khongolote district in Maputo. She started FDM's program in April 2007 and took a first loan of 6000 meticiais. She sells duvets and blankets, as well as clothes which she buys in South Africa. She has moved from her home to Xai-Xai and her 1st loan cycle went well. She will borrow 7000 meticais to pay back in 5 months.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

Luísa Pedro S. tem 39 anos de idade e é mãe solteira de 3 filhos. Vive no bairro Khongolote em Maputo. Entrou para o programa em Abril deste ano e tomu 6.000MT como primeiro empréstimo. Vende duvês e mantas, e ainda roupa que compra na Àfrica do Sul.Vem transferida de Xai- Xai uma vez que mudou de residência e comportou- se bem no 1º ciclo de empréstimo. Vai tomar 7.000MT para pagar em 5 meses.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Nuranda

texts.en:
I. Nuranda is 43 years old, married and the mother of five children. She is a refugee from the Azerbaijan- Armenian conflict territory Lachin region, situated in the western part of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Right now she lives in Sumqayit city. She is a low-income person who is very vulnerable to shifts in the local economy.

She buys lambs and raises them in half a year. She wants to expand her business.

Nurende would like to receive a $300 loan in order to acquire three small sheep, raise them and feed them. She will repay the loan within 12 months. She hopes eventually to expand her business. She hopes that this will further improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To acquire three small sheep, raise them and feed them

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en: Saleh is a 36 year old man. He lives with his wife and three children in South Lebanon, in the region of Saida. Saleh owns a glass store. He needs $1200 to buy enough merchandise to sustain and develop his business. Saleh is constantly striving to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha, age 25, is married with 3 children (ages 10, 6, and 3). She has a business of selling chapatis (round flat bread) and charcoal. She started this business in 1998, and now makes about $55 in profit per month for her work. She works daily from 5am to 10pm.

Asha hopes for a loan to expand her business by buying more stock. She belongs to the loan group Umani, which totals 38 members, who ensure one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more food items and charcoal stock

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia, a twenty-four year old mother of three children, lives in Casabe community of Santo Domingo where she strives to make a living and support her family.
She helps needy people of her hometown by lending them money at very low interests.  Patricia explains that the most of people of Casabe don’t have a job.  And people that work receive their salary bi-weekly, but they have to spend money every day to face the household issues.   Her clientele is built-up of these people.
Her husband, a truck driver, helps her run the business.  Patricia says that she wants to turn her business into a formal lending bank with lots of customers.  “My neighbors need help, and as far as possible, I will help them”.  She is requesting a loan of $375 so that she can have more capital to keep running her business.

loans.use: To invest in her small money-lending house.

loans.name: Theresia's Mkombozi Group

texts.en:
Theresia is 50 years old and is a married woman with 4 children, ages 24, 21, 18, and 16 years old. Theresia is a food and vegetable seller, a business she started in 2003. Every day, she works from 6am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

In the past, Theresia has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Sharifa, who has a business dealing in retail sales.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Juana Carmen's Group

texts.es:
Briggett, Rosa y Juana have belonged to the Banco Comunal of Yanapanakusun, which means "let's help ourselves" in quechua, for 1, 1 and 4 years respectively.

Briggett is a single mother, is 20 years old and have one son who is a systems engineering student. Briggett has a store where she sells clothing, groceries, and toys. She buys some of her products in the city of Lima.

Rosa lives with her partner, is 33 years old and has 2 children. Rosa and her husband make corn canchas (toasted snacks made from grains) , wheat, and noodles, which they sell wholesale out of their house.

Juana is married, is 53 years old and has 2 children. Juana sells underwear to friends and acquaintances. She also works in a social aid institution.

Briggett, Rosa y Juana need loans of 1000, 600 and 600 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of shirts, pants, shoes, noodles, corn, wheat and underwear.

Briggett, Rosa and Juana's dreams are to have a store in the city center, to travel abroad, to provide their children with a good education and to have a house in the city of Lima.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Briggett, Rosa y Juana pertenecen al Banco Comunal Yanapanakusun que significa “Ayudémonos” en quechua, hace 1 año, 4 meses, 1 año respectivamente.

Briggett es madre soltera, tiene 20 años y 1 hijo, estudiante de Ingeniería de Sistemas, Briggett tiene una bodega donde vende ropa, abarrotes, juguetes, algunos de sus productos son adquiridos en la ciudad de Lima.

Por otro lado Rosa es conviviente, tiene 33 años y 2 hijos, Rosa junto a su esposo elabora canchas (bocaditos hechos de cereales que son tostados) de maíz, trigo, fideo y sus ventas lo realizan en su casa al por mayor.

Mientras que Juana es casada, tiene 53 años y 2 hijos, Juana vende ropas interiores, productos que ofrece a amigos y familiares. Además trabaja en una institución como asistenta social.

Briggett, Rosa y Juana necesitan préstamos de 1000 soles, 600 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de polos, pantalones, zapatos, fideo, maíz, trigo y ropas interiores.

Los sueños de Briggett, Rosa y Juana son tener su tienda en el centro de la ciudad, viajar al extranjero, brindarles una buena educación a sus hijos y tener una casa en la ciudad de Lima.

loans.use: Briggett, Rosa y Juana need loans of 1000, 600 and 600 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of shirts, pants, shoes, noodles, corn, wheat and underwear.

loans.name: Luluk

texts.id:
Luluk’s daily work is a trader of electrical appliances. These electrical appliances include bulbs, fluorescent tubes, switches, circuit breaker, cables and various other types of electric appliances. A mother aged 33 years has been in this profession for sometime. At this moment Luluk needs additional funding very much in order to be able to add more variety and quantity of appliances offered. With her husband, I Ketut Widiani, they live in Kepaon Denpasar. They live in a home leased under the annual payment plan.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Pekerjaan sehari-hari Luluk adalah sebagai pedagang alat-alat listrik. Adapun alat-alat listrik yang dijualnya seperti balon lampu, neon, saklar, stop kontak, kabel dan berbagai macam peralatan listrik lainnya. Ibu berusia 33 tahun ini sudah lama menekuni profesi ini. Saat ini Luluk sangat membutuhkan modal tambahan untuk bisa menambah jenis dan jumlah alat listrik ditokonya. Bersama suaminya I Ketut Widiani, mereka tinggal di Kepaon Denpasar. Mereka tinggal di sebuah rumah kontrakan dengan sistem bayaran per tahun.

loans.use: Additional Funding for Business (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco began working as a taxi driver because the company for which he previously worked decided to downsize, so they had to lay him off. He then had difficulty finding another job due to his age. He needed to help his family get ahead, so after he received the opportunity to get a car, he decided to offer taxi cab services.

He now needs a loan of $700.00 USD, which he will repay in 6 months, in order to invest in vehicle maintenance and help his family move forward. This will be possible with your support.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Francisco se inicio como taxista debido a que la empresa en la que trabajaba realizo un reajuste de personal por lo que fue despedido de su anterior empleo, y al tener dificultades para encontrar otro empleo debido a su edad, no tenia muchas ofertas de trabajo. El tenia la necesidad de sacar adelante a su familia, posteriormente surgio la oportunidad de un carro y decidio dedicarse a prestar este servicio.

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $700 que pagara en 6 meses para invertir en el mantenimiento de su carro, y poder sacar adelante a su familia. con tu apoyo esto sera posible.

loans.use: Taxi cab maintenance

loans.name: La

texts.en:
Mr. La U., 27, and his wife, Mrs. Putheavy Ream, 26, who live in a Phnom Penh suburb, were married in 1997 and have two children, one son and one daughter, both of whom are in school.

Mr. La has been a motor taxi driver for a half year. Before starting this business, he worked in a restaurant for many years, while Mrs. Putheavy has been a garment factory worker for three years. The Tuk Tuk (a motorized rickshaw) is now more popular than the motorcycle taxi in Phnom Penh City, so Mr. La is requesting a loan of $1000 to bU. a trailer in order to offer tuk tuk transportation in his business.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer for his motor taxi.

loans.name: Surja Maiya

texts.en:
Surja Maiya M. is a resident of Thecho Village. Thecho is located in Lalitpur district. The majority of the people living in this region are Newar, the indigenous people of Nepal's Kathmandu Valley. Thecho is one of the developing villages of Lalitpur. Most of the people living in this region are engaged in seasonal farming.

Mrs. Surja Maiya M. lives in a nuclear family with her husband and one son. Mrs. Surja Maiya M. is engaged in selling chickens. Her husband and son also equally contribute their effort to that business. They sell broiler chickens in their shop.

Due to the increasing demand of their customers, Mrs. Surja Maiya M. is requesting a loan in the amount of Rs 20000.00 to buy chickens for their business.

loans.use: To buy chickens for re-sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of silver-plated jewelry to retail in her community

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine styles hair and also supplies wrappers (like sarongs). She has 2 apprentices. Josephine opens her shop 8.am-7pm. Josephine is 28 years old and married with two children. She needs the loan amount of US$ 850 to purchase styling creams and weave-ons. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy hair creams and weave-ons to re-sell

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
La señora María Elena , domiciliada en el Barrio Sportivo de la Ciudad de Itá, está casada con el señor Osvaldo, con quien tiene dos hijos: Gustavo con 30 años de edad, que se desempeña como funcionario del Hospital Nacional de Itauguá desde hace 6 años y Oscar de 19 años quien se encuentra cursando el Tercer Año de la Educación Media.

La misma se desempeña como costurera desde los 18 años de edad, dicho oficio aprendió de la madre, pero no contenta decidió estudiar en la Academia Nuestra Señora de la Asunción donde obtuvo a los 20 años de edad el Título de Corte y Confección.

El señor Osvaldo, aquejado de una enfermedad quedó desempleado, entonces María Elena pasó a ser el sostén de la familia ya que el hijo mayor ha formado su propio hogar.

Reconocida por su buen trabajo nunca le ha faltado clientela pero con el correr del tiempo su único elemento de trabajo fue desgastándose, impidiendo esto la entrega puntual de sus confecciones, es por ello que la misma ha puesto su confianza en la Fundación Paraguaya solicitando su apoyo para la adquisición de una máquina de coser nueva y así poder seguir realizando esta labor que con tanto empeño y dedicación lo hace a diario.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Elena, who lives in the district of Sportivo in the city of Itá, is married to Mr. Osvaldo, with whom she has two children. Gustavo is 30 years old and has worked as a civil servant at the National Hospital in Itauguá for 6 years. Oscar is 19 years old and is studying in his third year in secondary school.

María Elena has worked as a seamstress since the age of 18; she learned this craft from her mother. She didn’t have a certificate, so she decided to study in the Academy of Our Lady of Asunción where she earned a dressmaking degree at 20 years of age.

Mr. Osvaldo, was suffering from an illness that left him unemployed, so María Elena started supporting the family since their older son has his own home.

She is recognized for her good work and is never lacking clients. As time passed, though, her unique element of work was wearing out, preventing the timely delivery of her creations. It is because of this that she has put confidence in Fundación Paraguaya, requesting their support for the acquisition of a new sewing machine. This will allow her to continue pursuing this activity that she pursues daily with a lot of determination and dedication.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok S. is 40 years old and she lives in Kampong Svay village in Kandal Province.  She is the mother of four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others attend the local school. Mrs. Sok S. is a fish breeder. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it; thus she decided to request a loan to buy more fish and fish food. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Sao Oul, is a fisherman. She and her husband are in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more fish and fish food.

loans.name: Kofi

texts.en:
Kofi M. is 47 years old. He is married with five children. Currently all the kids are in school. He owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, evaporated milk, canned foods and drinks, assorted varieties of cooking oil, washing powder, toilet soaps, candies, biscuits etc. in the local market. He wants to use the loan to buy a bulk supply of rice, canned foods and drinks, milk, assorted spices, and washing soaps and powders, etc. to expand his business.

Kofi M. hopes to make a good income from the expanded business to enable him to provide the children with quality education. He belongs to the community group called ‘Obatanpa Trust Group’. This means 'Good Mother'. The group members guarantee a loan through their repayment pledge and assist one another to repay the loan. Kofi said he would be grateful for your support to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy rice, canned foods and drinks, milk, assorted food spices, washing soaps and powders, etc. in bulk

loans.name: Khursheedan M. Mushtaq Group

texts.en:
My name is Khursheedan and I’m 29. I have resided in a city named Pakpattan, Pakistan for the past 10 years. I completed my education till 4th standard and couldn’t study further due to low financial resources. My husband's name is M. M. and he is a fruit seller by profession with 3 years of experience. I have four kids: two sons and two daughters. None of my kids is getting an education. We all know that inflation is increasing rapidly and it’s difficult for a single person to serve his family. So from an honest feeling I help my husband by making embroidered dresses. I completed a dress in 3 days and sell it in the cloth market and earn good income for it. I used my income to pay the expenses of my house and my husband pays the bills; e.g., electricity, water and gas. Our kids admire our struggle from the core of their hearts. I am applying for a loan to buy a donkey cart so that my husband can sell the fruit easily without any walking pain.' She is a group leader of some more woman of her locality. Khairan Baji want a loan to buy fertilizer to resell. Allah Muafi Baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk selling business. Nazia Baji wants a loan to buy electric items such as televisions and fridges on installments to resell. Hamidan Baji wants a loan to buy animals (goats) for her animal selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a donkey cart for selling fruits

loans.name: Dorah

texts.en:
Dorah K. is single and has no children. She has completed an education through the junior high level. Dorah sells used clothing and artificial hair at Amoabin near Cape Coast, which she has done for about two years now. Dorah uses her income to pay the rent, utility bills, and other financial expenses. She will use the loan as additional capital to enable her to increase the sale of used clothing and artificial hair to meet the increase in demand from her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Dorah plans to reinvest back for the expansion of her trade in used clothing.

In the picture are some of the wigs on the table.

loans.use: To purchase and resell more used clothing and artificial hair

loans.name: Kosal

texts.en:
Mr. Kosal M., 33, and his wife, Mrs. Hel Phally, 29, were married in 2003 and have two children: one son and one daughter. Both of them are still young. Kosal also has a brother, who is a security guard in Phnom Penh, and a sister, who is a tailor.  Both are living with him. The family lives along National Road Number One, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Kosal has been driving a motor taxi in Phnom Penh for three years. His wife stays at home to take care of their children. Kosal is requesting his first loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorcycle for his brother to drive to work and to buy a sewing machine for his sister.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for his brother to drive to work and buy a sewing machine for his sister.

loans.name: Nike

texts.en: Nike rents out canopies, chairs, cooking pots, etc. She has been in this business for a long time. Nike is 48 years old and married with two children. She needs the loan amount of N150,000 to purchase more chairs and canopies to rent out to her customers. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more chairs and canopies

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
In the town of Tabo-o, Jimenez, lives a certain Mrs. Josephine C.. Having a mini "carenderia" (small restaurant) is really a big help for her. She is 38 years old, married, and has two children. Her husband is an employee receiving only a minimum wage.

Considering the economic crisis we are facing today, Mrs. C. works very hard in order to survive. She cooks for her carenderia & cafeteria at the same time. Fortunately, the daily food needs of her family are free because of the business.

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative is a big help to her family and business. She has obtained loans several times. Now, she applies for PHP 10,000 to buy additional bread, coffee and meat for her business. She hopes that her business will be successful and will someday expand into a restaurant selling a variety of foods.

loans.use: To buy bread, coffee and meat for her carenderia

loans.name: Fatima Argentina

texts.es: Doña Fátima es una mujer con deseos de superación, tiene una librería  que desde hace siete años administra, ella inicio con capital propio que su mama dio,  tiene 42 años de edad, reside en el barrio Monte Cristo en la ciudad de Managua. Con un hijo de 14 años de edad que estudia la secundaria, con este crédito es su sexto ciclo el cual va invertir en la compra de cuadernos, bolsos pinturas, calculadoras entre otros para surtir la librería y poder ofrecer a sus clientes una gama de productos nuevos. Sus planes es invertir más en su negocio y poder dar estudio a su hijo.
texts.en:
Fátima is a woman with a desire to get ahead. She has a bookstore which she has run for the past 7 years. She started it with her own money, which her mother had given her. She is 42 years old and lives in the Monte Cristo neighborhood in Managua. She has a 14 year old son who is in secondary school. With this loan, which is her sixth, she will buy notebooks, bags, paints, calculators and other things to stock her bookstore and to be able to offer her customers a selection of new products. Her plans are to invest more in her business and to give an education to her son.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy notebooks, bags, calculators and other products to meet the needs of her customers.

loans.name: Takku Liggey Tefess 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe  takku liggey tefess 1est une association qui regroupe des femmes  mariées qui s ‘activent de petit commerce de divers produits. Certaines d’entre elles vendent des tissus d’autre des chaussures et le troisième fait de la restauration   . Le groupe de trois(3) membres se réuni chaque semaine pour collecter  les cotisations des membres qui sont versées à une d’elle à tour de rôle .Avec le prêt elles comptent renforcer leur activité en achetant plus de marchandises.les revenus tirés de leurs activité leur permettent d’entretenir leurs enfants. Ces femmes habitent à Mbour  ville côtière située à 70 km de Dakar
texts.en:
The group Takku Liggey Tefess 1 brings together married women who are all petty traders selling various items. One sells cloth, another shoes, and the third sells cooked food. The group of three members meets once a week to collect dues from each member which are paid out to one of them in turn. With the loan, they intend to bolster their businesses by buying more merchandise. The income from their businesses permits them to support their children. These women live in Mbour, a coastal town situated 70 km from Dakar.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Genelyn L. manages a small rice field. She and her husband till a 1-hectare farm. She uses the proceeds from her harvest to feed and buy the things needed by their family. She is 38 years old and has two children. 

Genelyn is seeking a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizer and chemicals for the farm, to improve the size of her harvest. 

CEVI helps small businesses grow. CEVI provides not only loans, but also training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and chemicals for the farm

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en: Clementine N. lives in Kigali, Rwanda and has an egg business, raising chickens and selling the eggs. At 31 years old, Clementine is a widow, but has two children and two other dependents, all in their teens and twenties. For two years she has worked at her business from 5am till 8pm, earning 150,000 Rwandan francs (FRW) in monthly profits. To help her expand her business, Clementine has requested a 500,000 FRW loan from Vision Finance Company.

loans.use: Business expansion.

loans.name: Omiraw Group

texts.en:
Omiraw is the group leader of the Omiraw group. There are four members in this group. They would like to expand their businesses. They want to make a loan of 40000 Afghani. 

Omiraw wants to make a loan for her husband who has fuel selling shop. Nafesa wants to make a loan for the business of embroidery. Nazaq wants to make a loan for her husband who has taxi driver. Sharefa wants to make a loan for her husband who has general store. 

The group members are happy with this process that allows them to make loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Sim P. has been growing various crops on her own farmland since early 2005; she inherited the land from her grandparents years ago. She is 34, married, and has three children who are in primary school. To help meet her family’s needs, her husband works by playing traditional Khmer music for wedding parties. Sim P.’s husband complains that he has trouble with transportation getting to his work,  because he doesn’t own a vehicle. Because of this problem, Sim P. decided to take out a loan to buy a new motorbike for her husband, so that he can get to work.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for her husband, so he can drive to work

loans.name: Carolyn

texts.en:
Carolyn V., age 41, is from the town of Aloran. Carolyn is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Carolyn owns and operates a hog raising business in the agriculture sector. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Carolyn has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Carolyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. She wished to help improve her living situation and to increase her ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid six previous loans from PMPC.

Carolyn is now requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es:
"La Sra. Herminia Q. A., tiene como actividad  la venta de colchones de lana y polar, las cuales comercializa en su tienda ubicada en la populosa zona Eloy Salmon; esa actividad la realiza junto a su esposo, tienen tres hijos en edad escolar.
La cliente tiene antigüedad de dos años trabajando con nuestra institución, comenzó trabajando en banca de emprendimiento y en la actualidad lleva su segunda secuencia de forma individual."
texts.en:
Mrs. Herminia Q. A. sells mattresses made of wool and polar fleece which she makes in her store located in the popular Eloy Salmon district. Her husband works with her and they have three school-age children. The customer has been working with our institution for the past two years. She began by working in the beginner bank and is currently carrying her second individual loan.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to augment operational capital for mattress production

loans.name: Roida

texts.en:
Roida is a member of the Liloloa borrower group in Kihesa,Iringa. She is 44 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 2 children. Her children are 20, and 13 years old. Also she cares for other 1 dependent.

Roida has owned a charcoal business for 2 years, she works 12 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 250,000 Tanzanian shillings.


This is Roida`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to by more charcoal for sale.


With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Roida hopes to save more money ,pay school fees and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for sale

loans.name: Sabasan

texts.en:
Sabasan E. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and bread and is requesting a loan to purchase onions and Irish potatoes to sell. Sabasan is 25 years old and is married to a husband who is a driver. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her family.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase onions and Irish potatoes to sell

loans.name: Bolanle

texts.en: Bolanle is 37 years old and married with 3 children. She is in the catering business and has been in the industry for the past 9 years. She hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more baking materials. She say thank to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more baking materials

loans.name: Sabougnouman Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sabougnouman est constitué de 5 femmes, (3 mariées  et 2 veuves)  vivant toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies avec en moyenne 57 ans et 5 enfants par femme. Elles habitent toutes le quartier Bamanan kin de Markala (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des relations de voisinage et d’appartenance à une même association traditionnelle des femmes du quartier. 
Ce groupe fait le commerce du divers avec  les fruits (mangue et pastèque), du poisson,  des condiments alimentaires, des céréales du savon etc.
Elles sont à leur 5ème prêt de groupe, après avoir correctement remboursé les précédents. 
Ce nouveau prêt  sera utilisé pour acheter, 20 paniers de poisson, 10 sacs de mil, 5 sacs d’oignon et 12 cartons contenant 47 morceaux de savon chacun. 
Elles se ravitaillent en poisson au bord du fleuve Niger, en fruits, oignon et savon à la foire hebdomadaire de Diamarabougou. 
Les produits sont revendus  au comptant,  à crédit ou  en ambulant dans les quartiers de Markala et dans les foires de Diamarabougou et Sibila à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 51 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour payer la scolarité des enfants et compléter chaque jour le prix de condiments.
texts.en:
The Sabougnouman group is composed of 5 women (3 married and 2 widows) averaging 57 years of age and 5 children. They all live in extended traditional families in the Bamanan Kin neighborhood in Markala (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali) and got acquainted thorugh neighbourhood relationships and their membership in the same traditional women's local association.

This group sells various products, such as fruits (mangoes and watermelons), fish, food condiments, cereals, soap, etc. They are seeking their 5th group loan, after having repaid the previous ones without problems. This loan will be used to buy 20 baskets of fish, 10 sacks of millet, 5 sacks of onions, and 12 boxes containing 47 pieces of soap each.

They get their fish supplies from the banks of the Niger River, whereas fruits, onions and soap are purchased at the weekly fair in Diamarabougou. They resell the products for cash, on credit, or as ambulant saleswomen in Markala and in the fairs in Diamarabougou and Sibila, to a clientele comprising mostly women.

They count on turning an average monthly profit of XOF 51'000 (ca US$ 120), to be used to pay the children's scholarship and complete each day the cost of condiments.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 20 baskets of fish, 10 sacs of millet, 5 onion sacks, and 12 boxes containing 47 pieces of soap each

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr: Astou B. est une femme de 38 ans, elle est mariée et membre du Banc Villageois de MBOUSNAKH depuis 7 ans et demi. Elle a une bonne expérience avec le crédit pour l'avoir contracté à 15 fois et remboursé sans difficulté. Elle fait de l'embouche ovine, elle achète les sujets, les engraisse et les revend. Elle développe parallèlement un petit commerce d'arachide. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Astou B. is a 38-year-old woman. She is married and has been a member of Banc Villageois de MBOUSNAKH for 7½ years. She has a good loan record, having taken out a loan 15 times and repaid them without a problem. Her work involves fattening sheep. She buys them, feeds them, and then sells them. At the same time, she's developing a small peanuts business. She takes part in improving her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her investment capital

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco is 36, is married, and has two children. He has been in the courier and delivery business for over four years.

Francisco has two trucks with freight service, with which he delivers honey from a factory in the town of Piribebuy. He bought his first truck with money his wife earned while working in the U.S. where she has relatives. The second he bought with savings from his work.

Francisco will use this loan to purchase a cargo cover for one of his trucks so that he can deliver more and travel more safely with his freight covered. Francisco is a good client of Fundación Paraguaya, which is why his credit line is being extended on this, his next loan.

loans.use: To purchase a cargo cover for his truck

loans.name: Viktor

texts.en:
Viktor is married and has two children. He lives in the town of Vodyanoye, where he owns two well-equipped greenhouses in which he grows vegetables for sale. He’s been in this business for six years. He currently has 30,000 Grivnyas in working capital, and plans to spend about 15,000-20,000 of them to buy seeds and clear polyethylene film.  

Viktor is requesting a 10,000 Grivnya loan to build one more greenhouse and increase the amount of vegetables he is able to grow. Viktor’s son is actively helping him with this business, and the two work very hard to keep the business running. Viktor wants to make sure it’s a well-established and self-sustaining business before his sons inherit it from him.  

Note: In the photo, we see Viktor with his son.

loans.use: to build a new greenhouse

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia tiene 47 años y su familia esta conformada por ella y sus hijos que viven en su propia casa. Desde que era niña, creció y se formó bajo una cultura agrícola y ganadera, habiéndolo aprendido bien por sus padres, le ha servido mucho ya que ahora se dedica al cuidado de sus vacas, ovejas, así como sembrar extensos terrenos de papa, maíz, alverja, habas, entre otros, por lo que se ha convertido en su fuente principal de ingreso económico, además de su propio consumo. Sus hijos que son su orgullo, la ayudan constantemente en las labores, ya que lo que más anhela es restaurar su establo para ofrecerle un mejor cuidado a su ganado e intensificar su crianza. Esta es su onceavo crédito con MFP, y se le considera como una mujer muy activa y colaboradora dentro de su grupo comunal, además demuestra compromiso en el pago de sus deudas. Con el crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para sembrar alfalfa como forraje para sus vacas, además de comprar un toro de raza.
texts.en:
Antonia is 47 years old and her family is made up of herself and her children; they all live together in their own home. Since she was a little girl, she was raised in an agricultural and cattle raising milieu, learning her trade well from her parents. Now that she cares for her own cattle and sheep, what she learned from them as served her well. She also farms potato, corn, peas, and flat beans, among others; this has become her primary source of income as well as provided for her family's own consumption. Her children, who are her pride and joy, constantly help her with her chores. Her greatest wish is to restore her cowshed so that her cattle can have the best care in order to strengthen their growth. This is her eleventh loan with MFP. She is considered to be a very active and cooperative member of her group. Besides, she is always committed to repaying her loans on time. This funding will be used to buy sacks of natural fertilizer for alfalfa planting as well as for fodder for her cows and to buy a bull.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fodder for her cattle.

loans.name: Binta

texts.fr: Binta B. est âgée de 30, elle est célibataire sans enfant mais a la charge d'un enfant de ses parents. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de WALIDANE depuis 5 ans et y a bénéficié de 10 prêts qu'elle a bien gérés et remboursés. Elle fait de la broderie et la confection de draps de lit. Son objectif est de pouvoir faire face à tous ses besoins et d'assurer une bonne couverture sanitaire et scolaire de l'enfant qu'on lui a confié.
texts.en:
Binta B. is 30 years old, she is single and has no children, although she is taking care of one child for his parents. She has been a member of the Village Bank of Walidane for the past 5 years and has been the beneficiary of 10 loans in the past, all of which she properly managed and repaid. Binta B. makes embroidered items and bedsheets. Her goal is to be able to care for all of her needs and assure the good health and education of the child entrusted in her care.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To reinforce her business

loans.name: Renalyn's Group

texts.en: Renalyn D. is from the village of Estefania, Amulung, Cagayan. She is 26 years old and is the group leader of a ten-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Renalyn is married and has two infant children. She owns and operates a manufacturing business, primarily manufacturing and selling iron products to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month. In 2010, Renalyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This loan will be her first from ASKI. Renalyn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Patricio

texts.es:
Patricio Gómez L. es un chofer de transporte urbano desde hace 29 años donde el es concesionario y tiene su propio camión para trabajar. El es una persona responsable en su trabajo y da un buen trato a sus pasajeros. 
Para seguir dando la mejor atención, el desea darle mantenimiento a su camión para que este en muy buenas condiciones y no pueda suceder algún percance en la carretera cuando lleva pasajeros.
texts.en:
