But still, their income is not enough to sustain the needs of the family because they only earn money during the harvest season.  So, Marilou wants to avail a loan amounting to Php 6,000 to start a new business in meat vending and other kinds of products in their village.  She hopes it will be approved, and that the business will last long for the welfare of her family.

loans.use: To start a new business

loans.name: Zaher

texts.en:
Zaher A. is 30 years old, married and lives with his wife and their three children in Gaza City, Palestine. Zaher has been working as a farmer for ten years. He grows different kinds of vegetables.

Zaher approached Kiva's partner, Ryada, because he wanted to purchase more farming aids, such as herbicides, fertilizers and other necessities, in order to manage his crops appropriately. He hopes that his increased profit will allow him to better support his family and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more farming aids such as herbicides and fertilizers

loans.name: Mwamvita

texts.en:
Mwamvita has been a clothes (khanga) seller in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for four years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $60 and works at her business for 12 hours daily.

A member of the Ujamaa group loan, she is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more khanga for her resale. She is hoping to increase her profit and grow her business through this loan.

Mwamvita is 30 years old, is married, and has a five-year-old child.

loans.use: To buy more khanga for resale.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es:
Casado, tiene 47 años.

El es originario de la huasteca, donde los quesos son muy solicitados, el al llegar a mante y observa que casi no se venden mucho por ahi, decide poner su negocio de quesos y mas adelante tambien perfumes que observo que solicitaban mucho.

El pide el apoyo para un refrigerador para guardar los quesos y evitar que se echen a perder, le ha hido muy bien casi todo lo que vende es por pedidos.

Sus ganas de trabajar, lo han echo muy conocido en la zona donde vive, y tiene una gran demanda de queso, pero no tiene donde guardarlo. 

en tanto los perfumes fue un extra que tambien se le ha hido vendiendo muy bien.
texts.en:
Married, is 47 years old. He is from the Huasteca region, where cheeses are very popular. When he arrived to Mante and observed that they are not sold much there he decided to start her cheese business and in the future will also sell perfumes as they are requested a lot. He is requesting the support for a refrigerator to keep his cheeses to prevent them from going bad. It has gone well for him and almost everything that he sells is by special order. His desire to work has made him very well-known in the area where he lives. There is a great demand for cheese, but he does not have anywhere to keep it. In terms of the perfumes, it was an extra that has been selling very well.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods

loans.name: Christian

texts.en:
Christian is 34 years old. He is married and has a son who is currently in nursery school. He lives with his wife and son in a rented apartment in a farming and trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. His wife is a seamstress by profession. 

Christian is a commercial driver. He conveys goods and passengers from his community to nearby towns. He says his bus needs to be given a thorough maintenance in order to be in good working condition. He would like to obtain a loan to pursue this dream. 

Christian has been in business for eight years. He hopes to maintain his car in good condition so as to remain in business. Christian desires to improve upon his family's standard of living and to give his son a sound education.

loans.use: For bus maintenance.

loans.name: Otgonpurev

texts.en:
Otgonpuregv O. is 34 years old. He is married and is the father of two children, both of whom attend an elementary school. His family lives in a small house with one room in a "ger" (a yurt or nomadic housing tent) district in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

With his spouse, Tuvshinjargal, he has been selling firewood. He buys timber mostly at wholesale prices, cuts and bags the wood, and resells it. To expand his retail business, he aims to open a small store next to his little house on the plot of land he owns.

In the summer of 2007, he started baking bricks manually to sell. Baking a brick manually takes time and hard work. Otgonpurev intends to buy an automated brick baker. His plan is to build a store and a big house instead of the one room small house in which they now live. Otgonpurev says that "it is tough to live with four people in such a small house. I'm looking forward to having a big beautiful house with many bedrooms where my daughters can grow up for several years."

With this loan, he will buy a brick baking machine.

In the picture, Otgonpurev is sawing firewood with his spouse and one of his son.

loans.use: To buy a brick-baking machine

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Mr. T. Wilson is a carpenter. He is 45 years old and blessed with six children who are all in school. He owns a carpentry workshop in Ibanda. His experience in carpentry enables him to produce quality work attracting many customers. He is using the loan to purchase more wood to make furniture for his customers. He aspires to expand his carpentry workshop in the same location and attract even more customers.

loans.use: To purchase more wood to make furniture for his customers.

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Сухроб – опытный фармацевт. Собственный аптечный киоск находится в городе Вахдат. Свои кредиты он использует на расширение своего бизнеса. На следующий займ он хочет закупить медикаменты. Он рад сотрудничеству с нашей организацией и благодарит наших партнеров по КИВА.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. Suhrob is a skilled pharmacist. He has his own pharmacy shop in the city of Vahdat. He uses his loans for his business. His plans for the next loan include the purchase of medicine. He is happy to be in corporation with this organization and is thankful to the partners at KIVA.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Medicine

loans.name: Amani West Group

texts.en:
Demetelia is a member of the Amani West borrower group in Kinyanambo, Iringa. She is a 33-year-old woman, married, and mother of 4 children. Her children are aged 18, 15, 12, and 6 years old.

Demetelia started her own shop 8 years ago. She works 14 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 80,000 Tanzania Shillings.

This is Demetelia’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more commodities for her business. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Demetelia hopes to save money and expand her business.

Veronica, another member of the Amani West borrower group, has also requested 200,000 Tsh in order to support her own business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hog raiser.  She engaged in this business for she wanted to help her husband in providing the needs of their family and also to maintain her business and somehow uplift their poor living situation.  Since she do not have enough capital to support the daily feeds supply of her hogs, she is now asking for financial assistance from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP7, 000 as additional capital. Aside from raising hogs, Elizabeth is also into retailing of bagoong” (shrimp paste) which she purchases from the nearest market and sell in their village.  She found out that this business is more productive and beneficial for her family.  

She is 41 years old and they are living in the simple village of Binarzang Quirino, Isabela. They have four children;two are studying while the other two chose to stopped and work as housemaid to help them earn a living. 

Elizabeth is hoping to help all her children through her business.  She prays for all of them to always be in good health.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en: Susanna is 61 years old and married with five adult children, all of whom are fully independent. Despite her age, Susanna works very hard because she always wants to look healthy and make an income to support her elderly husband, who is a pensioner. For the past four years Susanna has been selling home products, such as cooking utensils, plastic bowls, buckets and plates, at the community market where she lives. She wants to use her loan to buy an increased stock of plastic items and kitchen sets. She would be very grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy an increased stock of plastic items and kitchen sets

loans.name: We Dee Woman Group

texts.en:
This is Marie K., Aminata D. and Serrah K.. They named their group We Dee Woman.  They are local entrepreneurs in Waterloo, twenty miles from Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are getting from SMT, a partner of Shine on Sierra Leone in Waterloo. They are requesting a loan of Le 500,000 for each. This loan can significantly impact the lives of these people. They will be able to use the proceeds to pay for their children’s school fees.  They will also be able to feed and clothe themselves and their children with the income generated from the loan. 

Marie K. (right) is the leader of the group. Marie is forty-two years of age and was born in Waterloo. She is married to a businessman and they have four children. Their first child is in college, the other has just sat to the West Africa Senior Secondary Schools Examinations, and the others are in Junior Secondary School I and II. Marie sells market food since a child. With this loan, she will be able to add more goods into her stall.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El señor Miguel A. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Sopocachi, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa.
El señor Miguel es rentista del magisterio, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la refacción de pisos en dos habitaciones  que por el pasar del tiempo se deterioraron.
Esta es la segunda vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Miguel A. and his wife live in their own house in the Sopocachi neighborhood on the west side of La Paz. Miguel is retired and supports his family with his pension. This loan will be used to repair the floors in two bedrooms in his house, which have deteriorated over time.

This is the second time Miguel has applied for a loan. He has been rated favorably by the socioeconomic analysis of the lender, so he qualifies for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair of floors in two bedrooms of his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more equipment for her business

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es: Cesar Augusto de 36 años de edad es casado, tiene 2 niños, de 14 y 4 años respectivamente, labora para la Alcaldia de Juigalpa como colector de ingresos desde hace 11 años.  Esta solicitando su 2do credito y espera seguir siendo beneficiado con el Fondo Kiva, pues desea seguir mejorando su casa de habitacion construyendo un pequeño porche, levantar un muro y hacer las gradas, poco a poco a ido haciendo su casita mas comoda para sus hijos, su esposa se encarga del cuido de la casa y de los niños. El mayor sueño de Cesar es lograr tener su casa con las condiciones basicas para que sus hijos crezcan en ambiente comodo, ademas que estos estudien y sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Cesar Augusto is 36 years old, married, and has 2 children, ages 14 and 4 respectively. He has been working for the town of Juigalpa as a tax collector for 11 years. Cesar is requesting his 2nd loan and hopes to continue as a Kiva beneficiary. He wants to continue his home improvements by building a small porch, erect a wall, and install steps. Gradually he has been making his home more comfortable for his children. His wife is in charge of looking after the children and maintaining the home.

Cesar dreams of having a home with the basic necessities so that his children can grow up in a comfortable environment. He also wants them to continue their studies and become good people.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a small porch, erect a wall, and install steps

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia I. is from the village of Baybay, Panalsalan, in Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old. Amalia is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Amalia owns & operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fish in the local community. Amalia has been running her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Amalia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Amalia is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Amalia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish for sell

loans.name: Jenny Agustina

texts.es:
La señora Jenny F., es madre de familia de tres hermosos hijos dos ya que trabajan y uno estudia la secundaria, su trabajo es maestra de secundaria que ha ejercido durante veinte seis años, junto con su esposo ya que también el trabaja como docente. Estudio en el colegio Normal para sacar su diploma y poder cumplir con su requisito. Gracias a Dios y a su trabajo han logrado poder hacer su casa toda de concreto para mejor seguridad. Poco a podo han comprado los muebles, ropero, pero a un su casa es de suelo, lo cual ella desea poder poner piso ya que sus muebles se están fregando, en la mera tierra es por eso ve la necesidad de comprar piso para una mejor higiene como para poder gozar de una mejoras mas, para después comenzar a repellar y a pintar su casa todo esto solo  lo puede hacer a largo plazo ya que toda esta caro pero si con una esperanza a futuro de poder arreglar su casa bonita
Con el crédito anterior logro poner toda la electricidad a su casa con su medidor para una mejor distribución de energía como mejor seguridad. Muy contenta de poder lograr sus planes como madre de familia a través del los prestamos.
texts.en:
Sra. Jenny F. is the mother of three beautiful children. Two of them work while the other one is a high school student. Jenny has been teaching at the high school level for twenty years. She works with her husband, who is also a teacher. Jenny studied at a teacher’s college to earn her degree and was able to complete all of her requirements.

Thanks to God, her work has allowed her to build a concrete house to provide her family with better security. Over time she has purchased furniture and installed a closet, but her house has a dirt floor. She wants to install flooring because right now she has to constantly clean her furniture. A proper floor will also provide better hygiene and help her family enjoy additional improvements. Afterwards she will be able to begin plastering and painting her house, which can be completed over the long term. All of these improvements are expensive, but she hopes they will make her house more beautiful.

With her previous loan, Jenny was able to equip her house for electricity by installing a meter for better distribution of energy. This provided her family with more secure conditions. She is very happy that she can use these loans to fulfill her plans as a mother.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to install a floor

loans.name: Tamensu Development Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the 'Tamensu Development' group from the town of Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. They are petty traders who have formed themselves into a group in order to apply for a loan from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of a loan, they will be able to expand their businesses both in size and quality. Consequently, their living conditions will improve so that they can better support themselves and their school-going children.

Ramatu C. on the right in the photo is the leader of this group. Ramatu was born in Kafe, near Magburaka about forty-five years ago. She is married to a motor-bike driver and they have three children who are attending secondary and primary schools respectively.

Ramatu sells firewood and has been in this business for nearly ten years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy a truck full of firewood and pay transportation costs to carry the wood to her house.

loans.use: Buy a truck full of firewood and pay transportation costs

loans.name: Davaajav

texts.en: T. Davaajav is a 46-year-old single mother who lives with her two sons in the province of Arkhangai in central Mongolia. They live together in a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent called a "ger". Her oldest son is 17 years old and is a university student. Her youngest is 14 years old and attends a local secondary school. Davaajav operates a dairy product trading business out of a rented stall at the local market in her town. She started her business in 2000 with capital of 50,000 tugrugs (~35 USD) and has built a stable operation over the years. She has worked hard to grow her business and has been able to save money for her children's education. Today her working capital exceeds 300,000 tugrugs (~210 USD). Davaajav is optimistic about the future and has many plans for her business. She says, "With my business profits I hope to buy a house in the future." She is requesting a 300,000 tugrug (~210 USD) loan to purchase a variety of dairy products to sell in her business.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of dairy products to sell.

loans.name: Alyeris Maria

texts.es: La joven Alyeris de 26 años de edad, habita junto con sus padres, es una joven de iniciativa que ha logrado tener su propio negocio en venta de ropa, cosméticos y prenda de plata y oro laminado. Todo esto con el propósito de tener su propio dinero y no depender solo de sus padres, lleva  siete años en las ventas, en donde ha hecho mucha clientela que le hacen encargo, vende al contado y al crédito. Lo único es que muchos clientes abecés le atrasan el pago y eso le perjudica por que trabaja con poco capital. La mercancía la tiene en su cuarto el cual se le hace incomodo. Su necesidad es poder hacer un local pequeño en donde pueda tener su propia venta. Lo cual comprara materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro, zinc, perlines y comenzar la obra. Gracias a estos préstamos ha logrado mantener su venta de prendas el cual inicio con el apoyo de Afodenic y es su once avo crédito y esta logrando cada día mejoras en su vida.
texts.en:
Alyeris is 26 years old and lives with her parents. This young woman took the initiative to start her own business selling clothing, cosmetics, and gold and silver laminated garments. Alyeris started this business so that she could earn her own money and not become dependent on her parents. She has been making sales for seven years. Her customers place their orders with her and she accepts payments by cash or on credit. The only problem is that many of her customers delay their payments, which hurts her because she is left with little available capital.

Alyeris stores her merchandise in her room, which makes it uncomfortable. She needs to have a location from where she can sell her products. For this reason, Alyeris will purchase materials such as stone, sand, cement, iron, zinc, and crossbeams so that she can begin construction. Thanks to her previous loans, she has been able to maintain the sales business that she started. With the support of AFODENIC, Alyeris will receive her eleventh loan which will help her continue making improvements in her life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build a location where she can sell her merchandise

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en:
Ethel M. is from the village of D'Ban, Calamba, Misamis Occidental.  She is 41 years old, married, and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Ethel owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products in the local community. Ethel has been engaged in her business for 6 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Ethel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ethel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Ethel is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Ethel from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Mrs. Ouk Vorn Village Bank Group

texts.en: A village bank loan consists of eight people who all live in Kandal village in Takeo province. The members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Ouk V. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members of the village bank loan. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn for a living. Her husband, Mr. Keo Bin Tha, is a construction worker who makes a small income to support their living conditions. Since Mrs. Ouk V. and her family live in an old house, Mrs. Ouk V. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to build a new house.  She will use the rest of the loan to buy wire fencing to protect the livestock from stray animals. Mrs. Ouk V. is a mother of two children who are both too young to work or study.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to build a new house and to protect the livestock

loans.name: Merian

texts.en:
30-year-old Merian is married to Richard and they have two children. Her oldest child is aged 6. She wants her children to have a proper education so she works hard to be able to save this early.

Merian is involved in rice farming and currently owns a hectare (2.5 acres) of rice field. She hopes to grow her business to earn more and also to improve her family’s living conditions.

Merian applied to CEVI for a loan of Php 8,000. This loan will be used to supply her farm inputs like seed, fertilizer and other supplies.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel tiene 63 años, es divorciada hace 23 años, pero de aquel matrimonio, tuvo tres hijos, adultos e independientes, por el que solo vive con su hija y su esposo en su casa, ubicado en un barrio al sur de Lima. Se dedica al negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad, establecimiento que se encuentra en el primer piso de su casa, por lo que ya lleva dieciséis años en este negocio. Desde entonces atiende con mucha amabilidad a cada uno de sus clientes, ya que sin ellos, no hubiera crecido su bodega y no hubiera percibido mas rentas. Es así que abre su tienda a las 6:00am de la mañana hasta altas horas de la noche, y cuando  se va a comprar más mercadería, su hija se encarga de la venta de bebidas, por lo que Isabel regresa prontamente a su casa, ya que no le gusta mantener cerrado su negocio.  Su mayor anhelo es que su bodega esté repleta de varios productos,  asimismo quiere arreglar las fisuras de las paredes de su casa, provocado por un  movimiento sísmico. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, además como líder de su grupo comunal, incentivará a todas sus compañeras que sean también puntuales en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de diversos productos para abastecer su bodega, asimismo desea derivar parte del crédito en la compra de materiales de construcción para arreglar su casa.
texts.en:
Isabel is 63 years old and has been divorced for 23 years, but from that marriage she has 3 children who are independent adults. She lives alone with her daughter and new husband in her own home in a neighborhood in the south of Lima. She runs her own business selling groceries and staples in a store built in the first floor of her house. She has run this business for 16 years. Since then she has attended to her every one of her customers with a lot of friendliness because without them she would not have been able to grow her inventory and her profits. For this reason she opens her store at 6am until late at night. When she leaves to buy merchandise, her daughter is in charge of selling beverages. She always hurries home because they do not like to leave the business closed. Her greatest wish is to have her warehouse full of various products. She also would like to fix the cracks in the wall of her house that were caused by an earthquake. This is her 6th loan cycle with MFP and she agrees to pay her account punctually. As leader of the group, she will also encourage all of her colleagues to be punctual with their payments as well. She is asking for a loan to buy various products to stock her warehouse and to buy construction materials to fix her house.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy products to stock her warehouse

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 43 years old and married with two children. He is a self-employed professional veterinarian.  He has been in this business for 11 years and his customers are livestock farmers. He also rears cattle for beef to earn extra income. His wife is also a farmer and together they rear cattle to earn enough money to support their family.   

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has saved his money in his group named Gathaithi Tuinuane, which enables him to access loans. He has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings from Faulu Kenya to add stock of veterinary drugs and to buy a motorbike and a heifer. He hopes to increase his turnover after buying a motorbike since he can then reach more customers.

loans.use: To buy veterinary drugs, a motorbike and a heifer

loans.name: Segundo Alberto

texts.es:
El  Señor. SEGUNDO ALBERTO S., Labora como Inspector de Salud en el Mercado Oriental de Managua.
El tiene cinco hijos a su cargo, y   tres  se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado siete  créditos con CEPRODEL durante siete años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los siete créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc, perlines y clavos para el techo de su casa de habitación ya que este se encuentran en mal estado. 
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
El Señor. SEGUNDO ALBERTO S., Labora como Inspector de Salud en el Mercado Oriental de Managua. El tiene cinco hijos a su cargo, y tres se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado siete créditos con CEPRODEL durante siete años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los siete créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL, el es un cliente excelente. El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc, perlines y clavos para el techo de su casa de habitación ya que este se encuentran en mal estado. Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: MEJORAS DE VIVIENDA Y AMPLIACION

loans.name: Joy Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Akua is a 47-year-old woman who describes herself as trustworthy.  She is married to a cocoa farmer and has 6 children between the ages of 9 and 25 years old.  Akua and her husband hope to provide their children with a good education and build a home for their family. For the past 25 years, Akua has operated a business selling vegetables and fruit.  Akua also manufactures local soap for washing clothes.  She will use the loan to purchase more vegetables and fruit such as tomatoes, garden eggs (or eggplant), and also buy more ingredients for her soap-making business.
 
Akua is currently the leader of the group named 'Joy Trust Bank Group'.  She believes she was elected as the group leader because she is a good organizer.  There are 9 members in this group.  The other members include 'kenkey' food processors, soap manufacturers, and maize traders.  'Kenkey' is a local dish prepared from maize, cooked and eaten with pepper sauce and fish. They plan to use the loan to buy food ingredients and other stock to grow their business and be able to adequately support their families.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and fruits in bulk.

loans.name: Rosette

texts.fr: Née en 1974 à Sotchanhouè (Ganvié-Bénin), H. Rosette est mariée à DOHOU Soulé, un chauffeur. Rosette est mère de trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Rosette vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants à Ekpè III, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, depuis cinq ans environs. Rosette vient en aide à son mari et assure avec lui, les différentes charges de la famille, grâce au revenu que lui apporte son activité. Rosette n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de sept ans que Rosette s’est mise à vendre divers produits (sucre, farine de manioc, insecticides, boîtes d’allumettes, charbon de bois, etc.) à son domicile à Ekpè. Rosette achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et aussi au marché d’Ikpinlè au Bénin. C’est la première fois que Rosette sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé, en vue de renforcer son capital et d’augmenter le stock de ses produits.
texts.en:
Born in 1974 in Sotchanhoué (Ganvié-Bénin), Rosette H. is married to Soulé DOHOU, a driver. Rosette is mother to three children, not all of whom are at school. Rosette has been living with her husband and children in Ekpé III in the municipality of Sèmè-Podji for around five years. She helps her husband to cover the various household expenses from the income she earns from her business. Rosette did not got to school. Almost seven years ago she started selling various products (sugar, cassava flour, insecticides, boxes of matches, charcoal etc.) from her home in Ekpè. Rosette buys her products at Dantokpa, Benin's international market, and also at the market in Ikpinlè in Benin. It is the first time that she has asked for financial support from ALIDé, so that she can strengthen her capital and increase her stock.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Achat de divers produits (sucre, farine de manioc, allumettes, charbon de bois, etc.) Purchase of various products (sugar, cassava flour, matches, charcoal etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy rocks, crushing process equipment such as diggers, shovels and used tires, and to pay workers

loans.name: Mak

texts.en: Mr. Mak N. is 36 years old and lives in Sam Raong village in Takeo Province where he and his wife, Mrs. Sy Nget, are farmers who cultivate rice for a living on a plot of land they own.  Mak is also cow middleman and is now requesting a loan to buy a cow to support his business. This couple has two children, both students in the local school. Mak's wife is shown in the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy a cow for his business

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 47 years old. She is a widowed mother of 8 children between the ages of 10 and 24. Six of the children are currently attending school. She has been farming for 20 years in the outskirts of Kitale town in Western Kenya. Her main product is milk, maize and beans which she sells locally. She also earns income from her rental houses in the same area.

Jane has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of KES.41,600 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that with this loan, she will be able to acquire another asset and meet the basic needs of the family with the extra income from the sale of milk.

In future, she hopes to acquire a good dairy cow that will increase the production of milk and earn her more income. She is grateful to Juhudi for increasing her sources of income generating activities.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes M. is from the village of Allinguigan 3rd. She is 47 years old. Mercedes is married and has 4 school-age children. To make a living, Mercedes owns & operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from making & selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. Mercedes has been engaged in her business for over 29 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mercedes joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercedes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. Mercedes is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Mercedes from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make additional furniture

loans.name: Aliou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Aliou S. est un yoffois  de 48 ans qui habite a Dagoudane. Il est marié sans enfant.
Pour ne pas rester inactif monsieur S. a choisi l’activité de mareyeur pour gagner sa vie. Depuis plus de 20 ans il exerce cette activité qui l’intéresse  par son aspect lucratif. La particularité de monsieur S. par rapport a d’autres mareyeurs est qu’il a acquit une  clientèle fidèle, composée d’usines de la place a qui il fournit régulièrement  du poisson. Il est sociétaire  de la caisse de Yoff depuis janvier 2010. Il sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs destiné à renforcer son fond de roulement afin d’accroitre la rentabilité de son activité dans l’espoir de mettre sur pied a  l’avenir une grande usine de mareyage.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maguette Gbaguidi, 41, lives in the Parcelles Assainies, a suburb of Dakar, not far from the village of Yoff. She is married and the mother of three children between 8 and 16 years of age. After leaving secretarial and office management school, Mrs. Gbaguidi has been working as a secretary in a school located in the Parcelles Assainies. She enjoys managing pupils and their paperwork. Besides that, however, she sells Alovera products. She is a member of the Yoff branch and is borrowing 500,000 francs to buy Alovera products for resale. These products are expensive and her salary does not permit her to acquire enough products to develop her business. This loan will thus allow her to increase her profit and improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: renforcement fond de roulement

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel S. is 29 years of age and is happily married to Jerald S., who is a security guard. The couple was blessed with three children whose ages range from two to eight years old. Two of her kids are in school and one kid is a two year old baby.  They are accumulating bigger amounts of expenses each year. Through a business she has been growing since Maricel had her own family until the present, she has been able to support the education of her children. 

Maricel's fattening (raising pigs in four months and selling after that) business started to grow when she had availed herself of a loan after she became a member of ASHI. 

Because of the success she found in her business, the loan she applied for will be used to purchase more piglets to raise. She hopes that her business will prosper and that she can have the ability to start up another business supported by the profit from her hog raising so that she can employ some of the members of her family, especially her extended relations in the village.

Her long term goals are to have a full-fledged pig farm business, invest in her home, send her children to school until they complete college, and embark on another venture - a sari-sari store. “Sari” is a native word for variety. Such stores are convenient for people in the village who live far from the market place.

loans.use: to purchase more piglets to raise.

loans.name: Tep's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of five people who live in Kampong Pou village, Kandal province. Mrs. Tep Pich, born in 1962 and married, is the group leader who was selected by all the members. The members of this group will each use their portion of the loan to support their different purposes. 
 
Mrs. Tep Pich and her husband, Mr. Nou Nim, are fishermen who are able to earn a small income by selling fish to support the family. She will use the loan from AMK to buy fishing supplies. This couple has five children: Three are laborers and another is a fisherman while the fifth is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fishing supplies

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary K. M. is 42 years old and lives in the town of Masindi in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is divorced and has 3 children. All of her children are currently in school. Mary has a business of selling household items, which she has had for over 10 years. She owns a 30 acre sugar cane plantation.  

To help expand her business, Mary has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase bigger saucepans. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Mary hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, Mary hopes to own a bigger supermarket.

loans.use: To buy bigger saucepans.

loans.name: Samuel Wambugu

texts.en:
Samuel has practiced farming in Olkalou since 1993. He is 42 years old, married to Hannah Njoki, and they have two children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He repaid his previous loan well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to harvest and market the maize from his farm.

In future, Samuel hopes to build rental houses and this will increase his income.

loans.use: To harvest and market the maize he planted

loans.name: Samina's Group

texts.en:
Samina is a hardworking lady. She stitches footballs to financially support her family. She receives the orders from football manufacturing factories. Those factories provide her with raw materials and she provides them with the finished product. In this way, she generates income for her family. She lives with her family in Gujranwala, which is a well known industrial city of Pakistan. Her house is located in the area named Veniawala. She is the mother of two sons, neither of whom are of school going age.

She is married to Z. A. who has a welding shop. He welds iron items on order. His shop is in the market and making him a reasonable income every month. He has been doing this business for over twenty years. 

Samina has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy another welding machine which will help him to work more efficiently and in a better way. She is hopeful that through this investment her husband’s business will definitely grow. 
 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. In previous loan years, she has proved herself as a responsible client who always paid her installments on time and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy another welding machine for welding business

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao S., 40, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. S. sells beans, earning an income of about USD 3 per day. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Two of her children are employed at the factories, earning an income of USD 3 each per day to help cover the family expenses. 

S. has to spend USD 20 on food, USD 18 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 20 on other necessary expenses every month.  S. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase food to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy food to resell

loans.name: Griselda

texts.es:
Griselda, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, tiene 32 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de mariscos y venta de tortillas, el negocio de las tortillas lo tiene en el mercado municipal de El Transito, ella posee casa propia.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de mariscos y maíz, para realizar sus ventas, con este préstamo ella contara con lo necesario para ofrecer a los clientes tanto mariscos como las tortillas.
Su aspiración es fortalecer el negocio y mejorar sus utilidades para acceder a mejoren condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Griselda lives in El Transito, in San Miguel department.  She is 32 years old and sells seafood and tortillas.  Her tortilla business is in El Transito town market.  She owns her own home.

Griselda is requesting a loan to buy seafood and corn so that she can sell her products.  Through this loan she will have all she needs to offer her customers both seafood and tortillas.  Her ambition is to strengthen her business and improve her profits so that she can improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy corn to make her tortillas and to buy seafood

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
La señora Rocio A. tiene 25 años de edad, está casada con el señor Juan Duarte quien tiene 43 años de edad, ambos de la ciudad de Caacupé, distante a unos 55 kilómetros de la ciudad capital (Asunción). La pareja tienen un hijo de 1 año.
 La señora Rocío vive en la compañía Y´aka Ro´ysa de la ciudad de caacupé. En su domicilio cuentan con una despensa desde hace 3 años.
 Por más que la señora y su marido poseen buen movimiento en su negocio se ven necesitados de aumentar sus ventas ofreciendo a sus clientes la mayor variedad de productos para que se sientan atraídos para realizar las compras. Solicita el crédito para la compra mercaderías de consumo de primera necesidad para cargar en su despensa y  para poder satisfacer la demanda durante estas fiestas navideñas.
 Agradece a la fundación paraguaya el apoyo obtenido para su actividad  y mediante ello su negocio ve en progreso.
texts.en:
Rocío A. is twenty-five, and married to Juan Duarte, who is forty-three.  They live in the city of Caacupé, some fifty-five kilometers from the capital city of Asunción.  They have a one-year-old child together.

They live in the Yaka Roysa compañia [rural areas on the outskirts of Paraguayan cities]  in Caacupé .  They've run a pantry in their house for the past three years.  

Inasmuch as Roció and her husband have made a lot of progress with their business, they need to increase sales by offering the widest variety of products in order to attract customers.  Rocío is seeking a loan to buy merchandise, including basic necessities, for her pantry, so she can satisfy demand during the Christmas holidays.

Rocío appreciates Fundación Paraguaya for supporting her business, which is progressing through the organization's help.

loans.use: To buy merchandise, including drinks, canned goods, sausages, etc.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro, de 58 años, está casado con Olivia, de 60 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos, pero viven solos su casa propia, ubicada en la ciudad de La Merced. Todas las mañanas desde hace 22 años, el restaurante del señor Pedro; ubicado en un lugar céntrico, abre sus puertas para deleitarnos con los ricos platos criollos y típicos del lugar, pues según afirma, la dedicación por sus hijos lo motivó a salir adelante. Ahora él está orgulloso de verlos salir adelante y ser independientes, por todo ello está planeando invertir con su esposa Olivia, en el negocio de arrendamiento de cuartos; con ello espera seguir trabajando, para mantenerse activo y vivir por muchos años, en compañía de sus hijos y nietos. Esté es el noveno crédito con MFP, y como secretario de su banco comunal, es una persona responsable y muy cumplida. De obtener el crédito solicitado, lo invertirá en la construcción de cuartos para implementar su casa en la ciudad de Pichanaki (selva central peruana), donde planea dedicarse al negocio inmobiliario.
texts.en:
Pedro is 58 years old and married to 60 year-old Olivia.  They have 2 children but live alone in their own home which is located in the city of La Merced.  Every morning for the past 22 years, Pedro's restaurant, which is in a central location, opens its doors to delight its customers with the rich creole dishes which are traditional in this area.  Pedro tells us that it was his children who motivated him to get ahead.  Now he is proud to see them getting ahead and being independent.  

Pedro is planning to invest, with his wife Olivia, in the business of renting out rooms.  He hopes that this way he will keep working, keep active and live for many years in the company of his children and grandchildren.

This is Pedro's ninth loan with MFP and, as secretary of his community bank, he is a responsible and very punctual person.  He will invest this loan in building rooms to set up his house in the town of Pichanaki (central Peruvian jungle) where he plans to work in the real estate business.

loans.use: To build more rooms so that he can rent them out

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Benedicta; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de comida, ella vende en forma ambulatoria, ella prepara diferentes platos de comida, ella trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de comida. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, carnes y verduras.                        

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "Madres Trabajadoras" ["Hard-working Mothers"] communal bank. The bank is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Mrs. Benedicta is 40, lives with her partner and has four children. She divides her time between her daily chores and her business selling food. She sells on the street. She prepares different dishes and works from 7:00 am to 6:00 pm. She wants to expand and improve her food sales business. She is requesting this loan to purchase products for cooking, such as rice, meats and vegetables.

She is happy to have this loan and promises to honour the payments of her quotas.

loans.use: She is requesting this loan to buy products for cooking, such as rice, meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Phin

texts.en:
Mrs. Phin P., who lives in Prey Melong Khang Cheung village in Takeo province, was born in 1958. She and her husband, Mr. Sang Suon, are farmers who own a small piece of land where they grow rice to sell to support their family. She also sells sugar cane and potatoes door-to-door.

Since her business is getting on well, she wants to expand. So, Mrs. Phin P. is asking for a loan to buy more sugar cane and potatoes to resell. She is a mother of four children, two of whom are employed in garment factories, and the others attend the local public school. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy more sugar cane and potatoes.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther, de 50 años de edad, natural del distrito de Anco, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora; esta casada con Alejandro de 45 años y tienen 06 hijos; juntos viven en su propia casa en la comunidad de Cuculipampa caserío del distrito de Samugari. Esther y su esposo Alejandro, son el sostén de sus hijos; ambos son campesinos y se apoyan mutuamente en las labores del campo. Labra la tierra durante 27 años, tiene una parcela, espacio que ha cultivado árboles maderables, cacao y café; productos oriundos de la zona selvática del Valle Río Apurimac. En tiempos de cosecha necesitan el apoyo de la mano ajena, por ello tiene que contratar jornaleros para avanzar con las extracciones de los frutos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta la ciudad de san francisco; lugar donde le ofrecen mejores precios por sus granos de cacao, café y por cada pie de madera.  En adelante desea comprar nuevas tierras y sembrar árboles maderables como: tornillo, caoba y cedro; pues tiene el objetivo de algún día heredarlos a sus hijos. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, siente que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo y esta dispuesta a cumplir puntualmente con sus cronogramas de pagos. Agradece a la institución Prisma por concederle el préstamo. Con los  2,500 nuevos soles solicitados,  contratará peones para aserrar madera.
texts.en:
Esther, 50, is from Anco district originally.  She is a very cheerful, hard working woman.  She’s married to Alejandro, 45, and they have six children.  They live together in their own house in the community of Cuculipampa in Samugari district.  Esther and her husband, Alejandro, are the source of support for their children.  They are both farmers who support each other in the field chores.

She has tilled the soil for 27 years.  She has a parcel of land where she has grown hardwood trees, cocoa beans and coffee, products that are typical of the Apurimac River Valley.  During harvest time she needs extra hands to help so she must hire day laborers to get ahead with the harvesting.

What she enjoys the most about her work is harvesting because that’s when she sees the long months of hard work rewarded in the quality of her fruits.  She considers transporting her crops from her field to the city of San Francisco, where the best prices are available for her cocoa beans, coffee and for each foot of lumber, to be the most difficult part.

Later on she’d like to buy more land and plant other hardwood trees like: mahogany, cedar and tornillo (tropical wood similar to elm) because her objective is to leave it to her children some day.

This is her first loan with MFP.  She feels this contribution will help her work’s progress very much and she is prepared to repay on time.  She is grateful to Prisma for granting the loan.  She will use the requested 2500 new soles to hire laborers to saw wood.

loans.use: To hire laborers to saw wood.

loans.name: Arpine

texts.en:
Arpine P., 23, lives in Tsaghkunk village, an area of Sevan, with her husband, her two children, aged two and four, and her parents-in-law. She and her family have been running an animal breeding and land cultivation business since 2007. They raise cows, sheep and horses on their farm and grow oats to use as fodder for the animals.

Arpine is asking for a 500,000 AMD loan to buy oat seeds and fodder for her farm animals. This is her second loan from Nor Horizon.

loans.use: To buy oat seeds and fodder for her farm animals.

loans.name: Consejo

texts.en:
Consejo T. is from the village of Palomoc, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay. She is 50 years old. Consejo is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Consejo owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Consejo has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Consejo joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Consejo is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Consejo from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Ainagul's Group

texts.en:
Ainagul M. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Tup, a nice village in the Isykul region. She is 56 and married. Together with her husband, she has raised two sons and a daughter. All the children are married, and, under the Kyrgyz tradition, the younger son lives with his parents. In order to earn money, the family breeds poultry and cultivates agricultural products. Selling poultry, they earn 3,000 soms per month. With the money received from the loan, Ainagul wants to purchase 600 kilograms of wheat seeds and some fuel for the sowing process. In the future, she wants to increase her quantity of poultry and get a good harvest. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line—People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (being environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team—Supporters of Kyrgyzstan—at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman with four school-going children. They live in a house that they rent; it has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. For the past three years, she has operated a retail shop, selling household goods, sugar, corn flour, wheat flour, rice, and tea leaves.

Grace has been able to educate her children and provide for their basic needs from her profits. She faces a major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. She dreams of establishing more businesses in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, corn flour and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to gain access to loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, corn flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Los Palmares 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
This group is named Los Palmares 4 & 5 (The palms) and it is located in Santo Domingo, in a community north of Main city. Melania and the 9 other members are taking loans for their businesses.

Melania requires a loan to buy fabrics and costume items to make blankets, bedding sets and t-shirts. This is Melania´s first loan with Esperanza International. She will take a step toward improving her business by investing this loan to increase her services and sales. 

She has had her business for 1 year. She lives in a simple home with her 2 children and her long-term partner. Her most difficult challenges were to raise her children after she became single (got divorced from her children's father) and didn't have a husband to help her with the needs in her house, so she had to start working for income and to take care of her children.

She says that her favorite thing is to take care of her children and to spend time with them at their home. Melania and her group are thankful for your support!

loans.use: to buy fabric and other costume items for blankets and bedding sets.

loans.name: Ramzana's Group

texts.en:
Ramzana is a housewife who stays at home and does her household responsibilities. Her husband sells milk from his shop, which is located in the market. Ramzana is 33 years old and a mother of three children. Two of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. Ramzana wants to send her younger daughter to school. She is 10 years old, but Ramzana doesn’t have enough financial resources. 

She wants to help her husband improve his business so she has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah. With the loan, her husband will purchase milk in larger quantity, which will help him increase his sales and improve his income. He has been operating this business for the past 10 years and it is going reasonably well for him. Ramzana hopes that after the loan, it will further improve and she will be able to send her younger daughter to school. 

She lives in a city called Arifwala, which is located in Punjab, Pakistan and known for its dairy industry. Her house contains three rooms and she moved here 10 years ago.

loans.use: To buy milk to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase lubricant, new tires, and used tires.

loans.name: Pedro Jorge

texts.es:
Pedro Jorge tiene 41 años, es soltero vive con la esposa y con los hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama UNIDOS VENCEREMOS,	 se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto La América, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Pedro se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace mucho tiempo. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos y la variación del clima. Su sueño es comprar un carro.

Le gusta ver películas y descansar.
texts.en:
Pedro Jorge is 41 years old, single, and lives with his wife and children.  He lives in Ventajas canton, in Los Ríos canton.

This community bank is called 'Unidos Venceremos' (Together We Shall Overcome) and it is located in La América, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and pigeon peas.

Pedro is a farmer who has been growing crops, especially corn and rice, for a long time.  He makes his purchases in Ventanas each month and makes his sales in the market in the same town.

Pedro is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  He faces challenges in his work such as pest infestations, crop diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to buy a car.

Pedro enjoys watching movies and resting.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es: La señora Guadalupe es una mujer muy trabajadora que a pesar de su edad no le impide seguir adelante por ella misma. Desde hace 7 años cuenta con su negocio de la venta de ropa usada que ofrece enfrente de un centro comercial muy conocido de la ciudad donde recurre variedad de clientes. En el local que tiene ofrece variedad de ropa, zapatos, bolsas, muñecos de peluche todo para el gusto de cada persona. Guadalupe solicita el apoyo para comprar mercancía para el negocio para tener mayor variedad y seguir generando mayores ganancias.
texts.en: Guadalupe is a very hardworking woman who in spite of her age is not prevented from getting ahead for herself. For 7 years she has had a business selling used clothing. She sells from a market that is very well-known in the city and where lots of customers come. She sells a variety of clothing, shoes, bags, stuffed toys, something for all tastes. Guadalupe is requesting the loan to buy merchandise for her business so she can have a larger variety and continue to generate improved earnings.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es: Pedro Pablo es caficultor, tiene 50 años de edad, es casado, tiene nueve hijos y junto a ellos y su esposa reside en la Comunidad de Rio Blanco. El es un señor muy amable y tiene un gran sentido del humor. Desde hace 18 años trabaja con el cultivo de café y lo aprendió de su padre ya que desde muy pequeño lo ayudaba en la finca. Actualmente los hijos de Don Pedro lo ayudan con el trabajo y lo hacen desde las 6:00 am hasta las 3:00 pm. Algunas de las dificultades que ha enfrentado es la falta de recursos economicos para combatir las plagas que atacan las plantas. Este es su primer prestamo y lo utilizará para la resiembra y necesita comprar algunos insumos agricolas y tambien abono. Don Pedro esta seguro que con el apoyo del prestamo la condicion de su cultivo mejorará y tambien la de su familia. Su sueño es comprar algunas manzanas mas de tierra para asi ampliar su negocio y ser uno de lo mas grandes caficultores de la region. Espera poder cumplir puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas, para que de esta manera la institucion lo siga apoyando con prestamos con montos mayores.
texts.en:
Pedro Pablo is a coffee farmer.  He is 50 years old, married, and has nine children.  He lives together with his wife and children in Rio Blanco community.  Pedro is a very kind man and has a great sense of humor.  He has been growing coffee for 18 years, having learned from his father as he used to help him on the farm when he was a boy.  Now, Pedro's children help him in his work, working from 6.00am to 3.00pm.  One of the difficulties that he has faced is a lack of economic resources to fight the pests that attack his plants.

This is Pedro's first loan and he will use it to resow his plants.  He also needs to buy some agricultural supplies and manure.  Pedro is certain that, with the support of this loan, his crops will improve, as will his family's living conditions.  His dream is to buy a few more 'manzanas' (one 'manzana = 1.68 acres) of land so that he can expand his business and become one of the biggest coffee growers in his region.  He hopes to make his loan repayments punctually so that the institution will continue supporting him with loans for larger amounts.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is a twenty-three year-old married man with one child.  He rents a house in Kasese, Uganda.  He is the bread winner of the family and his dream is to build a house and educate his children. 

He saved earnings and set up his own butcher shop after having been employed in the butchery and transport business for eight years previously.  He faces the challenges of the increasing cost of animals and of the mechanical breakdown of his motorcycle.  His dream is to own three motorcycles, since the business is profitable. Denis needs the loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Nestor is 44 years old and married with three school-age children. He is a farmer working in the Philippines, planting and selling rice. His wife is a housekeeper and his one and only partner in growing their rice farming business.

Nestor is asking for a loan of PHP 27,000 to buy rice seeds to grow. He will also buy fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides for plant care, in order to have a better yield. He wants to maintain his business because this is the only source of income that allows him to sustain the needs of his family and the necessities of his children in school.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and insecticides used in farming.

loans.name: Kamughobe Tukolerehaghuma Group

texts.en: Benedicto is a 43-year-old married man with seven children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. The responsibility of looking after the family rests on him and his aspiration is to see all his children graduate from university. He has been operating a retail shop for three years. He started the shop with 250,000 shillings and now has 1,800,000 shillings as his working capital. He is a member of a group where each member guarantees the other to obtain a loan. His vision is to someday own a wholesale shop. Benedicto needs this loan to buy saucepans, salt, and jerrycans for resale.

loans.use: to buy saucepans, salt, and jerrycans.

loans.name: Hillary

texts.en:
Hillary has been selling water for the past three years.  He is 28 years old and is married.  He has two children.   He is applying for his first loan of KES.50,000, with which he plans to increase the capital of the business by employing one casual worker to assist in the distribution and sale of water.

With the anticipated profit, he plans to re-invest the returns in the business.  His dream is to become a leading businessman in the area.

loans.use: to increase the capital for the business by employing one casual worker to assist in the distribution and sale of water.

loans.name: Nforneh

texts.en:
After joining GHAPE in 2007, things gradually improved in N.'s life. She has received and successfully repaid three Empowerment Credit loans. She invested these loans in her poultry, restaurant, and bar business. She used the profit from these loans to educate her grandchildren and to increase her capital.

Given a loan of 200,000 FRS, she intends to buy fowl for her poultry farm, buy drinks for her bar, and to buy firewood and stock some provisions. She strongly believes that this business will be a success because she has done it for a very long time and has a lot of experience with it. Other reasons for success are that she sells at a moderate price and has enough customers. The site of the business is also very good. Her business activity will be of great help to her community in that it will create an employment opportunity for N. and others, it will make some goods available for people around her, and will also improve people’s eating habits.

With the proceeds from her business, she will feed and clothe her family and also increase her capital. She prefers a GHAPE loan because of the training she receives, the low interest rates, and also because no collateral security is required before loans are disbursed. The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy fowl, drinks, firewood, red oil, and other provisions.

loans.name: Gennadyi

texts.ru:
Геннадий женат, у него двое детей. Он живет и работает в городе Мелитополе. Геннадий торгует игрушками, очками, а также подростковой одеждой. Так как Мелитополь – городок небольшой, чаще всего предприниматели на рынке предоставляют на розничную продажу сразу несколько видов товаров и Геннадий не стал исключением. Кроме того, что Геннадий реализует свой товар на одном из местных рынков, он еще занимается выездной торговлей по близлежащим селам и поселкам. 

Геннадий занимается этим бизнесом уже на протяжении 16 лет. У него хороший опыт работы  и много постоянных покупателей. В товаре у него 45 000 гривен. На данный момент Геннадию необходим кредит в размере 20 000 гривен для того, чтобы увеличить ассортимент подростковой одежды, которую он реализует. В будущем Геннадий планирует и дальше расширять свой бизнес и заниматься этим видом товара, который всегда остается в постоянном спросе. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en: Gennadyi is married and has two children.  He lives and works in the town of Melitopol.  Gennadyi sells toys, glasses and also juniors clothing.  Because Melitopol is a small town, entrepreneurs at the market often offer various types of merchandise for retail sale, and Gennadyi is not an exception.  Besides the fact that Gennadyi sells his merchandise at one of the local markets, he is also involved in traveling sales at nearby villages.  Gennadyi has been involved in this business for 16 years.  He has a good work experience and many loyal customers.  His merchandise is valued at 45 000 hryvnia.  Currently, Gennadyi needs a loan in the sum of 20 000 hryvnia in order to expand his assortment of juniors clothing that he sells. In the future, Gennadyi plans to further expand his business and always sell merchandise that is in high demand.

loans.use: to expand an assortment of juniors clothing, which he sells

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is an elementary graduate who did not pursue her studies due to the poor situation of her parents. For this reason, she was not be able to look for a better job to improve their standard of living. But despite that, this 59-year-old woman opened a sari-sari (variety) store as a source of income. It serves to cover their everyday basic expenses. This leads her to want to develop her business.


Now, she is asking for a loan in the amount of P5,000 to buy grocery items such as bread, cooking oil, sugar, and coffee. She hopes this will attract more customers and might be a big help to increase her net income. Then she could continue to send her three children to college. She is expecting the progress of her business through the help of Alalay Sa Kaunlaran (ASKI) Inc.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as bread, cooking oil, sugar, and coffee.

loans.name: Henrique

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Marracuene, provincia de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 8 filhos dos quais 7 maiores de idade e apenas um ainda frequenta a Escola. Fez 7ª classe e naõ continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

saiu da sua terra natal para o Distrito de Boane para constituir sua familia, trabalha como motorista na Funeraria Moçambicana ha mais de 26 anos e tem um salario de 4.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construcao para a obra da sua casa (cimento, barrotes, areia, pedra, ferro, e outros). O primeiro emprestimo foi de: 10.000.00mt, também para a sua obra.
Pretende solicitar mais valor para concluir a sua casa, e comprar uma viatura para o transporte da sua familia, irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Henrique was born in the district of Marracuene, in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique. He is married and the father of eight children, seven of whom are adults and one of whom is still in school. He went to school through the seventh grade but had to drop out because of financial difficulties. He lives with his family in a home they own, and isn't financially responsible for anyone else.

He left Marracuene for the district of Boane to start his family. He's worked as a driver for the Funeraria Moçambicana for more than 26 years and earns 4,500 meticals a month. He uses his salary to pay for household expenses and also saves some in a bank account.
He's never had loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku from friends who are also clients of the institution. This is his second loan, in the amount of 15,000 meticals, which he will use to purchase construction materials (cement, rebar, sand, stone, iron, etc.) to continue construction on his house. His first loan was in the amount of 10,000 meticals, which he also used for the construction.
He hopes to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to finish his house and buy a car for his family to use.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (cement, rebar, sand, stone, iron, etc.) to continue construction on his house.

loans.name: Chinda

texts.en:
Chinda is 29 years old and her husband, Chamroeun is 32 years old. They live in a village about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2002 and have three sons. Two are in school and another one is still young. 

Chinda and her husband sell ice. Chinda sells ice from home and her husband transports ice by his remoque to sell in other villages. (A remoque is a motorbike attached with a trailer at the back.) But his trailer is old which is why Chinda decides to apply for her first loan of $1,000 to buy new trailer for her husband. She will also use a part of the loan to buy additional ice to sell.

loans.use: To buy a new trailer for her husband to carry ice for sale.

loans.name: Maria Gabriela

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra: Gabriela; La socia tiene 51 años de edad, la socia  es casada,  tiene 3 hijos,  la socia sigue trabajando en la universidad,ella trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 1:00 p.m,la socia tambien se dedica junto a sus hija al negocio de venta de manualidades,ella hace adornos,teje y tambien hace trabajos como cuadros,por medio de este trabajo y este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de manualidades.  La socia desea el préstamo para comprar materiales para las manualidades como pinturas,telas y lanas.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: This communal bank member is Mrs. Gabriela.  She is 51 years old, married, and has three children.  She continues working in the university.  She works from 7:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m. Mrs. Gabriela, along with her daughter, also works selling handicrafts. She makes decorations, she knits, and she also makes works like paintings.  By means of this work and this small business she helps her children get ahead.  She wants to expand and improve the business of craftwork.  She wishes for the loan in order to buy materials for craftwork like paints, fabrics, and wool.  She is happy with the loan offered and she commits to fulfill the payment of dues for the established period of time.

loans.use: to buy materials for craftwork like paints, fabrics, and wool.

loans.name: Luzy

texts.en:
Luzy is aged 52 and married with three children. The last two are still in school. She has been in farming for over 15 years and produces maize, beans, coffee and milk which she sells at her local market in Nkubu area of Central Kenya.

Luzy has requested  a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo. She will purchase poultry birds for 20,000 KES and dairy goats for 20,000 KES in order to boost her farming. She says says the income generated will help her feed and educate her children. She also wants to start a cereal shop where she will sell cereals sourced both from her farm and from other farmers in the area.

She appreciates the help Juhudi has given to farmers by providing farming loans.

loans.use: to buy dairy goats and poultry birds.
