Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. This will be the first loan taken out by Evelyn from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
Es  un Sr. sumamente trabajador que actualmente se encuentra en una mala situación económica,él tiene 2 hijos que  están bajo su dependencia y una esposa que se encuentra en España, con la cual se tuvieron que divorciar hace poco ya que consiguió otra persona para que le acompañe y esta señora le dejo solo a su esposo con sus dos hijos,  el sr. Wilson  tiene  apenas 2 vacas las cuales  no dan mucha  leche, pero él no se conforma solo con ese ingreso ya que en su tiempo libre trabaja también de albañil,  el necesita comprarse otras vacas para obtener más ingresos por esta razón es que solicito un credito y tener que darles una vida mejor a sus hijos.

El sr. Wilson desea que sus hijos se supern y no sigan viviendo en las mismas condiciones que el hasta ahora vive.
texts.en:
Wilson is a very hardworking man who is currently in a poor financial situation. He has two children dependent upon him and his wife, who he recently had to divorce because she found another partner, is currently in Spain. She left him alone with their two sons. Wilson has only two cows that do not give much milk, but he does not make do with only this income as he also works as a builder in his free time. He needs to buy other cows to earn more income and this is why he is requesting a loan, as well as to provide his children with a better life.

Wilson wants his children to get ahead and to not continue living in the same conditions in which he has lived up to now.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: Sen M. is 44 years old, married, and has one adult child. He lives in Trapeang Leuk village in Takeo province.  He is a cow middleman and a fisherman who is able to earn some money to support the family. His wife,  Nget Mich, is a farmer who owns a two-hectare plot of land where she grows rice to sell to support the family. She is a also Khmer cheese maker. To improve rice production, Sen M. is applying for a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer, and gasoline to do farming during the dry season.

loans.use: To purchase rice seed, fertilizer, and gasoline

loans.name: Thoeurn's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan group has thirteen members, all of whom live in Akreiy Ksatr village in Kandal province. 

Mrs. Thoeurn N. married woman was born in 1979, and she is a village bank president. She was selected to be the village bank president by the other members. She earns her living by being a wedding beautician. With her current business, she would like to ask for a loan to purchase more wedding beautician supplies and beauty salon for selling and using.  

Mrs. Thoeurn N.’s husband, Sok Bros sells coal. With their carriers, they are able to earn a small income to help support the family. 

This couple has a child who is just 3 years old.

loans.use: To purchase more wedding beautician supplies and beauty salon for selling and using.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a married woman who lives in Narra, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a general store, an electronic loading business and a welding shop. Her husband Ariel, who is 37 years old, works as a welder to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have three children who are between 3 and 10 years old. Mercy joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Mercy has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 11,200, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her sixth loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 to buy more stock for the store so that she can continue to save up for future family needs and expansion of her business. Mercy is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda R. is from the village of Namnama, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 41 years old. Belinda is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Belinda owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Belinda has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Belinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Belinda has successfully repaid a previous loan  from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Belinda is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Belinda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Bros

texts.en:
Mr. Bros K. (pictured here) is 41 years old and his wife, Mrs. Sophat Khun, is 44 years old.  They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh, approximately 25 kilometers away.  They have been married since 1995 and have three sons. Two are in school and another one is still young.   

Bros sells cows and oxen. He buys them from other provinces far away from his house and resells to a slaughter house. Sometimes, there is a middleman who comes to buy at his house. His wife is a garment factory worker. 

Bros is asking for his first loan of $700 to purchase additional cows and oxen for resale.

loans.use: To purchase additional cows and oxen for resale.

loans.name: Phelister

texts.en:
Phelister is a married woman, with two children who attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent and school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a cafe, selling to her neighbors and passersby.  With the Kshs 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking oil, beans and maize flour. She dreams of growing her business in future.  She decided to join Yehu, to gain access to loans that will boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking oil, beans and maize flour.

loans.name: Rosa Marlene

texts.es:
Rosa de 54 años, es una mujer imprendedora que con su familia un día decidió abrir una panadería ya que uno de sus hijos sabe preparar pan.

Poco a poco incremento su capital hasta ahora que ella labora en su panadería desde las 6H15am a 11H00pm con el apoyo de su hijo. su esposo trabaja de comerciante. con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar arroz harina aceite viveres de hogar para vender en la panadería y en la preparación de panes. Su meta mas grande es que sigan con el negocio y arreglar su casa para que sigan juntos en armonía.
texts.en:
Rosa is 54 years old and she is an enterprising woman who, together with her family, one day decided to start a bakery, especially since one of her sons knows how to make bread.

Gradually her capital savings increased. Today she works in her bakery from 6:15am to 11pm with her son's help. Her husband works as a merchant. With the help of this loan she wants to purchase rice, flour, cooking oil, and other products that she wants to start selling in her bakery and to use in the preparation of baked goods. Her greatest goal is to keep up her business and to carry out some home improvements in order to stay together and in harmony.

loans.use: to purchase rice, cooking oil, and other baking supplies

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana C. lives in the village of Magsaysay, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old, married and has two school-aged children. For the last five years she has made a living by running a store where she buys and sells coconuts. She earns about 2,800 PHP a month.

In 2009, Susana joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid three previous loans and is applying for a new one, for 15,000 PHP, to buy more items to sell to her customers. She pans to use the additional revenue she earns as a result of this loan to continue improving her business. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and women and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy coconuts to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 39 years old, married to Eunice and they have two school going children.
  
He has been planting potatoes to sell in Olkalou town for the last three years. He was introduced to KADET LTD, by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan. He paid his previous loan of KES 18,500 well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Samuel hopes to buy a pick-up truck to help him transport his produce to the local market.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Roberta

texts.es: La señora Roberta se localiza en la comunidad de Atlacahualoya, Axochiapan, en el estado de Morelos, México, ella tiene 44 años de edad, ella es casada tiene 3 hijos Arseño de 20 años de edad ya trabaja, Nayely tiene 17 años y Luis Enrique de 10 años de edad está estudiando la primaria, ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes y también trabajan la alfarería elaborando cazuelas, ollas y jarros, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar, Huevo, azúcar, aceite, arroz, jabón, refrescos, agua, gelatinas, papel higiénico etc. para surtir su tienda de abarrotes y para pagar la luz, ella inicio su negocio hace 10 años con lo que tenían ahorrado su esposo y ella que se fueron a trabajar a los estados Unidos, su negocio es importante porque tienen trabajo su hija atendiendo la  tienda de abarrotes, su esposo y ella elaborando las cazuelas, ollas y jarros les ayuda a tener ingresos para cubrir los gastos de su hijo en la escuela y los de la casa, sus sueños y esperanzas son que su negocio crezca, que su hijos estén bien que no le pase nada, vivir contentos, ella quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por sus préstamos, les agradecemos mucho que nos están ayudando a crecer nuestros negocios y nuestras familias”.  Este préstamo le ayuda a inyectarle fuerza al negocio a tener bien surtida su tienda para tener que ofrecerles a sus clientes. Atlacahualoya es un pueblo bonito donde llegan personas a trabajar en la cebolla, se celebra el 29 de Septiembre a San Miguel hay misas, primeras comuniones, confirmaciones, hay jaripeo de Toros y baile.
texts.en:
Roberta resides in the community of Atlacahualoya, Axochiapan, in the state of Morelos. She is 44 years old, married, and has 3 children: Arseno aged 20 and already working, Nayelo 17, and Luis Enrique 10 who is enrolled in primary school.

Roberta has a grocery store and also works in pottery, making large cooking pots, pans, and jars. She solicits this loan to purchase eggs, sugar, cooking oil, rice, soap, soft drinks, water, gelatins, toilet paper, etc., to restock her grocery store and pay the electric bill. 

Roberta began her business some 10 years ago with what she and her husband had saved, after they went to work in the United States. Her business is important because it provides work for their daughter who is attending to the store, while Roberta and her husband make pottery, to help with household expenses and to afford to send their son to school.

Their dreams and hopes are that her store will grow, that her children will be healthy, and that nothing bad happens, so that they can live contentedly. Roberta wishes to say to Kiva and Fundacion Realidad, “Thanks for the loans, we are very grateful that you help us to improve our businesses and our families.” This loan will help to inject force into their business, and put inventory in the store to offer the customers.

Atlacahualoya is a pretty town where people come to work in the onion fields. They celebrate the day of St. Michael on September 29th, when there are masses, first communions, confirmations, a horse show, and a dance.

loans.use: buy eggs, sugar, cooking oil, rice, soap, soft drinks, water, gelatins, and pay the light bill.

loans.name: Jorge  Alberto

texts.es: El Sr. Alberto  es una persona muy  responsable  y trabajadora  que actualmente labora en una empresa  como chofer de autobús,  su   mayor  sueño  es  acondicionar  su   domicilio  ya  que  con esfuerzos y  dedicación    poco  a  poco  han ido  pagándola , en esta  ocasión requieren de nuestra  ayuda  para  terminar  de  instalar  el  techo  de  su  vivienda  ya  que   viene la  temporada  de lluvias,  agradece  el apoyo  para la  realización de este  proyecto  que  les  permitirá   brindar   una mejor  imagen a  su domicilio  y  asi  mismo  tener   mayor  comodidad.
texts.en: Señor Alberto is a very responsible and hard-working person who currently works for a company as a bus driver.  His biggest dream is to make improvements to his home.  Through his effort and dedication, he has paid for this little by little.  This time, he needs our help to finish putting a roof on his house since the rainy season is coming.  He is thankful for the support to carry out this project, which will let him make his house look better and also be more comfortable.

loans.use: To put a roof on his house.

loans.name: Iraida De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Iraida es socia del banco comunal Miraflores del Distrito De Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y tiene seis hijos (solo cuatro están a su cargo).
Iraida se dedica a la compra y venta de combustible, su esposo es motorista y hay ocasiones que encuentra combustible a un precio muy por debajo de lo normal y como todo comerciante aprovecha la oportunidad.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 50 galones de gasolina, 20 galones de petróleo, 10 galones de plásticos.
Este negocio lo comparte con su esposo, quien es el que consigue el producto a un buen precio, lógicamente la ganancia es buena.  Gracias a Manuela Ramos ha podido comprar sus cosas que le hacían falta y sobre todo poder educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Iraida is a member of the Miraflores community bank which is located in Calleria district, in Ucayali department.  She is 39 years old, married, and has six children (only four of whom are in her care).

Iraida's business is buying and selling fuel.  Her husband is a driver.  He sometimes finds fuel at a price which is much lower than normal and, like any salesperson, makes the most of the opportunity.

With this new loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles, Iraida will buy 50 gallons of gas, 20 gallons of kerosene and 10 gallons of plastic.

Iraida shares this business with her husband.  He is the one who acquires their product at a good price.  Logically, the profits are good.  Thanks to Manuela Ramos, Iraida has been able to buy things that her family needs and, above all, educate her children.

loans.use: to buy fuel

loans.name: Chhaem

texts.en:
From the Reussey Keo area, Mr. Chhaem is a 31-year-old man who has been in the farming business since 2000.  He earns approximately $3 each day.  He has a life partner in his wife, who helps support him in his business. They are blessed with one child, who is studying in the public school and relies on them for support.  

Mr. Chhaem has learned how to produce earthenware jars. He wishes to open a small business to sell these jars but doesn't have enough working capital to run this kinds of business. Therefore, Mr. Chhaem made the decision to apply for a loan from Kiva through HKL to obtain the capital to operate a small business selling earthenware jars.

loans.use: operate his earthenware jars business

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is 36 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is single and has three children between the ages of four to fourteen, all of whom attend school. For the past six months Comfort has been selling cold water and other food items. She started her business with 5,000 Liberian dollars. She is requesting a loan to purchase five cartons of whisky for her business. She plans to open a bank account for her children in the future.

loans.use: to purchase five cartons of whisky for her business.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 27 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. She has a business selling bread in Kator Branch in South Sudan. She has been running this business for three years.

Flora requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more bread to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman. She has three children, two girls and one boy, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees and clothing for the family. 

For the past year, Florence has operated a retail shop business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She decided to expand her business in the future.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase quantities of cooking fat oil, sugar and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of cooking fat oil, sugar and wheat flour.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SOLIDARIDAD-CACHIMAYO” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Cachimayo, en la Provincia de Urubamba y Departamento de Cusco.
La  socia Julia; tiene 40 años de edad,  la socia es viuda; la socia tiene 4 hijos  de 20, 17, 7, 2 años de edad; La socia es comerciante minorista, la socia se dedica a  comprar al por mayor golosinas y a la distribución de viandas en las diferentes obras, la socia trabaja en dos actividades, ella por un lado en las tardes se dedica  a la venta de golosinas de forma independiente no contando con una carreta autorizada, ella en una caja de cartón acomoda las diferentes golosina y jalando otra canasta regular , lleva otro grupo de galletas y chocolates. La socia también muy temprano por la mañana se dedica a elaborar los diferentes almuerzos diarios en viandas de plástico y las lleva a las diferentes obras en las cuales encuentra a los trabajadores muy ocupados construyendo casa, edificios, colegios y otros y ofrece los servicios de llevarles como 20 a 30 almuerzos diarios a las misma hora, lo cual es ventajoso para estos señores y rentable para la socia, ella desea en esta ocasión poder comprar insumos para la elaboración de sus viandas, ella compraría aceite en bidones, papas al por mayor, arroz en sacos, y otros productos  más, la socia no tiene planes a futuro solo el poder seguir teniendo trabajo y poder cubrir las necesidades de sus hijos, ella solo desea que sus hijos tengan comida diaria, salud, vestido y que se puedan educar. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos al por mayor como aceite, papa entre otros.
La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Solidaridad-Cachimayo Community Bank located in the district of Cachimayo, Urubamba province, in the department of Cusco. She is 40 years old and a widow. She has four children aged 20, 17, 7, and 2. 

Julia has two jobs. The first is a business selling candy. She buys it wholesale and then sells it at different work sites. She does this in the afternoons independently, not from an authorized cart. In a cardboard box she places different kinds of candy, and in a basket she puts cookies and chocolate. 

Her other job is making lunches. She gets up very early in the morning to prepare the food and then takes the plastic containers to different work sites where busy workers are building houses, buildings, schools etc. She sells 20-30 lunches daily at a set time. This is an advantage for the men, and profitable for Julia.

Now Julia wishes to buy ingredients for making the food. She is seeking a loan to buy oil in cans, potatoes at wholesale prices, rice in sacks, and other products. She doesn't have any special plans for the future, only to be in work and able to pay for her children's needs. Her only wish is for her children to have regular meals, health, clothing, and an education.

Julia is grateful for the support that is offered and promises to make the loan repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy products wholesale, such as oil and potatoes, for her lunch-making business

loans.name: Oscar Danilo

texts.es: Oscar Danilo se dedica a brindar el servicio de tornero. El decide comenzar este medio de vida por iniciativa propia, ya que siempre le había gustado ser una persona responsable y obtener sus propios ingresos por medio de su negocio. El tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a quienes les enseña a ganarse el pan de cada día.  El solicita este crédito es para la compra de llaves, aluminio, moldes entre otros. Sueña con terminar de establecer su taller que es lo más importante para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Oscar Danilo earns his living as a lathe operator. He started this job on his own initiative since he has always been a responsible person and enjoyed earning his own money through his business. He has two children whom he is teaching to make their own way in the world. 

Oscar is seeking a loan to buy keys, aluminum, and molds. His dream for the future is to have an established workshop, a goal that is very important to him and his family.

loans.use: to buy keys, aluminum, molds etc

loans.name: Egam

texts.ru: Эгам умный и целеустремленный человек. Он женат и у них трое детей. Более 20 лет он занимается скотоводством. Эгам хочет, чтоб его семья жили в хороших условиях жизни и в хороших красивых домах. Он хочет отремонтировать свой дом с целью улучшения свое жилищное условия. С этой целью он запрашивает займ в размере 5000 Сомони. Он заранее благодарить всех вас за вашу поддержку и помощь.
texts.en: Egam is an intelligent and goal-oriented person. He is married and has three children. He has been raising animals for over 20 years. Egam wants his family to have a good quality of life and good, attractive  housing. He would like to have his house repaired in order to improve his living condition. With this goal in mind, he is requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 TJS. He thanks all of you in advance for your support and help.

loans.use: to have home repair work done

loans.name: Cristina

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Magude, provincia de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 2 filhas que frequentam a Escola. Fez o nivel médio do Ensino Geral e Tecnico e naõ continuou devido a falta de tempo. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

Saiu da sua terra natal para o Distrito de Boane devido a seu emprego, é professora ha mais de 13 anos e tem um salario de 7.290.95mt, por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigas que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construcao para a obra da sua casa (blocos, areia, cimento, pedra, e outros) para dar continuidade com sua obra. O primeiro emprestimo foi de: 10.000.00mt, para a construção da sua casa.
Pretende solicitar mais valor para concluir a sua casa e construir uma mercearia, irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Cristina was born in the Magude district of Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She is the single mother of two daughters, both of whom go to school. She made it part of the way through a university degree, but couldn't continue due to time constraints. 

She left her native region for the Boane District to pursue work. She has been a teacher for more than 13 years and earns a monthly salary of 7,290.95
MZN [Mozambique Meticais] that goes to her household expenses and also some savings in his personal bank account.  

She has never taken out a loan from any other bank and became aware of Hluvuku [Kiva field partner] through some friends who are also Hluvuku clients. This will be her second loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 20,000 MZN [Mozambique Meticais] with which she plans to buy construction materials for her house (cinder blocks, sand, cement, rocks, etc.) so she can continue building her home. Her first loan was in the amount of 10,000 MZN [Mozambique Meticais] for this work. 

She plans to take out further loans from Hluvuku to finish her home and build a small grocery store.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for her house (cinder blocks, sand, cement, rocks, etc.)

loans.name: Mahliehon's Group

texts.en:
Mahliehon is 23 years old and she is a nurse. She lives with her parents in a small village called Aravan, which is in the south of Kyrgyzstan. Her mother also works as a nurse and her monthly salary is 6,000 soms. Her father is in Russia and each month he transfers about 5,000 soms to meet the family's needs. In order to earn additional money for the family budget, Mahliehon cultivates agricultural products. With the money received from this loan, she wants to purchase mineral fertilizers for growing potatoes. In the future, with the profits gained from selling the harvest she plans to build a summer kitchen.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers for growing potatoes

loans.name: Berna Luz

texts.es:
Doña Berna, sigue con la inversion de su negocio, una ferreteria, ubicada en mercado de la capital, que junto a su esposo trabajan, tambien, el hace trabajos de soldadura, y entrega portones de hierro,obteniendo buenos ingresos que ayudan a su familia ah pagar los gastos basicos del hogar.
Hoy en dia esta viviendo donde su mama, por corto tiempo ya que esta en remodelacion de su casa, con el objetivo de subirla toda de concreto, repellarla, y hacer las mejoras necesaria para el bienestar comun de la familia, ya que su casa era muy pequeña.
El cual comprara el resto de materiales que le hace falta, cemento, arena, para repellar paredes, ceramica, separadores, tinta, cemento boon, para terminarla, y que esta logrando gracias a sus ganancias y al financiamiento que la institucion otorga, haciendo mas rapido su terminacion.
texts.en: Doña Berna continues investing in her business, an ironmongery located in the capital, where she works together with her husband.  He also does welding jobs and installs iron gates, making good money that helps the family meet its expenses.  At the moment they are living with her mother for a while, while they are remodeling their house and making the improvements needed for their family's well-being, as the house is very small.  The loan will be used to buy the rest of the materials they need, such as cement and sand to plaster walls, tiles, dividers, stain, and Boone cement.  Thanks to their income and the loan they are receiving, they hope to finish their remodeling more quickly.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to finish the improvements her home needs.

loans.name: Esteban Ramón

texts.es:
El señor Esteban tiene 38 años de edad, es soltero, no tiene hijos. Tiene un ciber y realiza trabajos a computadora en su domicilio de la ciudad de Itá, decidió iniciar ese negocio ya que sabe mucho de informática gracias a su trabajo anterior como secretario de un instituto de informática.
Tiene varias computadoras propias, y nos comenta que le va muy bien en su negocio, desea comprar una computadora mas que lo ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
El señor Esteban es muy emprendedor y desea llevar a cabo dicho emprendimiento causa por la cual acude a Fundación Paraguaya y a Kiva para obtener el crédito. Agradece por esta oportunidad que se le da, pues es muy importante para el.
texts.en:
Sr. Esteban is 38 years old, single, and has no children. He manages a cybercafé and performs computer work from his home in the city of Itá. Esteban decided to start this business because he gained a great deal of knowledge about computer systems from his previous job as an assistant at a computer institute.

He owns several computers and says that he has done very well in his business. Esteban wants to buy another computer to help improve his income. He is very enterprising and wants to keep his venture in operation. Therefore, he approached Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva in order to obtain a loan. He is grateful for the opportunity that has been given because his business is very important to him.

loans.use: to buy a computer for his cybercafé.

loans.name: Dul

texts.en:
Mrs. Dul is a 47-year-old married woman and has 2 single children. She earns a living by cultivating rice and vegetable crops. She earns $1.50 per day from this business, while her husband earns approximately $5.00 by working as a construction laborer. 

Mrs. Dul would like to borrow $1000 to prepare a wedding party for her older daughter's upcoming marriage. In the future, she plans to own a store near a local school and sell products that appeal to students.

loans.use: to prepare a wedding party for her older daughter.

loans.name: Adau

texts.en:
Adau is a 30-year-old married woman with four children, three of whom are in school. She has had a business of a food stall in Bor South Sudan for 3 years.

Adau is requesting this loan through BRAC south Sudan to purchase sugar and milk. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: To purchase sugar and milk for sale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Review-Joseph is 58 years old and is supporting four children.

He has been involved in his retail business for the last 16 years, from which he earns a monthly income of Kes 37,000. He is applying for his first loan of Kes 30,000. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

He hopes to use the profits to buy maize, wheat flour and kerosene for sale.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, wheat flour and kerosene for sale

loans.name: Phory

texts.en:
Phory (in the photo) and her husband, Tian, are teachers. When free from teaching, they also run a weaving business at home. They have been married since 1990 and have no children yet. They live on an island in the Mekong River about15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Phory is asking for a loan of $500 to buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Momar

texts.fr: Monsieur Momar  est âgé de 45 ans. Il vit au Sénégal. Il est marié et père de 4 enfants  dont l’âge varie entre 1et 7 ans.  Il s’active depuis 1992 dans l’enseignement coranique  dans le quartier ou il habite. Ce qui l’intéresse  le plus c’est le savoir qu’il inculque aux enfants. Il est membre du guichet de l’U-IMCEC de la localité  depuis octobre 2003. Il sollicite un crédit de 150 000 prévu pour soutenir ses frères pécheurs qui ont des possibilité très limitées et qui veulent entretenir leur pirogue qui est en état de délabrement avancé. Son  objectif est d’aider ses frères à maintenir leur capacité financière a  supporter les charges familiales.
texts.en: Monsieur Momar is forty-five years old. He lives in Senegal. He is married and the father of four children, whose ages range from one to seven years. He has been active since 1992 teaching the Koran in the area where he lives. What interests him the most is the knowledge that he imparts to the children. He has been a member of his UIMCEC branch since October 2003. He is asking for a loan of 150,000, anticipated to help his brothers, who are fishermen, who have very limited possibilities and want to take care of their canoe, which is badly in disrepair. His objective is to help his brothers maintain their financial capacity to support their family expenses.

loans.use: to help his brothers repair their canoe.

loans.name: Omar Thomas

texts.es:
Omar tiene 36 años de edad, es viudo, vive con su hija de tres años de edad en de Santo Tomás que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. En esta zona las principales actividades que se desarrollan son la agricultura, ganadería y comercio y cuenta con servicios básicos como son agua y luz.

Omar es un padre de familia emprendedor que trabaja como gestor de un programa social desde hace 4 años, su trabajo consiste en visitar a los beneficiarios de este programa y verificar cuales son sus actuales condiciones de vida y verificar si muestran mejora en su economía. El crédito lo utilizará para gastos personales que le van a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Omar is 36 years old, widowed, and lives with his three-year-old daughter. They reside in Santo Tomás in Jaén Province, which is located in the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru. The main development activities in this area include agriculture, livestock breeding, and trade. This area receives basic services, such as running water and electricity.

Omar is an enterprising father who has been working as a manager with a social services program for the past four years. His work consists of visiting beneficiaries of the program, verifying their current living conditions, and verifying if they have made financial improvements. Omar’s loan will be used for personal expenses. This will allow him to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to pay for personal expenses.

loans.name: Sergey

texts.en:
Sergey is married with two children. His 17-year-old daughter is a handball player. His son is 22, he studies in college to be an IT technician. Sergey’s dream is to open family computer store/club.

Before Sergey started his business, he used to work at a factory adjusting welding equipment. When the factory staff was reduced, Sergey lost his job. He was forced to find another source of income for the family with two little kids. That’s how he ended up at a car repair shop working with a car flattener. In 1994 Sergey decided to start a small business of his own, selling dishware, leather wallets, perfume and souvenirs. The loans he received in “Nadiya Ukraine” helped him reinforce his trade activities, providing necessary resources for his small business. Sergey is very consistent and balanced, he has a good sense of management. That’s why he has succeeded to manage all loans without any delinquencies.

Sergey is applying for a loan to get sufficient capital to increase his inventory and gain extra profits. It will not only help him have enough to maintain his family and cover the increasing demand this Christmas season, but also give their family computer business a good start. In the country where most families still don’t have computers at home and many people go to computer clubs to access internet, Sergey and his son can open a client-friendly internet café that would provide high quality service to the community. They are planning to rent a facility, do all the necessary remodelling and purchase desktop computers and supplementary furniture. This computer club will not only provide access to computers, moreover, it will offer any kind of IT services and a wide range of computer equipment for sale.

Сергій – одружений, у нього двоє дітей. 17-річна донька професійно займається гандболом. 22-річний син вивчає в університеті комп’ютерні технології. Мрія Сергія – відкрити власний комп’ютерний магазин/клуб.

Сергій працював на заводі – налагоджував зварювальне устаткування. Коли Сергій втратив роботу, він був змушений шукати інший заробіток, бо треба було якось дбати про родину з двома маленькими дітьми. Так Сергій почав рихтувати автомобілі. В 1994 році Сергій вирішив почати свій бізнес і продавати посуд, гаманці, парфуми та сувеніри. Позики, які він отримав в „Надії України”, допомогли Сергію зміцнити свої позиції на ринку та забезпечити необхідні ресурси для успішного функціонування його бізнесу. Сергій дуже наполегливий та врівноважений. З поміж інших його відрізняє чудове вміння керувати фінансовими ресурсами та часом. Ці якості допомогли йому вчасно виплатити усі позики, отримані в „Надії України”.

Сергій просить про позику для того, щоб отримати необхідні кошти для збільшення кількості товарних одиниць та отримання додаткового прибутку. Це не тільки дасть йому можливість забезпечити родину усім необхідним та задовольнити попит на товари напередодні свят, але й надасть можливість нарешті почати свій сімейний комп’ютерний бізнес. В країні, де велика кількість родин досі не мають власного комп’ютера вдома і багато хто відвідує комп’ютерні клуби для того, щоб скористатися Інтернетом, Сергій та його син хочуть відкрити затишне інтернет-кафе, яке зможе запропонувати спільноті високоякісні комп’ютерні послуги. Сергій з сином планують орендувати приміщення, зробити ремонт, закупити комп’ютери ті необхідні меблі. Слід додати, що в планах Сергія зробити з цього інтернет-клубу також сервіс-центр та магазин, який надає різноманітні послуги у галузі інформаційних технологій, а також займається продажем комп’ютерів та іншого обладнання.

loans.use: To generate more profits and start family computer business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand and diversify used book business

loans.name: Rosalinda Margarita

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 25 years old, is married, and has 2 children. Her husband works as a mason’s assistant. She raises animals such as chickens, turkeys, and pigs, and sells them to people in her area and at the market in the city. She wants to buy feed for the animals with the loan; this is her biggest expense because the animals have grown in number. She is part of the “Palms Group 1”.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

ROSALINDA TIENE 25 AÑOS, CASADA 2 HIJOS. SU ESPOSO TRABAJA COMO AYUDANTE DE ALBAÑIL. ELLA SE DEDICA A LA CRIANZA DE ANIMALES COMO : GALLINAS ,PAVOS Y PUERCOS, LOS VENDE CON LA GENTE DE SU LOCALIDAD Y EN EL MERCADO DE LA CIUDAD A LOS ALDEANOS.CON EL PRESTAMO QUIERE COMPRAR ALIMENTOS PARA LOS ANIMALES YA QUE ES EN LO QUE MAS GASTA PORQUE EL NUMERO DE ANIMALES SE HA REPRODUCIDO. ELLA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO PALMAS 1.

loans.use: To buy feed for poultry and livestock

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: “My husband died a few years after we got married and I have no children. I live with my brother and his family in a rural area of Pakistan with the nearest metropolitan city about four hours away. I earn my livelihood by selling three to five tonnes wood daily in the local market and make a profit of about 33 cents per tonne. There are no financial sources of support available for me and require a loan so that I can purchase more wood to sell in the market.” Mariam B., Pakistan

loans.use: Purchase wood

loans.name: Ni Nyoman Simpen

texts.id:
Ni Nyoman Simpen, is a mother to 3 children. Her eldest child is first year in secondary school, which her second and third child is in 5 and 3 year student in primary school. Her husband works as a sweeper at a market neat Gilimanuk Port. With 3 schooling children, Ni Nyoman has to work hard to finance their education. She has a fruit stall business. She started this business since she was married. And didn't move into other business because she is very used to this business. Before having help from DINARI, Ni Nyoman SImpen only had capital from her own savings which is around Rp. 500.000, which is insufficient for her to cater for more fruits. She find it frustrated to not able to cater customer's request for a variety of fruits. Therefore some days NI Nyoman SImpen only manage to have a mere profit of Rp. 35.000. After having help from Dinari her capital increased to Rp. 1.100.000. She has also manage to increase her selection of fruits. And manage to get around Rp, 60.000 profit per day. With it She is able to cover finance her children studies and yet have enough cash flow for the business.

Translated from Bahasa by bernard, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Nyoman Simpen, ibu dengan 3 orang anak. Anak yang pertama sudah duduk dibangku SMA kelas 1, yang kedua SD kelas 5 dan yang terakhir duduk dibangku SD kelas 3. Suaminya bekerja sebagai Tukang Sapu di pasar dekat pelabuhan Gilimanuk. Dengan 3 anak yang duduk di bangku sekolah, Ni Nyoman Simpen harus bekerja untuk menunjang biaya pendidikan anaknya. Ni Nyoman Simpen mempunyai usaha sebagai Dagang Buah – buahan. Usaha ini sudah ditekuni Ni Nyoman Simpen sejak menikah dan tidak pernah beralih ke usaha lain karena pekerjaan ini sudah menjadi keahliannya Sebelum mendapat pinjaman dari Dinari, Ni Nyoman Simpen hanya mengandalkan uang simpanannya sendiri untuk modal usaha sebesar Rp. 500.000.- Dengan modal yang kurang mencukupi, Ni Nyoman Simpen seringkali tidak mampu melayani pembeli karena buah – buahan yang dimilikinya kurang bervariasi jenisnya. Terkadang dalam sehari Ni Nyoman Simpen hanya mendapat keuntungan sebesar Rp. 35.000.- Setelah mendapat pinjaman dari Dinari, modal yang dimilikinya sekarang menjadi Rp. 1.100.000.- dan dengan dana itu, Ni Nyoman Simpen sudah mampu menambah dagangannya dengan aneka jenis buah – buahan. Dengan kondisi yang sekarang, Ni Nyoman Simpen bisa mendapat keuntungan yang lebih besar yakni Rp, 60.000.- per hari. Keuntungan itu sudah bisa untuk menghidupi keluarga, biaya sekolah anaknya dan untuk modal usaha.

loans.use: Membeli berbagai jenis buah - buahan yang disukai oleh pelanggannya -  To buy more fruits to cater to her customer's request.

loans.name: Nurhayati

texts.en: Nurhayati is 23 years old and is married with one child aged 1. She has a small shop which sells snacks, food, and drinks, along with household products. She can earn $6 per day. Her husband has no fixed income. She would like a IDR 900,000 loan to complete her business. Nurhayati hopes that she can improve her income to use towards her children's education. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To complete her business

loans.name: Dionisia's Group

texts.es:
Dionisia, Olga, and Yolanda are members of the Kutimuy Community Bank since 14, 3 and 1 year, respectively. Kutimuy is a Quechua word that means "to return". Dionisia has been making handicrafts in a loom for 25 years and she sells her products directly and also through middlemen. Together with her husband Yolanda elaborates dairy products like: yogurt, ice cream, and cheeses. They sell them door to door. Olga is dedicated to sell groceries at a kiosk.

At their community bank, they had learned to raise and educate their kids without violence and to live in harmony. They need loans for the amounts of 400 soles(Peruvian currency), 1200 soles, and 1500 soles respectively. They will invest it in buying dyes, firewood, wool, milk, sugar, bags, carbonated beverages, yogurt, cookies, sweets, liquors,and shampoo.

Dionisia's, Olga's, and Yolanda's dreams are to be able to have a store that sell supplies for looms and loomscrafts, have their own houses, that their children become professionals and a store where they can sell at wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

 Dionisia, Olga y Yolanda son socias del Banco Comunal Kutimuy desD. hace 14, 3 y 1 año, respectivamente. Kutimuy es una palabra quechua que significa “regresa”. Dionisia realiza artesanías en telar desD. hace 25 años y sus productos los venD. a intermediarios y directamente. Yolanda, junto a su esposo elaboran productos lácteos como yogurt, helados, quesos y la venta lo realiza ambulatoriamente y por otro lado, el negocio D. Olga es la venta D. abarrotes en un kiosco. En su Banco Comunal ellas han aprendido a educar a los hijos sin violencia y a vivir en armonía. Ellas necesitan préstamos D. 400 soles, 1200 soles y 1500 soles respectivamente que lo invertirán en la compra D. tintes, leña, lana, leche, azúcar, bolsas, gaseosa, yogurt, galletas caramelos, licores, champú. Los sueños D. Dionisia, Olga y Yolanda son tener una tienda que venda insumos para telares, tener una casa propia, que sus hijos sean profesionales y una tienda D. venta al por mayor.

loans.use: They need loans for the amounts of 400 soles(Peruvian currency), 1200 soles, and 1500 soles respectively.  They will invest it in buying dyes, firewood, wool, milk, sugar, bags, carbonated beverages, yogurt, cookies, sweets, liquors,and shampoo.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 41 year-old Sara M.. She is widowed with three children, ages 9, 11, and 13. In 2006 Sara established a farming business, and now requires a loan of $175 in order to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and tools. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA: SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer and tools for farming.

loans.name: Camilia Lyli

texts.es:
Señora Camila is a merchant who has a lot of experience selling women's and men's clothing, cosmetics, and appliances for the home. She developed this business in her home and has expanded it. She now offers a larger variety of products, styles, brands, and prices.

She has a good number of clients who buy and order from her. She dedicates her entire day to her business. She buys the products that she sells in the central market at favorable prices since she buys them in large volumes. She started her business 14 years ago by selling only clothing and cosmetics. Today it is larger due to her good administration. This has let her educate her three daughters, who now live independently.

Camila needs a loan right now to buy home applicances that her clients have ordered from her like televisions, radios, and DVD players, among other things. Her clients have the ease of acquiring these appliances on credit that they can pay off weekly, bi-weekly, or monthly.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Camila es una comerciante de mucha experiencia en ventas de ropa para dama y caballeros, cosméticos y electrodomésticos para el hogar, negocio que lo desarrollo en su vivienda y el cual ha ido expandiéndose, ya que ofrece una gran variedad de productos, estilos, marcas y precios.

Tiene un buen número de clientas que le compran y le encargan, le dedica todo el día a su negocio. Los productos que comercializa los compra en el mercado central a precios favorables debido a que compra en grandes volúmenes. Inicio su negocio hace 14 años con la venta de ropa y cosméticos únicamente, hoy lo tiene más amplio, esto es debido a su buena administración, ya que el mismo negocio le ha permitido profesionalizar a sus tres hijas, las cuales viven independientes de ella.

La señora en estos momentos necesita un préstamo para comprar electrodomésticos que le han encargado sus clientas como son TV, RADIO, DVD entre otras cosas. Los clientes tienen la facilidad de adquirir los electrodomésticos al crédito con facilidades de pago semanal, quincenal o mensual.

loans.use: To purchase appliances to invest in her business

loans.name: Katwe B(Iv) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Jackline K.. She is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to purchase more sacks of charcoal. Jackline is 33 years old and is married with a husband who sells produce for work. She has 3 children ranging from age 7 to 15 and her children go to school. Each week, Jackline makes approximately UGX 100000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children. Jackline has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 350000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Jackline is joined in her small group by Edith K., Agnes N. and Sarah A.. Edith K. has a business selling used clothes and wants to purchase more clothes to sell. Agnes N. is currently operating a laundry business and wants a loan to put up sign posts and buy dry irons. Sarah A. operates a business in used clothing sales and wants to increase the stock of clothes.

loans.use: To increase charcoal purchases and sales

loans.name: Iva B Centre - Group 3

texts.en:
For these 3 women of Iva B on the island of Savaii, these are their first loans from SPBD. They all undertook 4 weeks of training on managing a business and maintaining a savings account, and then passed a written test on the SPBD principles: business, savings, weekly meetings, payments and group guarantee. Over the next 52 weeks, they will support each other in their individual business development and to guarantee on-time payments.

Silivia Wong S., 40, is married to a carpenter and has 7 children. For over 2 years, she has farmed a taro plantation. She employs 5 workers. With her loan, she will purchase a weed killer, pesticides, fertilizer, a bush knife, and labor.

Mua Ee V., 36, has 4 children and is married to a farmer. She is involved in 2 businesses: farming and fishing. She sells taro one day per week at the Salelologa market and sells fish three days per week. He husband performs the farming and fishing duties. With her loan, she will purchase a weed killer, pesticides, a lantern and a fishing boat.

Naoupu Lefee M., 47, is married to a farmer and fisherman. She has 4 children. She has over 3 years of experience in taro farming. She will use her loan to purchase a weed killer, pesticides, a knife, a filing and 1,000 taro roots.

loans.use: Purchase a weed killer, pesticides, fishing boat…

loans.name: Felicita

texts.en: Felicita is a 49 year old mother of 9 children. Her kids are all between the ages of 18 and 29 and she supports two of them at university. She has three different businesses that she manages completely on her own.  She has chickens that she buys as chicks, rears and then sells for meat when they are adults. At the moment she has around 90 chickens (some layers, some broilers and some local breed). She also has 3 pigs which she also buys young and sells for meat.  As well as her meat businesses, she has water in a large tank which she sells by the jerry can to the locals, and she has a small jack fruit plantation. Her main business is her poultry which she buys for $5 each, rears for 2 months, and sells for $30.

loans.use: To buy more chickens and feed

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en: Jamila is a 41-year-old woman who lives in southern Lebanon, in Saida. Jamila makes handicrafts and accessories. This is the first time she is applying for a loan at Al Majmoua. She needs to buy merchandise to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Trinh Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Trinh Thi H., 47 years old, is the owner of a small general store. She joined the TYM Fund since 1997. After 10 years of membership, her family economy becomes more stable. She has 2 grown-up children. She is owning a general store to assist local people with common merchandises. Since her house is facing the road that links different towns together, her customers are not only from in town but also people from other places. The general store brings her a profit of about 200 USD/month. Besides, her husband also breeds animals. This time, she wants to borrow 550 USD to invest more in her general store. Her total income is approximately 275 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Trịnh Thị Hồng 47 tuổi hiện đang là chủ của của hàng tạp hoá nhỏ. Chị Tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1997. Qua 10 năm tham gia Quỹ kinh tế gia đình chị ngày càng ổn định và phát triển. Gia đình chị có hai con đã trưởng thành. Hiện nay gia đình chị có một cửa hàng tạp hoá buôn bán các mặt hàng gia dụng phục vụ cho nhân dân trong vùng. Nhà chị nằm ở mặt đường giao thông liên xã do đó khách hàng đến với của hàng của chị không chỉ có nhân dân địa phương mà còn có cả khách hàngcủa các xã lân cận do vậy công việc buôn bán của chị có rất nhiều thuân lợi. Cửa hàng cho thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng. Ngoài công việc buôn bán chồng chị cũng giúp chị nhiều trong công việc chăn nuôi tại gia đình. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư thêm vào cửa hàng tạp hoá. Thu nhập bình quân 4.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Invest in general store

loans.name: Arafa

texts.en: Arafa M. is 25 years old. She sells charcoal and juice; a business she started in 2008. Every day, she works from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. and earns a monthly profit of about $78. Arafa now hopes for a loan of $175 to buy more charcoal and increase her income.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương thu nhập của gia đình chị Ngân chủ yếu dựa vào chăn nuôi và trồng trọt. Với số vốn vay 2.000.000đ của vòng vốn đầu tiên khi tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương chị Ngân cũng sử dụng để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi cho thu nhập 500.000đ/ tháng. Sau một thời gian sử dụng vốn vay hiệu quả cùng với nguồn vốn huy động thêm từ anh em bạn bè gia đình chị đã đầu tư mua máy say sát gạo về phục vụ cho nhu cầu của người dân địa phương. Hiện nay công việc hàng ngày của chị Ngân là làm máy say sát và chăn nuôi còn chồng chị thì đi làm thợ xây. Với mức thu nhập ổn định 3.000.000đ /tháng và sự hỗ trợ của người con hiện đang lao động tại nước ngoài nên ngoài việc hoàn trả vốn cho Quỹ và chi tiêu trong gia đình anh chị còn tiết kiệm để tiếp tục đầu tư phát triển kinh tế gia đình. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ để tiếp tục đầu tư cho kinh doanh và chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Before becoming a member of this organization, Ms. N. only source of income for her family was raising livestock and providing child care services. Her first loan was used as an investment in raising livestock, averaging in 500.000d/month. She saw a success with the loan she receive for her business. She was able to used the profits in which she made along with the help from friends and family to invest in buying a wheat processing machine to service the need of the people in her community. Presently, Ms. N. every day job is to process wheat and raise farm animals while her husband works in the construction field. The family’s income has been steady at 3.000.000d/month. She also received financial support from one of her children who lives in a another country. Besides paying off the loan in which she received from the organization, she is able to save some money for her family. This next loan she is requesting an amount of 20.000.000d to continue her business and raising farm animals.

Translated from Vietnamese by Lynn Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Jonas

texts.en:
Greetings from Jonas in Gisenyi, Rwanda! Jonas is 32 years old, married with 7 children.

Jonas sells fresh milk to people living in the town center. He employs 2 people to run the business. He is looking for a loan worth 300 575 Frws to buy materials and milk for his business. The loan repayment period is 8 months.

loans.use: To buy more materials and milk for his business

loans.name: Odile

texts.fr: Odile D., 44 ans, mariée est membre du banc villageois de Samba 15 ans 1  depuis 3 ans. Elle veut renforcer son commerce de produits alimentaires (miel, pâte d’arachide et pain de singe). Ses revenus  lui permettent de participer aux charges familiales. <b> Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Odile D., age 44, is married and has been a member of the village loan group "Samba 15 ans 1" for three years. She wants to bolster her business selling food items (honey, peanut butter, and the fruit of the baobab known as monkey bread). Her income enables her to help cover family expenses. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell honey, peanut butter, and monkey bread

loans.name: Clara

texts.en: Clara is a 63-year-old woman who owns a grocery store. Her husband helps her with the business. Before acquiring the store, her business, for about twenty-six years, was to buy and sell products in various markets around the province. Her experience, industriousness and the support of her husband have helped their two sons to earn a college education. She wants to expand her grocery store. Both she and her husband want to save money so they can live comfortably, through their own effort, in the future.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Martha Yuliza

texts.es: Martha Yuliza es soltera, de 28 años de edad, trabaja como conserje en la Universidad Agraria con 7 años de servicio, vive en casa de su mamá, esta solicitando su credito # 8 para comprar un terreno y construir su propia vivienda en el futuro y asi tener un poco de independencia, piensa seguir con los creditos para poco a poco realizar su sueño de tener su casa, pues en el futuro tendra su propia familia y desea que esten en un lugar propio y darle las condiciones basicas.  Martha Yuliza se ha caracterizado por ser responsable y puntual en sus pagos, es muy querida por sus compañeros de trabajo y vecinos, y confia en que AFODENIC le ayudara a cumplir su sueño de tener su propia vivienda.
texts.en:
Martha Yuliza is 28 years old and single. For the past seven years, she has been working as a custodian at the Agrarian University. She currently lives with her mother, and is requesting her eighth loan to buy a plot of land on which she can build her own home in the future. She plans to continue to take out loans so that, little by little, she can make her dream of building her own home come true. Someday, she will have a family of her own, and she would like her family to have its own home and access to basic services. Martha Yuliza has been very responsible and punctual with previous loan payments. She is very well-liked by her coworkers and neighbors, and she is confident that AFODENIC will help make her dream of having her own home a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a plot of land to build her house on

loans.name: Snguon

texts.en: Snguon S., age 50, lives in Siem Reap Province. She takes care of her two children who both live at home. For many years, she has serviced her neighbors with her flouring machine. She earns a profit of approximately $4 per day. Her husband, Phout Choum, is 52 years old. Since 2007, he's been making a living by repairing motorcycles and bicycles from his home. He normally earns $6 per day. Mrs. S. has applied for a loan to help her husband buy more repair materials for his business.

loans.use: To buy repair materials

loans.name: Zulfa J.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 31 year old Zulfa M. from Mbeya. She is married with 2 children, ages 8 and 10 respectively. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependent because her parents' life situation is not good; in addition, she is a student.

Zulfa has been running a medical shop since 1997. She works at the business for 5-8 hours per day, 7 days per week and is assisted by one employee. Zulfa currently earns about 110USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 600USD in order to purchase more medicine in bulk. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity of medicine. Zulfa thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: Purchasing medicine in bulk

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline sells provisions, drinks and foodstuffs. She has been in this business for a long time. She needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs to sell. She is 42 years old and married with 8 children. She says thanks to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Omolola

texts.en: Omolola is 42 years old and married with four children. She is a LAPO client. She sells fabrics and has been in this business for a long time. She needs the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more fabrics to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fabrics to sell

loans.name: Otgontsetseg

texts.en:
Otgontsetseg G. is 40, married and has one daughter. Her family lives in a "ger" (a nomadic Mongolian tent) district in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family proudly owns the plot of land where they live. 

In 2001, she started a shoe business at Narantuul, the largest year-round outdoor market. Her business was a success, but the brutally cold Mongolian winter caused her to have health complications. Eventually she was forced to close her shoe stall at Narantuul and buy a clothing stall at Hantalst, an indoor market. 

Otgontsetseg goes to Ereen, a Chinese border city where many Mongolians buy cheap goods to resell, once a month to buy fashionable women's shoes. Her husband works as a taxi driver, and her only daughter is a university student. 

She is requesting a loan to buy shoes for the spring and summer, which are usually very busy. Otgontsetseg says, "Selling cheap shoes is not great for the customer. Consumers like cheap goods, but they also want quality. I will try to sell inexpensive but high-quality shoes in the future."

loans.use: To buy shoes for the spring and summer

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila M. is a farmer. Her specialization is rice but she also grows vegetables at the back of her house. She is 45 years old and has two children. Her husband, Jose M., is working as a bus fare collector. They work together for the future of their children.

The purpose of Mila's loan is to buy fertilizers for her farm. She thinks that by using fertilizers, she will have bigger yield. In addition to fertilizers, she will use some of her loan to start a new business to augment their income.

Mila has been a CEVI client for two years already. She receives not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and start a new business.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi A. is a 42-year-old local restaurant operator. She is married and has five children who are currently in school. She prepares and sells local foods like banku and other local dishes. Banku is a kind of dough prepared from milled maize grains and it is eaten with hot pepper sauce or soup. She says the prices of raw materials has gone up significantly and she needs the support of a loan to help meet her production costs. With the loan, she will purchase more raw materials like bags of maize, plantains, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood to prepare her meals. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her local restaurant.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en: Mrs. Lanie L., 38 years old, is a married resident of Calabayan, Ozamiz City. Lanie is a micro-entrepreneur, presently engaged in selling vegetables from the harvest of the vegetable garden that her husband, a farmer, cultivates. This vegetable garden and small riceland supports her 6 children who are still dependent on her. In times of no harvest, she also buys vegetables from neighbors who are engaged in similar gardening. She started this vegetable ‘buy and sell’ business at the time she got married with an initial capital of only PHP 1,500. Now her business is still existing and stable. She decided to join PAGLAUM MPC because of the benefits and other services that the Co-op has offered for the members. As a first time borrower, she is applying for an amount of PHP 3,000, under the Medal Pangnegosyo 2 program, to add her vegetable vending business. She is prioritizing her children’s education for their good future.

loans.use: Addional capital for her vegetable vending business.

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es: Doña Albertina O., es docente de la secundaria desde muy joven comenzó a dar clase, también vende cosméticos a sus compañeras de trabajo, y al publico en general al contado y al crédito de la quincena. Tiene 45 años de edad, reside en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Jericó tiene dos hermosos hijas una casada y una que estudia. Sus planes es apoyar a su hija para que concluya sus estudios, y pueda tener un nivel de vida mejor, con este crédito va a comprar cerámica para poner en la sala, este es su sexto ciclo el cual da las gracias ala institución  por el  apoyo ya que a través de estos préstamo ha podido hacer mejoras a su casa y así dar seguridad y estabilidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Albertina O. has been a high school teacher since she was very young. She also sells cosmetics to her co-workers and to the general public for payments in cash or on credit (monthly or bi-weekly). She is 45 years old and lives in the Jérico neighborhood of the capital city of Managua. She has two beautiful daughters; one is married, while the other is in school. Albertina plans to continue to support her daughter so that she can finish her studies and improve her quality of life. With this loan, Albertina will buy floor tiles for her living room. This is her sixth loan cycle, and she thanks the institution for its support. Thanks to these loans, she has been able to make home improvements and provide her family with security and stability.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy floor tiles for living room

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells eggs. Esther is 42 years old and married with 4 children. She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more eggs to sell. She thanks Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more eggs to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 24 years old; she is currently single and seriously preparing herself for Mr. Right. She is determined to raise her business to a higher level. To achieve that, she does not play with her work; she has been selling cosmetics with products like spray, powder, lip gloss, blouses etc. She sells on the top of a table in a community market. She has been in business for three years now. She says selling cosmetics is very lucrative and therefore she wants to expand her inventory to enable her to make good income. She is sure that your loan support will bring her to the desired results.

loans.use: To buy bulk stocks of cosmetics

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie M. is from the village of Poblacion 1 , Clarin,Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old. Elvie is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Elvie owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Elvie has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In March 2009, Elvie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products for sale. Elvie is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products for sale. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Elvie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Esperanza Del Socorro

texts.es: Esperanza del Socorro S. tiene la edad de 54 años, vive con su esposo. Doña Esperanza tiene 4 hijos y todos trabajan. La actividad económica de Esperanza es la venta de productos plásticos. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio. Inicio por que observo que muchos clientes buscaban la manera de obtener sus productos como le agrado la idea de facilitarles a sus clientes estos productos decidió seguir adelante. Sus  propósitos de  son de mejorar la calidad de sus productos para que sus clientes se encuentren satisfechos con sus productos. El financiamiento es para capital compra para la inversión de su negocio para la compra de bolsas plásticas, vasos plásticos, tasas y todos los productos plásticos.
texts.en:
Esperanza del Socorro S. is a 54-year-old woman who lives with her husband. She has 4 children who all work. She has been selling plastic goods for a living for 4 years. She launched this business because she noticed that many customers were looking for a way to obtain these products. Since she liked the idea of providing her customers with the products, she decided to move forward. Her goal is to improve the quality of her products so that her customers can be satisfied. This loan will be used as working capital to invest in purchasing plastic bags, cups, teacups, and all sorts of other plastic goods.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy is 50 years old and married with 5 children. She sells provisions, drinks and foodstuffs. She hopes for the loan amount of N50000 to purchase refrigerator to cool her drinks. She thanks you for the support.

loans.use: To purchase more refrigerator

loans.name: Maria Angelita

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres Solidarias está ubicado en el  cantón Paute a unos 45 minutos fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca, goza de un  clima templado favoreciendo para el cultivo  de flores y una gran variedad de frutas, además nos ofrece  un gran paisaje y un lugar muy hermoso para visitar.

María  Angelita Muñoz R. es socia activa del Banco  Comunal Mujeres Solidarias, formado  por un grupo de mujeres dispuestas a salir adelante con sus familias, mantienen una excelente relación de amistad tanto   dentro del banco como de su comunidad apoyándose siempre unas a otras.

María Angelita vive en la comunidad de Chican en la cantón de Paute, tiene 29 años de edad es soltera y sin niños, vive con su madre ayudándola con los gastos del hogar.  

María Angelita trabaja como empleada doméstica desde hace cinco años y nos cuenta que le va bien, además tiene criadero de pollos, cuyes y cerdos  que  los vende en la comunidad, nos manifiesta que este es su quinto ciclo y que los créditos obtenidos le han servido para comprar los animales para su corral y  seguir con su negocio. Con el nuevo préstamo que la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR le entregue  lo va a invertir en la compra de materiales como bloques, cemento,hojas de zinc, etc. para construir una chanchera para sus cerdos.

Su sueño es poder viajar al extranjero, trabajar allá y ayudar más a su madre con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Solidarias Communal Bank is located in the Paute district 45 minutes outside the city of Cuenca. It enjoys a mild climate, which favors the cultivation of flowers and a great variety of fruits. It also offers us great scenery and a very beautiful place to visit. María Angelita Muñoz R. is an active member of the Mujeres Solidarias Communal Bank. It is comprised of a group of women who are prepared to get ahead with their families. They maintain an excellent, friendly relationship within the bank and in the community. They always support one another. María Angelita lives in the Chican community in the Paute district. She is 29, single, and does not have children. She lives with her mother, and she helps her with the household expenses. María Angelita has worked as a domestic employee for five years. She tells us that it is going well for her. She also raises chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs. She sells them in the community. This is her fifth cycle. With the previous loans she bought small animals for her corral, and she kept on with her business. With the new loan from the ESPOIR Foundation she will buy materials like blocks, cement, and zinc sheets, etc. to build a pen for her pigs. Her dream is to be able to travel abroad, work there, and help her mother more with the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials like blocks, cement, and zinc sheets, etc. to build a pen for her pigs.

loans.name: Jehova Jireh Group

texts.es:
ALCOM JEHOVA JIREH

La Alcom Jehova Jireh son muy unidos y puntuales en sus pagos, eso lo demuestran en su historial crediticio. La Sra YOLANDA es la presidenta del grupo, tiene 3 hijos que gracias a su esfuerzo ya son independientes a pesar que estuvo separada del esposo por 16 años. Ella inicio su negocio a consecuencia de un problema de salud, le detectaron Diabetes y Osteoporosis, le recomendaron tomar  productos “naturales”, los consumió y en poco tiempo pudo notar muchos cambios, estos cambios también lo notaron sus familiares y amigos, es ahí donde empieza a comentar de las bondades de ese tipo de productos e inicia la venta. 

Ahora se siente muy contenta con su negocio porque gracias a ello pudo  mejorar la infraestructura de su casa y ayudar a sus hijos. Ahora es distribuidora independiente tanto local como a provincia;  realiza reuniones en su casa  denominadas  “el club de nutrición”. 

Con el préstamo obtenido, lo invertirá en comprar  diferentes productos “naturales”, de esta forma podrá atender mejor sus pedidos; pero por encima de todo, su  objetivo primordial es “mejorar la salud a otras personas”; Es por ello  que recomienda a sus compañeras a poder iniciarse en este tipo de negocio ya que sabe que con mucha perseverancia se puede alcanzar cada uno de los objetivos y metas.
texts.en:
The Alcom Jehova Jireh are a very unified and punctual with repayments group, which is clearly demonstrated in their credit history. Yolanda is the group president. She has three children who, thanks to her efforts, are all now independent despite her being separated from her husband for 16 years. She began her business as a result of a health problem; she was diagnosed with diabetes and osteoporosis for which they recommended she take "natural" products. She began taking them and soon noticed several changes. Her family and friends noticed them, too. This is where she realized the benefits of these kinds of products.
