Now, she is happy with her work because she was able to improve her house's infrastructure and help her children. She is an independent distributor, both at the local and at the provincial level. She chairs meetings, called the "nutrition club", in her home. With the loan she intends to buy various "natural" products with which to better fill her orders but, above all, her main goal is to "improve others' health". This is the reason she encourages her teammates to get involved in this kind of business since she knows that, with perseverance, one can reach each and every objective and goal.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: COMPRA DE PRODUCTOS

loans.name: Sajama 1 Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal denominado  SAJAMA 1, está conformado por doce señoras que en su mayoría radican en la misma zona de la ciudad; la característica principal de sus casas, es que son de adobe en gran parte de ellas y tienen solo una planta. El banco comunal está conformado por socias responsables y solidarias, también son alegres. Este banco está conformando por una mesa directiva; como presidenta la Sra. Julia, que se dedica a la costura confeccionando centros de pollera para las cholitas, la tesorera es la Sra. Nancy se dedica a la venta de pasteles y masitas y la secretaria es  la Sra. Jimena se dedica a la venta de artefactos varios. Las demás socias se dedican a diferentes actividades, en costura, confección de deportivos, tejidos artesanales de mantas de vicuña y alpaca y chompas,  venta de ropas, tiendas de barrio o de micro consumo, venta de carne, venta de regalos. En todo el sector comercio que las socias se dedican esta en un mercado altamente competitivo pero ellas son dedicadas a su negocio que tienen una antigüedad de más de 10 años  de antigüedad y han logrado encontrar mercado a nivel internacional. Ellas necesitan el crédito para realizar compras de materia prima e insumos como  ser lana de vicuña, alpaca y otros, también otros para comprar carne para su carnicería, compras de tela para confección de deportivo y enaguas con el fin de hacer crecer sus microempresas con un mercado fijo. Las socias están en el segundo ciclo ellas han demostrado ser responsables en esta institución y otras que tienen créditos vigentes en otras entidades financieras, sus antecedentes crediticios son positivos.
texts.en:
The communal bank called SAJAMA 1 consists of twelve women who mainly come from the same part of the city. The main feature of their houses is that they are built largely of adobe and have a single floor. The communal bank is composed of responsible, cheerful members who support one another. The bank is guided by a board of directors: the president is Julia, a seamstress who makes skirts for women; the treasurer is Nancy, who sells cakes and pastries; and the secretary is Jimena, who sells different devices. The rest of the members engage in various activities including sewing, manufacturing sports equipment, weaving handmade blankets and sweaters from vicuña and alpaca wool, selling clothing, running small or neighborhood stores, selling meat, and selling gifts. All in all, the commercial sector that the members work in is a highly competitive market, but they are dedicated to their business, which is over ten years old and for which they have found a market at the international level. They need the loan to buy raw materials and supplies such as wool from vicuñas, alpacas and other animals, meat for their butcher shops, or fabric to make sports equipment and skirts, all with the goal of making their small businesses grow in a fixed market. The members are in their second cycle and have proven themselves to be responsible with this institution; of those who have current loans with other financial institutions, their credit records are positive.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase working capital

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda D. S., 43, lives in a Habitat for Humanity village within the BASECO Compound, Port Area, Manila (an islet near the Manila harbors). She has two children. Her husband Jose, 56, is a heavy equipment operator.

Imelda has been in business for more than 20 years. She sells different fruits in a flea market near their village. She also has a small sari-sari (general) store at home.

The combined earnings from her fruits business and general store are now close to 35,000 PHP a month, although her sales are affected very much during rainy season.

She has already made a few improvements in their house from her business profits.

She became a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2007. The loans provided by the cooperative were very helpful in the growth of her business.

Imelda is now applying for a new loan in the amount of 21,000 PHP to use as additional capital for her businesses.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Additional capital for her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying cocoa

loans.name: Karanday Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Karanday del barrio Isla Aveiro de la ciudad de Limpio, se formó con integrantes del comité Restaurador del Asentamiento El Bosque Restaurador, las mismas decidieron formar un nuevo grupo con vecinas mas cercanas, actualmente el comité se encuentra en el tercer ciclo, es un grupo muy unido y esta conformado por 16 integrantes las cuales invierten en distintas actividades.

La señora Lucia M. se dedica a la venta de carnes e invirtió el dinero en la compra de carnes al por mayor para el incremento de sus negocios.
 
La señora Teofila L. se dedica a la venta de lencería y es costurera e invirtió el dinero en la compra de ropas interiores para damas y telas para la elaboración de prendas para su venta posterior.

La señora Gilda C. se dedica a la panadería e invirtió el dinero en la compra insumos para la elaboración de panificados e incrementar con ventas de pan de navidad para aprovechar las fiestas de fin de año.

La señora Clara R. se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras e invirtió el dinero en la compra de los mismos al por mayor para el incremento de su negocio, provechando la temporada.

La señora Juana R. se dedica a la venta de ropas e invirtió el dinero en la compra de productos varios tales como remeras, busos, short, pantalón, blusas, entre otros.

La señora Zulma F. se dedica a la venta de ropas e invirtió el dinero en la compra de productos varios tales como remeras, busos, short, pantalón, blusas, entre otros.
 
La señora Antonia Duré se dedica a la venta de juegos artificiales e invirtió el dinero en la compra de estos productos para aprovechar las fiestas de fin de año.

La señora Mariana Fernández tiene una despensa e invirtió el dinero en la compra de mercaderías varias para el incremento de su negocio.

La señora Jorgelina D. se dedica a la venta de perfumes e invirtió el dinero en la compra de perfumes para su venta posterior.

La señora Fidelina Fernández se dedica a la venta de verduras e invirtió el dinero en la compra de productos varios al por mayor para el incremento de sus ventas.

La señora Gladys Z. tiene una despensa e invirtió el dinero en la compra de mercaderías varias para el incremento de su negocio.

La señora Nancy V. tiene una despensa e invirtió el dinero en la compra de mercaderías varias para el incremento de su negocio.

La señora Carmen Baéz se dedica a la venta de comestibles e invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumos para la elaboración y venta de los mismos.

La señora María V. se dedica a la venta de bebidas e invirtió el dinero en la compra gaseosas y cervezas al por mayor para su venta.

La señora Elizabeth O. se dedica a la venta de helados e invirtió el dinero en la compra helados de sabores varios al por mayor para su venta.

La señora Valeria L. se dedica a la venta de ropas e invirtió el dinero en la compra de productos varios tales como remeras, busos, short, pantalón, blusas, entre otros.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Karanday” committee, located in the Isla Aveiro neighborhood in the city of Limpio, was founded by members of the rebuilding committee in charge of the housing project “El Bosque Restaurador”. The members decided to create a new group with women who live closer to each other. This very close group is composed by 16 female members who invest in different activities. Lucia M. sells meat and she used the money to buy meat in bulk to expand her business. Teofila L. sells underwear and she’s also a seamstress. She used the money to buy lady’s underwear and fabric to make clothing for sell. Gilda C. is a baker. She used the money to buy supplies to make bread and related products, so she can increase her sales during the Christmas and New Year’s season. Clara R. sells fruit and vegetables. She used the money to buy products in bulk, to expand her business taking advantage of the season. Juana R. sells clothes. She used the money to purchase several products, such as tops, hoodies, shots, pants, T-shirts, and others. Zulma F. sells clothes. She used the money to purchase several products, such as tops, hoodies, shots, pants, T-shirts, and others. Duré sells fireworks. She used the money to purchase these items and take advantage of the holiday season. Mariana Fernández owns a grocery shop. She used the money to purchase items to expand her business. Jorgelina D. sells perfumes. She used the money to purchase there items for sale. Fidelina Fernández sells vegetables. She used the money to purchase products in bulk and improve her sales. Gladys Z. owns a grocery shop. She used the money to purchase items to expand her business. Nancy V. owns a grocery shop. She used the money to purchase items to expand her business. Carmen Baéz sells food. She used the money to buy raw material to make and sell these products. María V. sells drinks. She used the money to buy soft drinks and beer in bulk for sale. Elizabeth O. sells ice cream. She used the money to purchase different flavors in bulk for sale. Valeria L. sells clothes. She used the money to purchase several products, such as tops, hoodies, shots, pants, T-shirts, and others.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase meat, T-shirts, lady's underwear, flour, fruit, vegetables, hoodies, pants, fireworks, milk, pasta, bread, napkins, oil, soft drinks, beer, ice cream, and others.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes E., 55, is a hardworking businesswoman. She is married to Juanito E., a direct seller of different products. She helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been direct selling assorted cosmetic products and branded clothes for eight years.

Mercedes has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than four years now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow 10 times in CCT’s cooperative.  She has been consistent in paying her dues because she uses the borrowed money to buy assorted cosmetics and clothes and then direct sells these to her clients. Her business lets her earn an average profit of 15,000 PHP per month.  

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a loan of 12,000 PHP. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business to buy assorted cosmetics, branded clothes and shoes.

She dreams that her business will grow into a franchise store so that she can gain big profits and experience a good status in life. 


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy assorted cosmetics, branded clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Mercedes Del Socorro

texts.es: La señor  Mercedes del Socorro S. O. tiene 58 años de edad es madre soltera pero vive acompañada de sus hijas las cuales son mayores de edad y todas están casadas, la señora S. se dedica a la venta de tortillas y sus hijas le apoyan en su negocio, dentro de las aspiraciones de la  señora esta el poder remodelar su humilde casa y dejárselas a sus hijas para que moren con su familia y que así mismo se conviva en un ambiente mas cómodo y seguro para todos, el negocio desearía tener las posibilidades de ampliarlo y diversificarlo de forma que sea el sustento de todos, para esto la señora solicita de este préstamo con el objetivo de comprar leña y maiz que aumente las ventas y que signifique mejores condiciones de vida para todos.
texts.en:
Mercedes del Socorro S. O. is 58 years old and single. She lives with her grown daughters, all of whom are married. Ms. S. sells tortillas, and her daughters assist her in her business. Among her goals are being able to remodel her humble home and give it to her daughters so they can live with their families in an environment that is more comfortable and safe for everyone, and expanding and diversifying her business so that it can support everyone. In order to do this, she is requesting this loan to buy firewood and corn, which will increase her sales and improve living conditions for everyone.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Cheikhou Omar

texts.fr:
Monsieur T. sociétaire à la caisse de liberté 6 est  commerçant de profession dans le domaine de l'informatique et bureautique il vend des produits de papeterie un cyber café Internet copieur noir et blanc fax envoie et réception il  a une expérience dans ce domaine qu'il exerce depuis plusieurs années
il sollicite un prêt de 500 000 F C FA pour acheter du matériel informatique et augmenter son fond de roulement
texts.en:
Mr. T., a member of the Liberté 6 branch office. He is a merchant by profession in the domain of computers and office supplies and equipment. He offers stationary supplies, an internet café, a black and white copier, and the sending and receiving of faxes. He has experience in this business, which he has been operating for several years. He's requesting a loan of 500,000 francs CFA to buy computer equipment and supplies and to increase his working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buyiing computer and office supplies and equipment

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en:
C. Sreymom, age 27, is married and has two young children living at home. The family lives in Takeo Province. She and her husband have business selling grilled bananas. On average, she is able to make around US $5.00 a day. 

Because this business makes a significant income, C. Sreymom would like to take a loan of US $350 to reinvest in her business. She would like to use this money to purchase a motorbike and a trailer so that she and her husband can transport and sell grilled bananas around the village.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her food business

loans.name: Kheng

texts.en:
Mrs. Kheng D., a 25-year-old married woman who lives in Preaek Ruessei village, Kandal Province, is a tailor earning a small income to improve her family's living standards. Her husband, Mr. Vong Noun, is an iron welder who also makes a small income to help support the family. In order to support her husband's business, Mrs. Kheng D. is requesting a loan to buy more metals to make doors to sell. She hopes this loan will help to increase her family's income.

This couple has one child who is too young to study or work. Her husband is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more metals

loans.name: Honorata

texts.es:
Honorata pertenece al banco comunal “Reyna de los Ángeles”, es natural de Urubamba, tiene 35 años, tiene dos hijos (Miguel Angel de 15 años y Maria Estefani de 13 años). Ella es una madre responsable que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus menores hijos.

Honorata se dedica a la venta de verduras como por ejemplo lechuga, culandro, huacatay y perejil, ella nos cuenta que no  tiene una chacra propia pero tiene que alquilar una chacra para sembrar sus productos, ella después de cosechar sus productos manda y vende a las vendedoras del mercado de Huancaro. Ya son 7 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo  La socia nos cuenta que tiene clientes fijos que le hacen pedido de las verduras, pues sus productos son de calidad y sus clientes se encuentran contentos. El anhelo de la socia es sacar profesionales a sus hijos.  

Honorata requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas como por ejemplo lechuga, perejil y huacatay, ella también va comprar abono para la chacra.     

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Honorata is a member of the “Reyna de los Ángeles” (Queen of Angels) communal bank. She’s from Urubamba, 35-years-old, and has two children (Miguel Angel, 15, and Maria Estefani, 13). She is a responsible mother who seeks every opportunity to get ahead with her daily effort and provide a better future for her children. Honorata is a vegetable merchant. She sells such items as: lettuce, coriander, huacatay (native Peruvian herb related to marigold and tarragon) and parsley. She tells us that she does not own her own fields so she must lease land to grow her products. Once she harvests, she sends it to market vendors in Huancaro’s market to sell. She has been in this line of work for 7 years now and has done well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. She tells us that she has regular customers that order her vegetables because her products are of good quality and her customers are satisfied. Her dream is to see her children become professionals. Honorata needs funds to buy seed like: lettuce, parsley and huacatay; she also will buy manure for her fields. She is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more baby items and clothes to sell

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Rosela N. is a 56-year old woman who lives in Common Brgy Daan Banua, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by running a general store, selling fish and shrimp. Her husband, Jacinto, is 59 and the caretaker of a fish pond. They have four children between 22 and 33 years old. Three of their children are currently employed while the other one just graduated from college.

Rosela joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1992 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income with her fish store. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 28,000.

Rosela is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 25,000 was used to fund operations for her fish vending business which had a positive impact on both the business and on the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing  for her 17th cycle loan, the amount of Php 27,000, which she intends to use on her general store. Rosela is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon -- a title of esteem bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional capital for her businesses

loans.name: Lilas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama LILAS, esta ubicado en el Estado D. Morelos. El grupo esta conformado por 10 integrantes.

L. señorita Oliva Castañeda ocupa el puesto D. Presidenta  del grupo tiene 28 años D. edad, venD. zapatos por catalogo.

L. señora María del Rosario, es viuda y se dedica a L. venta D. comida desD. hace 15 años, cuando falleció su Mamá, al no tener ingresos, sus vecinas le dijeron que vendiera gorditas D. manteca con atole, ya que su situación económica era muy difícil, su esposo  no tenia trabajo y le ayudaba, años mas tarD. falleció el señor y elL. continuo con el negocio, mismo que hoy en día le permite salir adelante. Con el paso D. los años fue consolidando y complementando el giro y hoy en día venD. gordas entre semana y pozole los fines D. semana (ambos son platillos típicos). L. señora tiene problemas D. salud, el trabajo le ayuda a no deprimirse. Solicita el crédito para dar mantenimiento a su negocio y surtirlo D. materias primas.
texts.en:
This group is called LILAS and is located in the State of Morelos. It is maD. up of ten members. Oliva serves as the group’s president and is 28 years old. She sells shoes through a catalog. María is a widow who sells food and began doing so 15 years ago when her mother passed away. She did not have a source of income, so her neighbors suggested that she begin selling gorditas and atole. Her economic situation was not very good, and her husband was unemployed, he helped as he could, but years later he also passed away. She continued with the business and it allows her to get ahead. Over time she consolidated and complemented the business and today she sells gorditas during the week and pozole on the weekends. (both are typical dishes) She has problems with her health and the work helps keep her from getting depressed. She is asking for this loan in order to be able to maintain her business and stock it with supplies and ingredients.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies and Ingredients

loans.name: Selvina

texts.en:
Selvina is a married woman with two children, 1 girl in secondary school and 1 boy in primary school. Her husband is employed. She sells charcoal to her neighbors and passersby.

Selvina has been running the business for five years and before she was unemployed. With the KES 80,000 loan, she wants to add more stock of charcoal and start selling coconuts at a wholesale price.

Her main business challenge is coping with harassment from the tax collectors. She would like to build her own house in future as she currently lives in a rented home with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food. She decided to join Yehu so as to access loans for her business and to improve her living standards.

loans.use: Buy 80 sacks of charcoal and 800 coconuts

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is a small-business owner in New York who sells beauty products to Hispanic beauty salons. He started his business in order to be more independent and to increase his income. He started his business with only $500 capital and has expanded the business and clientele over the past two years. His pride comes from selling products that are of high quality and from making beauty salons look more professional. He enjoys his job because he is constantly meeting new people and business owners.

With his loan, Jose will be able to repair his car, which he uses daily to travel between clients. He personally delivers his products and checks in with the clients he has sold to. His loan from ACCION USA will allow him to make improvements to his car so it is more adequate for his job. This will allow him to be able to sell to more clients, which will expand his business and allow him to invest in more high-end products.

One of Jose's goals for the future is to grow his business by expanding the selection of products he sells and his client base. With this loan, he'll have more security and will be able to better serve his clients. Jose has had one previous loan with ACCION USA, which was very helpful in developing his business early on. He is very motivated by Kiva lenders and hopes that those who have the business aptitude will also have the chance to get a loan for their business.

loans.use: To make repairs to his car, which is used to deliver products

loans.name: Badenya 4 Group

texts.fr:
Badenya 4 est un regroupement de dix femmes mariées majoritairement dans des grandes familles traditionnelles. Elles ont un âge moyen de 34 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le village de Zambougou Fouta dans la commune rurale de Tesserela dans la 4ème région administrative du Mali, qu’est Ségou. Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de mariage. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs superficies de culture, les membres du groupe ont fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er  cycle de prêt de campagne. 
Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du sésame.
Madame Adiara C. compte acheter avec son prêt 3 sacs de complexe céréale, 25kg de grains d’arachide et recruter la main d’œuvre pour les activités de labour et de sarclage dans son champ d’arachide. 
Elle se ravitaille en intrants agricoles à la foire de Gouassola et recrute des jeunes dans le village. 
Avec une superficie de 3 hectares, elle compte produire 28 sacs d’arachide, 3 sacs de mil, 6 sacs de sésame. 
Une partie de la récolte du mil et de l’arachide est auto consommée tandis que le reste est vendu. 
Le bénéfice obtenu est utilisé pour acheter des condiments dans les foires et assurer les soins de santé des membres du foyer. 
Madame Adiara C. à l’image des autres femmes de Badenya 4 a pour objectif d’assurer l’auto suffisance alimentaire dans le village.
texts.en:
Group 4 (of the association Badenya de Zambougou Fouta) is composed of six married women mostly in large traditional families.  The group members average 34 years of age and two children each, and they all live in the village of Zambougou Fouta, in the rural community of Tesserela (in Segou, the 4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  They women know one another through ties of kinship and marriage. With the goal of expanding their arable land, the group members turned to the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first farm loan cycle.  They grow peanuts, millet, and sesame.  Ms. Adiara C. plans to use her loan for buying three sacks of a fertilizer blend for grains and 25 kg of peanut seeds and for recruiting labor for plowing and seeding in the peanut field.  She gets her farm supplies at the Gouassola fair and recruits youngsters in the village.  With three hectares of land, she plans on producing 28 sacks of peanuts, 3 sacks of millet, and 6 sacks of sesame.  Part of the millet and peanut harvests will be consumed at home, while the rest will be sold.   The profits obtained will be used to buy some condiments at the fairs and to ensure the health care of members of the household.  Ms. Adiara C., like the other women of Group 4, has the goal of having enough food to be self-sufficient in the village. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fertilizer and seeds and to pay for workers

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen K. is currently in the business of selling both dried and fresh fish at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more fish and some tomatoes to sell.

Hellen is 41 years old and is married to a director. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

loans.use: To stock more fish and some tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Quang

texts.en: Quang T. D. was born in 1958. She has two pigs and 200 chickens. She has two children, a son and a daughter, who go to school. Her husband is retired. They have a monthly income of about 4,000,000 VND. She has participated in SEDA since 2006 and repaid punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 5,450,000 VND in order to buy food for her pigs and chickens.

loans.use: in order to buy food for her pigs and chickens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To extend his arable land and to purchase agricultural inputs

loans.name: Grace Luzili

texts.en:
Grace Luzili is 24 years old and is married to Francis M. who is a cereal seller. They both bring in an income of Kshs 15,000 which they use in support and supplementing the family needs. They have three school-going children aged 6 years, 4 years and 2 years. They live in Migori town.

Grace is in the business of selling sweet potatoes and has been in this business for the last three years. (She is the lady in a red top and the other ladies are her colleagues in the market). She is applying for a loan of Kshs 15,000, this being the first loan that she is accessing from KADET after being introduced by a friend. She intends to use the money to buy more sweet potatoes to add to her stock.

Grace hopes to build a permanent home for the family in the future.

loans.use: To buy more sweet potatoes to add to her stock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more door locks, knives, cutlasses, hinges, nails, etc.

loans.name: Kikoni Bakyara Tweyambe Group

texts.en:
The determined Hadija N., aged 38 years, is a go getter business woman who has been dealing in the sale of sweet yellow bananas from Ntungamo as one of her agricultural products. This stickler for hard work and also a married mother of 6 children, has basked in the career graces of her grocery business for over 10 years. With this experience behind her, she has managed to subdue most of the uncertain adversities that have threatened to play havoc with her business.

In a month her business generates her a profit of 120,000 Ugandan shillings. This to all intents and purposes a low figure compared to the responsibilities cut out of her. What has played into her hands as she operates her business has been her exceptional customer relationship skills. As it is now she is taking a long view with an aim of maximizing her small profits. She figures this loan will come in significantly handy in helping her buy more stock as she looks at expansion.

Hadija belongs to Kikoni Bakyara Tweyambe group in Ntungamo.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of yellow bananas.

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah is a farmer from Nyamira town in western Kenya. She has been farming for two years. Her mixed farm produces maize and beans which she sells at the local market. She also operates a kiosk that supplements her farming income.

Zipporah has requested this loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will help her pay school fees for her children and improve the standard of living of her family. Her biggest challenges have been drought, which affects her products, and price fluctuations which affect her income. In the future, she would like to increase the number of her dairy cows and buy more land for farming. 

Zipporah is 23 years old. She is married with two children, ages 5 months and 8 years old. Her eldest child attends school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza T. is from the village of San Isidro, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 42 years old. Eliza is married and has three children. To make a living, Eliza owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, biscuits, & junk foods in the local community. Eliza has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Eliza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eliza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Eliza is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Eliza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena B. is from the village of Sampagar, Damulog, Bukidnon. She is 33 years old. Rowena is single. To make a living, Rowena owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, and snack foods in the local community. Rowena has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rowena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rowena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Rowena is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rowena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Rosendo

texts.es: El Sr. Rosendo tiene 31 años de edad, casado con la señora Carla, tienen 2 hijos , Don Rosendo es un hombre que trabajo desde sus 20 años de edad en una propiedad cuidando  animales (vaca caballo ovejas gallinas y/u otros ) luego años después se dedico a la elaboración de queso, ahora actualmente don Rosendo se encarga de distribuir quesos a los supermercados de Santa Cruz  de la sierra. El crédito que se le otorgo al cliente es para terminar de construir un cuarto compra de (cerámicas cemento pinturas). El cliente  manifestó su agradecimiento por la rapidez del crédito y lo bien que lo atendieron en la Institución.
texts.en: Rosendo is 31 years old and married to Carla.  They have two children.  Rosendo is a man who has been working since he was 20 years old in a property taking care of animals (cows, horses, sheep, chickens and/or others).  Then years later, he began making cheese.  Now Rosendo is in charge of distributing cheese to the supermarkets of Santa Cruz de la Sierra.  The loan granted to Rosendo is to finish the construction of a room and to buy pottery, cement, and paintings.  Rosendo expresses his gratitude for the speed of the loan, and how well the Institution serves him.

loans.use: To buy pottery, cement, and paintings

loans.name: Kenia Katiuska

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres En Acción.

En este lugar encontramos a Kenya. Tiene 22 años de edad y es madre soltera de un hijo de 4 años el mismo que estudia en jardín de infantes. Vive en la casa de sus padres. Ella es auxiliar de enfermería. Además también es comerciante.

Tiene un local en el centro comercial Bahía Rio en la ciudad de Portoviejo, en el cual vende ropa de todo tipo y productos Yanbal (productos de cosméticos, belleza, perfumería y accesorios de damas) trabaja los días de la semana desde las 9am hasta las 17h00, lo que más vende es ropa para niños, nos cuenta que lleva con su local ya por cuatro años y que a pesar de la crisis económica le va bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa como: pantalones, blusas, camisas, ropa de niños, etc. Este es su cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y está muy contenta le gusta las facilidades para conseguir los créditos  Sus sueños son tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the members of the 'Mujeres en Acción' (Women in Action) community bank meet in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí.  This city has been known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarind Trees.

Here we meet 22 year-old Kenia.  She is a single mother and has a 4 year-old son who is in nursery school.  She lives in her parents' home.  Kenia is a nursing assistant.  She is also a saleswoman.

Kenia has premises in the Bahía Rio shopping mall in the city of Portoviejo.  She sells all kinds of clothes and Yanbal products (cosmetics, beauty products, perfumes and ladies' accessories).  She works every day of the week from 9.00am to 5.00pm.  What she sells the most of are children's clothes.  She tells us that she has had her premises for four years and, in spite of the economic crisis, things are going well.

Kenia will use her loan to buy clothes such as pants, blouses, shirts, children's clothes, etc.  This is her fourth loan cycle with her community bank and she is very happy.  She likes the ease with which she can obtain loans.  Her dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, shirts, children's clothes, etc.

loans.name: Sharon Rose

texts.en:
Sharon Rose, 34 years old, is from the town of Banga. She is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she plants and harvests rice and corn for sale and also grows pigs for fattening. She sells the pigs to the market.

Sharon Rose joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and feeds. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and feeds

loans.name: Ramón Daniel

texts.es:
Es Señor Ramón Daniel D. es trabajador de Instituto Nacional Tecnológico, desempeñando el cargo de Mercadólogo desde hace 3 años.
Es casado, con una persona a su cargo en edad escolar.
Este es el tercer crédito que trabaja en CEPRODEL, lo solicita para la compra de materiales de construcción para dos cuartos en su casa, va a comprar arena, Piedrín, cemento, perlínes. Hierro, zinc etc
texts.en: Mr. Ramón Daniel has worked for the National Technological Institute for the past three years teaching marketing. He is married to one of his former students. This is his third loan with CEPRODEL. He is asking for the loan in order to buy materials to be used to build two rooms in his house. He will buy sand, gravel, iron, zinc, etc.

loans.use: He will buy construction materials to build two rooms in his house. There materials will include: zinc,cement, gravel and sand.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica D. P. is a married woman who lives in the municipality of Bantayan on the island of Cebu, a part of the Visayas islands. She has two businesses: selling crab and other sea foods and operating a sari-sari (variety) store. Her husband, Teresito D. P., 49 years old, works as a fisherman and helps with his wife's business activities. They have two children who are nineteen and eight years old.

Veronica joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past eight loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Veronica has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 18,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 20,000 PHP, so lifting the family's standard of living.

Veronica is now borrowing 25,000 PHP, which she intends to use to fund her businesses. She wants to continue to save up for the future and give her children a good education and improve their lives. Veronica is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a dollar a day to achieving realities beyond their dreams. They are on a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon—a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund her business operations

loans.name: Yoeun's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of six members who live in Tep Archun village in Kandal province.

Mrs. Yoeun S., born in 1967, is the group leader. She was selected to be the group leader by the other members. She and her husband, Mr. Long Sitha, are farmers.  They own a plot of land on which they grow different vegetables to support the family. The farming does not produce enough money to support it. Thus, Mrs. Yoeun S. would like to ask for a loan to pay to hire farm laborers, and to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and gasoline for growing crops. 
This couple has two children.   One is a vegetable transporter and one is attending a local school.

loans.use: To pay to hire farming laborers, and to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and gasoline for growing crops.

loans.name: Ilgar

texts.ru:
Ilgar A. 39 let. On jenat i imeyet odnoqo rebonka. Ilgar yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet vmeste so svoyey semyoy v Fuzuli regione. 
Ilgar uje 10 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom. Etomu biznessu on uchilsya u svoyeqo otca kotoriy toje bil skotovodom. Ilgar ochen lubit svoyu rabotu i on vseqda xochet imet razvitiye v svayom biznesse. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit yeshe korov. Ilgar v osnovnom iz moloka delayet Kefir i prodayet yeqo v magazini.
texts.en: Ilgar A. is 39 years old.  He is married and has a child.  Ilgar is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city, and now he and his family live in the Fuzuli region. Ilgar has been a herdsman for ten years.  He learned this business from his father who was also a herdsman.  Ilgar loves his work and is always looking for ways to develop his business.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN to buy another cow.  Ilgar makes kefir from the milk and then sells it in shops.

loans.use: buy a cow to expand his business

loans.name: Changamuka Group

texts.fr: Kahambu Joséphine  est entrepreneur, leader du groupe d’affaire Changamuka, âgée de 32 ans, mariée, mère de 4 enfants.  Son conjoint est un fonctionnaire de l’Etat dans une entreprise publique  «  la REGIDESO ». La  cliente  Kahambu Joséphine est vendeuse des souliers usagers.  Elle installe ses marchandises au marché « CADECO » dans le centre ville de Goma. Il ya 10 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité.  En 2009, elle bénéficia de premier crédit de l’IMF Hekima de 50$ pour  renforcer  son capital. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  des nouvelles marchandises (25 paires de souliers usagers).  En plus, elle ambitionne pérenniser  son entreprise,  ouvrir  un dépôt de vente poissons salés. La cliente Kahambu Joséphine remercie l’IMF Hekima pour  ses actions dédiées aux pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Le groupe Changamuka est constitué de 33 membres.Cependant, une cliente détient son enfant sur cette photo et 2 autres clients, leurs figures demeurent invisibles sur cette photo de groupe.
texts.en: Joséphine  Kahambu is an entrepreneur and the leader of the Changamuka work group. She is 32 years old, married, and the mother of four. Her husband is a governmental employee in a public sector company named La Regideso.  Joséphine  Kahambu sells used  shoes. She sets up her wares at the Cadeco market in the center of town of Goma. She has been in this business for 10 years. In 2009, she obtained her first loan of $50 from IMF Hekima in order to increase her working capital. This new loan will allow her to replenish her stock with additional goods (25 pairs of used shoes). In addition,sher goal and to open a store selling salted fish. As a client of IMF Hekima, Joséphine  Kahambu is grateful for its actions oriented towards poor women who do not have access to traditional banking. The Changamuka group is composed of 33 members. However, one of the client also has her child in the photo, and there are two other clients whose faces can’t be seen on this group photo.

loans.use: to purchase 25 pairs of used shoes

loans.name: 12 Hoang Thinh - Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
"Hoa Hoang Thi (43) is a 53 year-old female living in the town of Hoang hoa - Thanh hoa.  Hoa is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 08.04.12 Hoang Thinh - Hoang Hoa.

Hoa is married and has 2 adult children.  To making a living, Hoa operates a family member's business venture running a general store.  The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community.  Hoa has been engaged in this business for over 7 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2003, Hoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Hoa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000,000 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.  The loan will be the 7th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Hoa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Thong Vien thi (45) is a 61 year-old female who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  Quy Nguyen Thi (44) is a 56 year-old female who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.


3.  Hoa Hoang Thi (9) is a 41 year-old female who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


4.  Hoan Le Thi (2) is a 36 year-old female who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


5.  Son Le Thi (56) is a 37 year-old female who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Hoa Hoang Thi (43) là 53 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoang hoa - Thanh hoa.  Hoa là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành V..  Mặc dù mỗi thành V. trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành V. trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 0804012 Thon 4 - Hoang Thinh - Hoang Hoa (0804012 Thon 4 - Hoang Thinh - Hoang Hoa).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán các loại sản phẩm khác nhau trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Hoa thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 7 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hoa kiếm được khoảng 2,000,000 VND.  Vào 2003, Hoa đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hoa đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5,000,000 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,000,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 7th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Thong Vien thi (45) là 61 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Quy Nguyen Thi (44) là 56 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


3.  Hoa Hoang Thi (9) là 41 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  Hoan Le Thi (2) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


5.  Son Le Thi (56) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to baby livestock to raise

loans.name: Jocelyne

texts.fr: Née en 1983 à Avrankou, dans le département de l'Ouémé, Jocelyne vit depuis cinq ans à Sèdjè à Avrankou. Jocelyne est mariée à Pierre, un marchand, et est mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Jocelyne n'a pas été à l'école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Jocelyne mène comme activité principale, la vente de nourriture (pâte de maïs accompagnée de sauce, farine de manioc) ; ce qui lui permet d'assurer les besoins de sa famille. De façon secondaire, Jocelyne vend des boissons à son domicile. Jocelyne achète ses produits à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. En vue de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Jocelyne sollicite pour la deuxième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Les crédits précédemment obtenus ont tous été bien remboursés. Dans l'avenir, Jocelyne désire acquérir une parcelle.
texts.en:
Born in 1983 in Avrankou, in the department of Oueme, Jocelyne has been living in Sedje for five years. Jocelyne is married to Pierre, a salesman, and is a mother of two; both children attend school. The couple jointly takes care of the household's various expenses. Jocelyne did not go to school.
To provide for her expenses, Jocelyne's main occupation is food retailing (corn paste with sauce, cassava flour); this allows her to support her family. Jocelyne supplements this activity by selling beverages door-to-door. Jocelyne purchases her products in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. In order to meet her clientele's needs, Jocelyne is requesting financial help from ALIDe for the second time. The loans she was granted before well all correctly paid back. In the future, Jocelyne wishes to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase corn, cassava flour and beverages

loans.name: Yoel

texts.es: Yoel, de 27 años de edad, convive con su pareja Zaida y fruto de relación tienen 01 hijo llamado Jharlim de 03 años y juntos residen en su propia casa en la comunidad de Villa Quintiarina, anexo del distrito de Quimbiri. Yoel aún cuando era adolescente trabajaba en las tierras de sus padres, pero hace 05 años logró comprarse su propia parcela de 06 hectáreas en donde cultiva cacao y café.  La clave de su éxito radica en la creatividad y las ganas de trabajar, sus plantas están trabajadas de manera tecnificada porque recibe capacitación de los Ingenieros Agrónomos de manera periódica. Su  producto con mayor demanda es el grano de cacao, debido a la calidad del producto que los ofrece y fruto de ello percibe buenos réditos económicos. Normalmente trabaja solo, pero en tiempos de cosecha contrata jornaleros, para que pueda avanzar rápidamente con la extracción y selección de su producto. Su plan a futuro es seguir ampliando su producción agrícola para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, y con ello mejorar su condición de vida. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, sabe que este aporte le será de mucha utilidad en el progreso de su trabajo. Con el crédito solicitado contratará jornaleros para que le apoyen en las cosechas y desmonte de maleza.
texts.en: Yoel is 27 years old and he lives with his partner, Zaida. They have one son from their relationship, named Jharlim and he is 3 years old. They live together in a house which they own in the community of Villa Quintiarina, an annex to the district of Quimbiri. When Yoel was still an adolescent he worked his parents' land. But 5 years ago he managed to purchase a parcel of land measuring 6 hectares where he cultivates cocoa and coffee. The key to his success has been his creativity and his eagerness to work. His plants benefit from being cared for in a technical manner. He received training from the Agricultural Engineers periodically. The product in greatest demand is the cocoa beans, given the quality of the product that he offers and the income earned from these grains is good. He usually works alone but during the harvest he hires farm hands to help him advance in the harvest quickly. His plan for the future is to keep expanding his agricultural production to be able to satisfy his clients' demands. He will be able to improve the quality of his life. This is his first loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and he knows that his support will be a great help in the development of his work. With the loan that he requests he will hire farmhands to help him with the harvest and to help him combat against plagues.

loans.use: to hire farmhands to help him combat against plagues.

loans.name: Aloyce

texts.en:
Aloyce is a hardworking man. He does welding to earn his living. He has been in the business for two years. He is also employed.  

Aloyce joined Faulu Kenya because he wanted to access business loans easily. Through Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save his money. In five years, he hopes to grow his clientele. He has requested for 15,000 KES to buy a welding machine.

loans.use: To buy a welding machine.

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
Rani is married with two sons and two daughters. Her sons are factory workers while her daughters stay at home and help Rani in her business and household work.
Rani does embroidery work from her home. She is very skillful and prepares beautiful embroidered dresses on order. She is also a very good housewife and performs her routine work very well. Her husband is involved in an animal sales business. He buys goats and sheep from the animal market at cheap rates, raises them up and sells them to customers at a profit. Rani has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband's business. With the loan, he will buy animals, like goats and sheep, for resale. He has been in this business for the past five years and Rani is hopeful that an investment will help him make better profits.

loans.use: to buy animals for her husband's animal sales business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy sacks of manure and sheep.

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es: Maximiliana, natural de la ciudad de Quimbiri de 48 años de edad, madre de 04 hijos por quienes vela a diario y en futuro promisorio hacer de ellos hombres de bien. Ella esta casada con Faustino de 49 años y cuentan con casa propia situada en el distrito de Quimbiri. Maximiliana desde muy niña sus padres le inculcaron a ganarse la vida y a comprarse sus propias prendas de vestir y pagar sus estudios con el esfuerzo de si misma. Ella tuvo una infancia muy dura de la cual tuvo que salir a base de trabajo y perseverancia. A sus 17 años se independizó y dejó de ser empleada y abrió su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes, que inicialmente lo hacía dentro de la casa de sus padres y con el transcurso del tiempo compró su propio lote de terreno donde actualmente se sitúa la bodega de la señora Maximiliana. Ella es una mujer de armas tomar y señala que uno logra su propósito a base de perseverancia. Hoy se siente a gusto con la actividad que realiza y con los buenos ingresos que obtiene, es mas ella tiene casi todo los productos que sus clientes requieren, además que ofrece una buena atención a sus clientes y hace que la bodega de Maximiliana sea tan concurrida pues no hay cliente que no desearía  ir a comprarle una migaja de sus productos. Ella necesita el crédito para seguir prosperando y prestando buen servicio a sus consumidores. Necesita comprar balanza, mostradores, y mesas para exhibir su mercadería y sabe que lo logrará gracias al apoyo de los financistas. Este será su tercer  crédito de Maximiliana y esta muy contenta de saber que obtendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de comprar lo que necesita para su negocio. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles comprará, balanza, mostradores y mesas.
texts.en:
Maximiliana, age 48, is from the city of Quimbiri.  She has four sons whom she watches over daily.  They have a bright future, and will see to it that they become honorable men. She is married to Faustino, age 49.  They have their own house in the Quimbiri district.

Ever since she was a young girl her parents taught her to earn a living, to buy her owns clothes, and to pay for her education through her own efforts.  She had a very difficult childhood, and she had to leave due to her work and her perseverence.  She became independent when she was 17.  She stopped being an employee and opened her own business, a grocery store.  In the beginning the business was in her parents’ house.  As time passed she bought a piece of land where Maximiliana’s store is now situated.

She is a capable woman, and she indicates that one achieves their goal through perseverance.  She is now comfortable with her business activity and with the income that she gets.  She has almost all of the products that her customers need.  Also, she provides good customer service.  This makes Maximiliana’s store very popular.  There is not a customer who does not wish to go shopping to buy some of her products.

She needs the loan to continue prospering and providing good service to her consumers.  She needs to buy a scale, counters, and tables to display her merchandise.  She knows that she will do it thanks to the support of the lenders.  This will be Maximiliana’s third loan.  She is very happy to know that she will get financial support because, with that support, she feels certain that she will buy what she needs for her business.  She will use the 2,000 soles to buy a scale, counters, and tables.

loans.use: to buy a scale, counters, and tables for her store.

loans.name: Meck

texts.en:
30 year old Meck is a garment factory worker. Her husband is a construction worker, and their combined income is $7 per day. They have 3 children; two are studying and the third is in construction with his father. 

Every month, Meck has to spend $24 on food and $20 on other family expenses.  She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy a motorbike for her husband, so he can start a taxi business when he is not working construction. He knows how to repair motorbikes, so Meck wants to set up a small motorbike repair shop for him at home when they have enough resources to do it.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Joyner

texts.en:
Joyner is 30 years old. She is married and has 5 children between 13 and 5.

Joyner has been practicing mixed farming for the last 10 years in her home area of Eldoret in North Rift, Kenya. Her farm produces potatoes, vegetables, maize, and milk which she sells locally.  She also runs a retail shop business.

Joyner has made a loan request of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to fund the purchase and insurance of a dairy cow.  She is optimistic that her expanded business will uplift her family's living standards.  

Joyner aspires to grow her business into a wholesale one and own pedigreed dairy animals.   She however laments about the poor market prices for farm products.

loans.use: purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Juana Patricia

texts.es: Juana, de 33 años es conviviente y madre de dos hijos de 15 y 07 años con quienes vive en casa de los padres de su pareja.Juana tiene como trabajo la venta de abarrotes y otros productos de primera necesidad el cual  realiza en casa de sus suegros. Se despierta temprano al mercado a realizar la compra de los productos de diario como pollo; verduras y algunos tubérculos; cuando vuelve saca los productos a la vereda de la casa y empieza con la venta. Tiene 5 años en esta actividad que realiza sola.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede utilizar su tiempo para hacer otras actividades, además cuando tiene un tiempo libre se va al mercado a vender algunos productos, sobre todo sabanas y cochas. Sin embargo lo único que no  le gusta de su trabajo es tener que mover todos los días sus productos ya que su venta es en la casa de sus suegros y tiene que colocarlos en el espacio que sus suegros le dieron.Este es el décimo préstamo entre Juana Patricia y la institución MFP, le gusta trabajar con su grupo porque hasta ahora no tiene inconvenientes y espera poder seguir así.Con el préstamo solicitado de 2500 soles ella comprará productos y abarrotes para su tienda.
texts.en:
Juana, 33, has a spouse and is the mother of two children who are 15 and 7 years old.  They all live in her spouse’s parents’ house.  

Juana works selling groceries and other basic need items at her in-laws’ house.  She wakes up early and goes to the market to make her daily purchase of such items like chicken, vegetables, a few tubers.  When she returns home, she displays her products on the path alongside the house and starts her sales.  

She’s been in this line of work for five years and she does it alone.  What she enjoys about her work is being able to use her time to do other things.  When she has free time she goes to the market to sell other products, especially sheets and bedspreads.  However, the only thing she doesn’t like about her work is having to move her products daily because the sales take place at the house of her in-laws and she has to place them in the space her in-laws gave her.

This is Juana Patricia’s 10th loan with MFP.  She enjoys working with her group because, to date, she’s had no inconveniences and she hopes to continue that way.  She will use the requested 2500 soles to buy products and groceries for her store.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es: Cesar Augusto tiene su negocio que es la venta de productos plásticos. Hace más de dos años, inicio por la necesidad de no poder trabajar en su profesión, uno de sus mayores desafíos obtener ventas diariamente  ya que algunas veces no obtienes muchas ganancias, por lo que cesar tiene que andar bajo sol buscando a sus clientes. El sueño de cesar es poder tener un local en donde pueda recibir mejor a sus clientes. El préstamo es para la compra de bolsa, platos desechables, cucharas, vasos.
texts.en: Cesar Augusto has had a business selling plastic products for over two years. He started it out of need, as he was unable to work in his profession. One of his greatest challenges is obtaining daily sales since sometimes he does not make much money. For this reason he has to walk around under the sun in search of customers. His dream is to be able to have a store where he can better receive his customers. This loan is for the purchase of bags, disposable plates, spoons, cups.

loans.use: to purchase bags, disposable plates, spoons, cups

loans.name: Sop Cheikh Ibra Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Cheikh Ibra est créé le 14 décembre 2008, Il est composé de 10 femmes qui ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

La présidente Dieumb est une femme de 62 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Sur la photo elle est à droite et vêtue de grand boubou rose et emmitouflée d'une écharpe blanche.

Elle est commerçante. Elle vend des habits et des chaussures. Elle mène cette activité depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle s'approvisionne à Dakar ou dans la ville même. Elle a une bonne expérience dans son domaine d'activité.

Avec Son crédit elle voudrait renforcer son commerce.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle participe aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
The solidarity group called Sop Cheikh Ibra was created on December 14, 2008. It is made up of 10 women whose principal activity is small-scale retailing. 

The president, Dieumb, is a woman of 62, married, and the mother of six children. In the photo she is ..... 

She is a merchant, selling clothing and shoes. She has been in this business for more than 10 years. She buys her merchandise in Dakar or in her own town. She has a good deal of experience in her field. 

With her loan, she wants to bolster her business. With her profit, she shares in covering family needs.

loans.use: to strengthen her business.

loans.name: Amada Petita

texts.es:
Amanda Petita tiene 60 años de edad, es soltera tiene dos hijos pero no viven con ella, ella vive sola,  en el Canton Chillanes Provincia de Bolivar.

La V.R.C se llama EL PLACER perteneciente al Canton Chillanes parroquia San Jose del Tambo esta ubicada a 60 minutos de la oficina, en esta ventanilla hay 24 socios que se dedican a la agricultura a la siembra de Platano, arroz, yuca, cacao, soya y naranja ademas crian animales de corral.

Amanda  se dedica a la siembra de arroz, maiz, naranja, soya y platano, ademas cria pollos para la venta. Las compras las realiza en San Jose del Tambo y las Vende en el mercado de Chillanes los domingos en la feria.

El credito lo solicita para comprar de insumos agricolas y fertilizantes y alimento para los pollos. El credito le ayudara como apoyo para mejorar la cosecha y la venta de los pollos. Enfreta desafios como la edad y la salud. Su sueño es tener casa propia.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir a camniar.
texts.en:
Amanda Petita, 60, is single and has two children but they don’t live with her; she lives alone in Chillanes Canton, Bolivar Province.

The communal bank is called “El Placer” (Pleasure) and it belongs to Chillanes Canton, San Jose del Tambo Parish, and located 60 minutes from the office.  This communal bank has 24 members who are banana, rice, manioc, cocoa bean, soy and orange farmers; they also raise barnyard animals.

Amanda is a rice, corn, orange, soy and banana farmer; she also raises chickens to sell.  She makes her purchases in San Jose del Tambo and her sales at the Sunday Chillanes market.

She is asking for the loan to buy farming supplies, fertilizer and chicken feed.  The loan will serve as support to improve the crops and the chicken sales.  She faces challenges like age and health.  Her dream is to have a house of her own.  She likes going for walks in her free time.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies, fertilizer and chicken feed.

loans.name: Donitila

texts.es:
La señora Donitila es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Productivas del Distrito Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y tiene 5 hijos.
Recién lleva 3 ciclos trabajando con los préstamos de  Manuela Ramos y sus préstamos lo invirtió en el negocio familiar que tienen, su hijo es el que se encarga del negocio cuando tiene que realizar algunos trámites, tiene un taller de mecánica y su hijo es el que le ayuda con el trabajo.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: repuestos para implementar un poco más el negocio, 1 caja de bujías, 1 balde de grasa, ½ docena de cámaras, cable para embrague, 1 caja de aceite, ½ ciento de pernos.   
Su esposo es comerciante independiente que compra y vende madera, es corredor de madera y le va bien porque el también aporta dinero para implementar sus negocio.  Ambos están muy agradecidos con Manuela Ramos porque han tenido una gran ayuda para iniciar sus negocio familiar
texts.en:
Donitila is a member of the 'Mujeres Productivas' community bank which is based in Calleria district, in Ucayali department.  She is 43 years old, married, and has five children.

Donitila has been working with Manuela Ramos loans for three loan cycles.  She invested her loans in her family business.  Her son is the one who looks after the business when she has other business to attend to.  She has an auto repair shop and her son helps her with the work.

With this new loan for 1,000 soles, Donitila will buy spare parts with which to stock her business a little more: one box of spark plugs, one bucket of grease, half a dozen inner tubes, a clutch cable, one box of oil and fifty bolts.

Donitila's husband is an independent salesman who buys and sells wood.  He is a wood dealer.  His work is doing well and so he also contributes money to stock the businesses.  They are both very grateful to Manuela Ramos because they have had a lot of help in starting up their family businesses.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming activity

loans.name: Houy

texts.en: Houy, 37 years old, is a grocery seller who earns $3 per day. Her husband sells palm fruit, and he earns $5 per day. The couple has three children; two are studying and one works in a factory, earning $3 per day. Every month, Houy has to spend $60 on food, $5 on electricity, $5 on school fees, $10 on transportation and $20 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy more grocery goods to sell. She wants to support her children to study and at least finish secondary school.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Dzunga

texts.en:
Dzunga is a married man with two children; one is enrolled in school, while the other is too young for school. His wife is a farmer who contributes to the provision of their family's basic needs. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family.

Dzunga has operated a meat goat selling business for the past three years. His potential clients are people from the slaughterhouse. He faces the major challenge of livestock disease, or sometimes even livestock death. He dreams of expanding his business. 

With this KES 40,000 loan, Dzunga wants to purchase goats and cattle for his business. He decided to join Yehu Microfinance because he wanted access to loan facilities.

loans.use: to purchase goats and cattle for his business.

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es:
Clotilde es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Barbara” del centro poblado de Chinumani, distrito, provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene  28  años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos.  Cuenta con estudios de secundaria.

Trabaja desde hace dos años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en la  compra de mercaderías para su negocio de venta de  ropas para bebes y otros productos como
shampoo, desodorantes, colchas y frazadillas para bebes. 

Solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 1,500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra de una docena de ropas, ropones, colchas de polar, shampoo, jaboncillo, entre otros.  Su esposo trabaja fuera del país.

La señora desea construir su casa y tener un carro, le gusta del Banco Comunal la puntualidad y la responsabilidad.

En la foto se muestra junto a su bebe.
texts.en:
Clotilde is a member of the 'Santa Barbara' community bank which is located in the small village of Chinumani, in Yunguyo district and province, in Puno department.  She is 28 years old, married, and has three children.  She has a high school level of education.

Clotilde has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years.  Her first loan was for 500 soles and she invested that money in buying merchandise for her business selling baby clothes and other products such as shampoo, deodorants, bedspreads and baby blankets.

Clotilde is requesting a new loan for 1,500 soles to invest in buying clothes, christening dresses, fleece bedspreads, shampoo, soap, etc.  Her husband works abroad.

Clotilde would like to build a house and own a car.  She likes the punctuality and responsibility of her community bank.

In the photo, Clotilde is shown with her baby.

loans.use: to buy clothes, christening dresses, fleece bedspreads, shampoo, soap, etc.

loans.name: Aida

texts.fr:
Mme Aida est une femme de 44 ans qui loge dans un village pas loin du centre-ville qui tend a se développer  grâce  à l’accroissement de la population .Elle est mariée  et mère de famille.
Aida est marchande depuis 19 ans. Elle vend de l’arachide, du niébé  de l’huile…
Avec le crédit elle veut augmenter ses marchandises.
Elle participe à la dépense quotidienne du foyer en se chargeant de l’achat du savon utilisé par les membres de sa famille.
texts.en:
Aida is a 44-year-old woman who lives in a village not far from the downtown area, which tends to expand along with population growth.

She is married and a mother. Aida has been a retail merchant for the past 19 years. She sells peanuts, niébé (black-eyed peas), vegetable oil,...

She intends to use her loan to increase her stock supply.

She participates in daily household expenditures by purchasing the soap used by her family.

loans.use: buy peanuts, vegetable oil, niébé (black-eyed peas)

loans.name: Misha

texts.en:
Misha is from the village of Ashotck in the Shirak region of Armenia.  Ashotck is his birthplace and he is proud of his village.  He hopes to live there permanently.  Misha is married with two children: a twenty-three-year-old daughter and an eighteen-year-old son.  Misha has been engaged in farming since 1988.  He hopes to increase his income to support his children’s higher education.  He has been using the services of microfinance for three years and is pleased with the services and the credit disbursement process.  This year, he would like another loan to purchase livestock.  With this new loan, Misha expects the family income to increase by 15%.  This loan is about 40% of the capital he has already invested in his business.


About the Field Partner – AREGAK Universal Credit Organization
In the fall of 1997, United Methodist Committee on Relief (UMCOR) established the AREGAK microfinance program, with the purpose to create economic opportunities for low income people who have no or limited access to the formal financial sources, especially in the remote rural areas. The microfinance program rapidly became one of the largest MFI in Armenia in terms of number of active clients and portfolio size.

In March of 2006, AREGAK UCO was registered as a Universal Credit Organization, structured as a Closed Joint Stock Company with UMCOR as the sole shareholder.
Today, AREGAK UCO provides a broad range of financial services to the population without compromising the social aspects of its mission and continues initiatives geared toward the fulfillment of its ethical principles

Vision Statement
To be the most dynamic and ethical financial institution in Armenia and Nagorno Karabagh.

Mission Statement
AREGAK supports the economic development of small and medium entrepreneurs with high quality, accessible and reliable financial services.

AREGAK UCO’s Ethical Principles
1. Integrity and Excellence
We deliver on our promises
We are honest and transparent in everything we do
We provide excellent customer service
2. Respect and Inclusion
Our leadership, workforce and decision-making reflect and respect the diversity of customers and communities we serve.
We value all employees, investing in their personal and professional growth.
3. Innovation
We develop new processes and systems to improve efficiency
We create value added new products to enhance economic opportunities

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Dufatanye /shr Group

texts.fr:
Marc  fait partie du groupe Dufatanye/Shyr. Il a 55 ans et il est marié avec 8 enfants de 13 à 34 ans, dont 2 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 5 ans de primaire.

Marc est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de faire la semence sélectionne du riz. Dans les prochaines années, Marc voudrait agrandir la surface de culture du riz. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
