Marc is a member of the group Dufatanye/Shyr. He is 55 years old and married with eight children ranging in age from 13 to 34, two of whom are at school. Marc attended 5 years of primary school.

Marc is a rice farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB, and he will use the loan to buy fertilizers.

His business growth strategy is to be selective in the rice seed that he sows. In the coming years, Marc would like to expand his farmable area. He will use his profits to support his children’s education and tuition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his rice farming activity.

loans.name: Killion

texts.en:
Killion was born in 1983. He is married and has three children.  He runs a retail shop to earn a living.  He has been in this business for 4 years.  He has retained his business because he has a good reputation with his customers.

Killion hopes to expand his business into wholesale in the future.  He has requested 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy sugar, cooking fat, maize flour, soda and tea leaves.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking fat, maize flour, soda, and tea leaves.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 38 years old and is married to Daniel. They have 3 children. She has been practising dairy farming for the past 2 years, earning a monthly income of Kes 9000.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET ltd of Kes 20,000. She will use the loan to purchase dairy feeds. With the anticipated profits she will also venture into vegetable cultivation.

Her hopes and dreams are to purchase more dairy cows and to cater for her basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase dairy feeds

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 43 years old, married, and they have been blessed with children between 25 and 7 years old.

She is a dairy farmer and she has been in business for 15 years. Right now her monthly income is KES 10,000. 

She is borrowing a loan of KES 30,000 in order to boost her business. She will pay back the loan with the anticipated profit from the business.

This is her second loan and she successfully paid her previous loan.

loans.use: To boost her dairy farming.

loans.name: Ketlyn

texts.en: My name is Ketlyn G., I work selling products of popular demand, I have my business for 5 years already, my mini market is preferred for the attention that I give to our customers, I have a large variety of products and I’m near a bus station in my community, my business generates income to support my family, my goal is to increase my inventory with new products and with better quality and with the profit I get I would be able to buy a refrigerator and some shelves to improve my business and pay for son’s education as I’m a single mother.

loans.use: Ketlyn will buy grocery store products like sodas, batteries, toilet paper, corn, beans, rice, sugar, cereal, juice, candy, cookies, bananas, butter, cheese, sauce, eggs, soap, sausages, meat, bread, milk, oil, salt, pens, soups, etc.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio has been working for a long time in the business of selling shoes. He used to have a shop in his own house, but when his marriage ended, his wife kept the business and Antonio had to start over again. Little by little, he opened a new shoe store. Now that he has his own business, he needs a loan of $1,200.00, which he will use to fill many of the orders that he already has, and to provide better service to his clients.

Antonio really wants to get ahead and he knows that with a little bit of help he can achieve great things. He expects to repay the loan over a period of 6 to 12 months. You can contribute to the growth of this business. Be an important part of Antonio’s life, he will be sincerely grateful.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Antonio tiene mucho tiempo en el negocio de venta de zapatos, anteriormente tenía su local en su propio domicilio, pero después de la disolución de su matrimonio, su esposa se quedó con el negocio y Antonio tuvo que empezar de nuevo, poco a poco logró abrir otra zapatería, ahora que ya tiene su propio negocio necesita de un préstamo de $1200 dólares que utilizará para surtir muchos de los pedidos que ya tiene, y para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Antonio tiene muchos deseos de superación, y sabe que con un poco de ayuda puede lograr grandes cosas, y espera devolver el préstamo en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses, tú puedes contribuir al crecimiento de este negocio, sé parte importante en la vida de Antonio, él te lo agradece sinceramente.

loans.use: To buy inventory

loans.name: Tomás

texts.en:
Hello, my name is Tomás B.. I'm a merchant, I own a traveling business that sells over-the-counter medications, products for personal hygine and for cleaning. I distribute my merchandise to different stores throughout the city. I have been in this business for some years now, and it provides me enough income to cover my family's expenses and my agreements with the suppliers. Right now, demand has grown and I don't have enough to satisfy my clients.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Maite Barragán

Hola Mi nombre es Tomás B., soy comerciante, cuento con un negocio de venta de Medicinas populares y achineria, producto que distribuyo de manera ambulantes en las diferentes pulperias de mi ciudad, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y demas compormisos con los proveedores. actuamete la demanda a crecido y no cuento con el capital para satisfacer toda la clientela.

loans.use: Purchasing Ibuprofen, lighters,  hair pins, diapers, zippers, floor cleaning products, etc...

loans.name: Imran

texts.en: Imran A. owns and operates a small Cell Phone and accessories shop in the town of Khachmaz located on the North Eastern coast of Azerbaijan. Imran is looking for funding so that he can increase his inventory for the seasonal increase in his business. The Khachmaz region in Azerbaijan is a farming region and the local population receives a good portion of their yearly income in the summer and early fall after selling their fruits and vegetables to the markets in Baku and Russia. It is this time of year that the local population has money and makes a majority of their purchases.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for his cell phone store in time for the summer rush.

loans.name: Ni Komang Karmini

texts.id:
Persistance is the main capital of Ni Komang Karmini, young mother, wife of I Gede Sujana. Although she felt resistance from the price speculation done by the pig businesspersons, that did not stop Komang Karmini to expand her business. With the capital from Dinari of Rp 1,400,000 (about US$150) this mother of a girl named Ni Luh Puspayani could buy 4 piglets to be fatten. With a cost of Rp5000 (about 60 cents) feed cost, within a period of 6 months she could profit Rp2000,000 (about $220). From that profit she will but more pig feedstock, so that within a year she could harvest 2X, and that would increase her profit.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Ketekunan adalah modal utama yang di miliki oleh Ni Komang Karmini, Ibu muda pasangan dari I Gede Sujana ini . Meski sering mengalami hambatan dan permainan harga yang dilakukan oleh ulah para pedagang babi, hal itu tak membuat pupus semangat Komang Karmini untuk mengembangkan usahanya. Dengan modal pinjaman dari Dinari Rp 1.400.000.- Ibu dari seorang anak perempuan yang bernama Ni Luh Puspayani ini membeli empat (4) ekor bibit babi yang siap untuk digemukkan. Dengan biaya Rp.5.000 per ekor untuk biaya pakan, maka keuntungan yang didapat dalam jangka waktu 6 bulan adalah Rp. 2.000.000.- Dari keuntungan tersebut akan dibelikan bibit babi lagi ,sehingga dalam setahun bisa panen 2 kali dan keuntungan yang didapat pun lebih banyak

loans.use:
To buy pig feedstock for fattening

Membeli bibit babi untuk penggemukkan

loans.name: Kea

texts.en:
Mrs. Kea M. was married in 2004 and now has one daughter. She learned to weave silk from her mother in 2003 and started her silk production in 2005 after she was married. She trained her husband to weave as well, and he can now assist her in weaving silk at home. 

This is the first time she has asked for a loan from MAXIMA. She has asked for $300 to purchase silk materials, sewing thread and to purchase another loom for her husband so that they can weave more silk and expand their business.

loans.use: to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and an extra loom

loans.name: Gabina Alicia

texts.es:
Gabina belongs to the Lirio Community Bank since 3 years. At her home, Gabina cooks and sells typical food from the region, like the “mondongo” and “puca picante”.

With this business, Gabina, who is a single mother, aims to cover all the needs of her 5 years old daughter.

Sometime ago, Gabina would only sell food on Saturdays and Sundays, now she sells it everyday of the week. She says that before she would sell the food in a very small place and that is why she decided to expand it and make it more welcoming.

Now that the place is bigger, Gabina wants her business to further expand by adding a groceries store.

With the 1000 soles (350 dls) Gabina requests, she will invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, milk, noodles, tuna and canned food.

Gabina says that through the Community Bank she learned to save, to have self-esteem and to better treat her clients. Her dreams are to see her daughter study to learn a profession and she would also like to build a house with solid materials.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Gabina pertenece al Banco Comunal Lirio desde hace 3 años. Gabina se dedica a la preparación y venta de comidas típicas de la región como “mondongo” y “puca picante”, negocio que realiza en su casa.

De esta forma Gabina, quien es madre soltera, espera sacar adelante a su hija de 5 años. Antes Gabina solo vendía su comida típica los sábados y domingos pero ahora vende todos los días.

Ella menciona que el ambiente donde vendía al inicio era pequeño, y que por ello decidió hacer un ambiente más cómodo y ahora cuenta con un local más grande. Ahora que tiene más espacio Gabina quiere que su negocio crezca implementando una tienda de abarrotes.

Entonces, con los 1000 soles Gabina invertirá en la compra de arroz, azúcar, leche, fideo, atún y conservas. Gabina dice que en su Banco Comunal aprendió a ahorrar, a tener autoestima y también a cómo atender al cliente.

Su sueño es que su hija estudie y sea profesional y también quisiera construir su casa con material noble.

loans.use: Gabina would like to expand her business adding a groceries store. She will use the loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, noodles, tuna and canned food.

loans.name: Soe

texts.en:
Mr. Soe K. (age 58) and his wife, Mrs. Say Moe have been married since 1981.They have seven children— two sons and five daughters. One of their daughters is working in a garment factory and the other children are studying in a local school. K. and his family are living on National Road 6, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. K. and his wife are in the business of growing vegetables and rice for selling at the market in Phnom Penh. They started their farming business in 1992. (Shown in the picture with his wife and his daughter)

K. is requesting his first loan of $600. He will use this loan to make repairs to his house.

loans.use: House repairs

loans.name: Zarifa

texts.en: Zarifa A. is 38 years old. She is married and lives with her husband in the town of  Khachmaz. She started a retail business 3 years ago. Zarifa would like a loan of $850 to buy goods to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To buy goods for resale

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Mrs. Tony, as her customers affectionately refer to her, started her fast food business 3 years ago in an effort to help her husband with the family expenses. Her family is comprised of 3 females and 1 male.

Thanks to her delicious way of preparing her meals, she is preferred among the people of Mérida, Yucatán. She would now like to expand her menu, offering up to 3 different casseroles for her diners, which is why she would like to obtain a loan of $250.00 USD that she is willing to repay in 3 months. She will use this loan in order to purchase the supplies necessary for this change. Let’s help Tony achieve her goal!

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Tony como cariñosamente la llaman sus clientes inicio hace 3 años un negocio de venta de comida para apoyar en la economía familiar a su esposo, su familia esta conformada por 3 mujeres y un hombre.

Gracias a su delicioso sazón ella goza de la preferencia de la gente de la ciudad de Mérida, Yucatán ahora desea expandir su menú ofreciendo hasta 3 guisos diferentes para sus comensales razón por la cual quiere contar con un crédito de US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar lo necesario para llevar a cabo este cambio. Ayudemos a Tony a cumplir su meta!!!.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies

loans.name: Lach

texts.en: Lach K., age 29, is a young mother of three children and has lived in Kampong Cham province for many years. She works making Khmer cake and has been selling them at the market since 2006, normally earning around $1.5 a day of profit. Her husband works making cutting boards. In Cambodia, usually all the cutting boards are made from wood. He receives $4 a day for his work. To make more profits, the couple would like to take a loan from Kiva to purchase a motorbike and trailer to run a new business. This will give them extra income to support the household. (Picture is of husband and wife.)

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and trailer

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther B. is very thankful and grateful to Kiva and shall always remain thankful to Kiva for their kind gesture. The loan, she said, is a great blessing. She is realizing a profit from the business and an increase in stock. She said that Kiva is a life saver for poor women like her. She feels strong and filled with hope that one day she will drive herself and her children out of poverty. Esther would like to continue expanding her fish business and is requesting a loan to purchase 2 baskets of dried fish.

loans.use: To purchase more baskets of dried fish to increase stock

loans.name: Lomuku 2004-A Group

texts.en:
Veronica S., the group leader, has a business selling flour and she has applied for this loan in order to purchase more flour to resell. Veronica is 30 years old, married and has four children between the ages of 6 and 20. Her husband is a builder and her children of school age attend school. Each week, Veronica makes approximately 100 Sudanese pounds in profits.

Veronica is joined in her small group by Joice K., Tereza S., Magreat F., and Cicilia A.. Joice K. sells bread and wants to expand her business. Tereza S. currently has a business selling bread and cooking oil at the market but would use this loan to build a hotel. Magreat F. operates a business selling tea at a restaurant and hopes to expand the restaurant. Cicilia A. is currently in the business of selling food at a hotel but has applied for this loan in order to buy a taxi for carrying passengers.

loans.use: To buy more flour

loans.name: Jose Mario

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Jose Mario R. and I work in the purchase and sales of household consumer goods, such as dining room and living rooms sets, sofas, chairs, etc.  I purchase the goods from distributors and later sell them to my customers on credit. 

Currently, I have a large order of goods to sell but unfortunately, I don’t have sufficient capital to invest in those goods.  This is why I am seeking a loan to be able to purchase the goods, sell them and generate a decent income since this is my only job and the only source of income to sustain my home and my family. 

 Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

hola mi nombre es Jose Mario R. me dedico a la compra-venta de articulos para el hogar como ser comedores, juegos de sala, sillones, sillas, etc, yo compro los articulos a los distribuidores y luego los vendo a mis clientes al credito, en estos momentos tengo un gran pedido de articulos para vender pero lastimosamente no tengo el capital para invertir en dichos articulos, por tal razon necesito una ayuda economica para poder comprar estos articulos y poder venderlos y tener ganancias, este es mi unico trabajo y con esto sustento mi hogar y mi familia.

loans.use: Purchase of dining room and living room sets

loans.name: Kodzovi Mawuena

texts.fr:
Kodzovi Mawuena A. is 39 years old, married and the father of five (5) children. He occupies and works in his welding workshop in Avetonou, a village located approximately 100 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital. With this loan, he would like to reorganize his workshop and acquire work tools. The profit that he earns from this business allows him to support the needs of his children and improve the conditions of their lives. Mawuena is a good client as he has made more than three (3) previous loans and repaid them regularly. Mawuena is wearing a blue shirt (in the photo). The other persons are his apprentices.

Translated from French by Dave Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer.

Kodzovi Mawuena A. est âgé de 39 ans, marié et père de 5 enfants. Il habite et travaille dans son propre atelier de soudure à Avétonou, un village situé à environ 100 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale Togolaise. Avec ce crédit, il souhaite aménéger son atelier et acquérir des outils de travail. Les profits qui se dégageront de son activité lui permettront de supporter les besoins de ses enfants et améliorer les conditions de la vie. Monsieur Mawuena est un bon client puisqu’il a déjà bénéficié de plus de trois crédits et les remboursements ont été réguliers. Mawuane est celui habillé en chemise bleue. Les autres personnes sont ses apprentis

loans.use: To reorganize his workshop and purchase work tools

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr:
Née le 15 août 1973 à Assanhoun, ville située à 80 Km de la ville de Lomé, madame Akouvi A. vit aujourd’hui à Lomé après avoir passé son adolescence à Assanhoun au côté de sa maman qui l’initia au commerce de charbon. Elle est mariée aujourd’hui et est mère d’un enfant. Depuis qu’elle s’est installée à Lomé 1998, elle vend du charbon de bois.
Elle à besoin de ce premier crédit pour augmenter son stock de charbon d’un montant de 150.000FCFA.
texts.en:
Born on August 15, 1973 in Assanhoun, a town situated 80 km from the city of Lomé, Mrs. Akouvi A. now lives in Lomé after having spent her adolescence in Assanhoun with her mother who taught her how to sell charcoal. She is now married and is the mother of one child. Ever since she came to live in Lomé in 1998, she has been selling charcoal.

She needs this, her first loan, to increase her stocks of charcoal by the amount of 150,000 FCFA.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of charcoal for re-sale

loans.name: Maria Andrea

texts.es: LA SEÑORA MARIA ANDREA TRABAJA COMO ASISTENTE EDUCATIVA DE UN PRESTIGIOSO COLEGIO Y SU ESPOSO EL SEÑOR JOSE DE JESUS LABORA TAMBIEN PARA UN COLEGIO COMO PROFESOR DE EDUCACION ARTISTICA JUNTOS ESTAN SOLICITANDO ESTE PRESTAMO PORQUE LE QUIEREN COLOCAR PROTECCIONES EN PUERTAS Y VENTANAS A SU CASA YA QUE TIENEN UNA BEBITA DE TAN SOLO 2 AÑITOS Y POR MEDIO DE ESTE PRESTAMO SE SENTIRAN CON MAS SEGURIDAD, “SU META DE VIDA ES TENER UN MEJOR MODO DE VIDA”.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Andrea works as an education assistant at a prestigious college and her husband is Mr. Jose de Jesus. He also works for a college as a professor of art and together they are asking for a loan because they want to put protection on the doors and windows of their house because they have a small baby that is only two years old and through this loan they will feel more secure. Their goal in life is to have a better way of life.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Put protection on the doors and windows

loans.name: Las Amistosas (The Friendly Folks) Group

texts.es:
Grupo conformado por comerciantes, que trabajan en el municipio de El Torno, Santa Cruz, Bolivia.
JORGE ESPINOSA, Es la líder del grupo,  vive en el torno tiene una venta de repuestos y actualmente vive en casa alquilada,  tiene tres hijos y es separado de su mujer desde hace unos años. El crédito que necesita será para invertir en el mismo negocio aumentando su capital. El desea tener su propio local y con el ahorro que vaya acumulando  con el tiempo quiere colocar una ferretería en su barrio.
ANGELICA RODRIGUES, vive en casa propia tiene tres hijos,  vive en la misma zona en el barrio naciones unidas de la misma localidad, se dedica a la venta de comida es ambulante. Como meta tiene la de llagar a contar con puesto fijo dentro del mercado, para poder seguir progresando.
ARMINDA ENCINAS, es la tesorera del Banco comunal, vive en la zona de la guardia, tiene cuatro hijos vive en la casa familiar. Se dedica a la venta de cosméticos fuera del mercado, el negocio con el que cuenta actualmente es ambulante y de la misma manera que las otras compañeras con el tiempo quiere llegar a colocar su negocio fijo. El  esposo trabaja como ayudante de chofer, el sueño de ambos es llegar a contar con vehiculo propio.
texts.en:
A group made up of businesspeople who work in the city of El Torno, Santa Cruz, Bolivia. JORGE ESPINOSA is the leader of the group. He lives in El Torno and has a grocery store. At the moment he lives in a rented house. He has three children and has been separated from his wife for several years. The loan that he needs would be invested in this business to increase his capital. He wants to have his own location and with savings that he has accumulated over the time he wants to open a hardware store in his neighbourhood. ANGELICA RODRIGUES lives in her own home. She has three children. She lives in the same area in the neighbourhood Naciones Unidas, of the same area. She works selling food in the streets. She has a goal to achieve a fixed stall inside the market, in order to be able to continue progressing. ARMINDA ENCINAS is the treasurer of the community bank. She lives in the area La Guardia. She has four children and lives in a home with her family. She works selling cosmetics outside of the market. The business that she currently has is on foot and like the other members of the group, in time she wants to have a business in a fixed location. Her husband works as an assistant of a driver. The dream of this couple is to have their own vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy cookies, gum and candy

loans.name: Parbati

texts.en:
Mrs. Parbati G., 33, lives in Thecho, Lalitpur District, Nepal. She is one of the active group members of Patan Business and Professional Women. She lives in a joint family with her father-in-law, her husband, two daughters, and a son. Her husband, Mr. Shankar G., is a farmer and works in their own field. Their daughters are studying in grades 9 and 5 and their son is in grade 3.  Because Mr. G. is the eldest son of his father, Nepali culture requires that his father live with them. 

Mrs. G. opened the grocery shop 5 years ago to improve the living standards of her family. She sells different types of grocery items in her store such as rice, maize, and noodles. Her children help her in her shop.  She is requesting a second loan of NPR15000 ($200.00) from Kiva to buy more varied inventory for her shop.

loans.use: To buy grocery inventory

loans.name: Sugran Basharat Ali Group

texts.en:
Sugran baji is the wife of B. A. and has been a citizen of Multan, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Her husband is a shopkeeper and, for the past 5 years, has been running a grocery store in the community. She is the mother of two sons. Her oldest son is involved in a fruit selling business. Her youngest son is 10 years old. Sugran baji is involved in a clothing selling business. She buys clothes from the famous market of Multan and sells them in her local community. Sugran baji is applying for a loan to buy more clothes to expand her clothing selling business.

Sugran baji is a group leader of some more women in her locality. Khadija baji is requesting a loan to buy clothes for her clothing selling business. Hamidan baji is requesting a loan to buy materials like cloth, sketches and colored thread for her decorative embroidery business. Sobia baji is requesting a loan to buy meat for her meat selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mohamad will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es:
La señora Nicolasa P. Coronel vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Llojeta, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposo, el señor Pedro Huanca y su hijo.
La señora Nicolasa así como su esposo trabajan como empleados en una ladrillería en la misma zona.
Con créditos anteriores construyeron dos habitaciones en su vivienda, las que en la actualidad están ocupando.
El crédito es para la conclusión de la construcción en obra gruesa de dos habitaciones nuevas.
Esta es la novena vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Nicolasa P. Coronel lives in her own home with her husband, Pedro Huanca, and her son in the community of Llojeta, on the western slope of the city of La Paz. Nicolasa and her husband are employed by a brickworks factory in the community. Using previous loans, they have built two rooms which they currently live in, in their home. This loan will be used to finish the structural work of two new rooms. This is her ninth loan; our socio-economic analysis determined that she qualifies for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To begin the structural work for two new rooms for her home.

loans.name: Tina

texts.en: Tina is 42 years old and married with three children. Tina sells foodstuffs and has been in this business for a long time. Tina hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly S. is a 58-year-old mother of seven. Her husband Arnaldo is a fisherman. She joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), Kiva's partner, to get capital four years ago. She is weaving mats and bags made of pandan leaves and raises pigs for fattening to help support the family.

She applied for this loan to buy assorted foods for her variety "sari-sari" store she had just started from the sales of her pigs. She wants to engage in this business in order to have a regular income since mats and bags are sold in seasons. However, she wants to invest some of her loan to buy raw materials for her weaving in order to sustain its order.

She hopes that in the future, she can save enough money to support a grocery store and buy raw materials in bulk to get a lesser price in the market. She dreams of sending her children in college.

loans.use: To buy assorted foods for variety store and to buy raw materials for weaving.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet A., 38, is married and is blessed with four children: one son and three daughters. One is currently learning a trade while the rest are in primary and junior high schools. Janet lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Takorase, near Akim Oda in the eastern region of Ghana. She works to support her husband financially to provide for the family. Her husband is a carpenter by profession, while Janet is a food vendor.

She cooks and sells rice and stew. She prepares and sells the food in the local government school compound. Janet procures bags of rice and other ingredients from the nearby supermarket. She has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to purchase bags of rice in bulk. Janet hopes to give her children the best of education.

loans.use: To purchase bags of rice in bulk

loans.name: Kodzo

texts.fr: Kodzo M. est conducteur de taxi résidant à Wome. Agé de 48 ans, il est marié et père de 4 enfants. Il opère dans ce domaine depuis 7 ans. Les pannes régulières de son engin lui causent des dépenses périodiques. Pour palier à ce phénomène, Kodzo souhaite avec ce crédit changer son moteur. Ceci lui permettra d’épargner plus et de mieux répondre aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kodzo M. is a moto taxi driver residing in Wome. He is 48 years old, married, and the father of four. He has been operating in this field for seven years. Regular engine breakdowns are a periodic cost for him. To mitigate this phenomenon, he would like to use this loan to change out his motor. This will enable him to save more money and to respond better to the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To renew the motor of his car

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel D., 24, is from the village of Katipunan, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has one infant-aged child.

To make a living, Maricel owns and operates a business raising crops. Her main source of income comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Maricel has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Maricel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maricel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000.00 PHP from PMPC to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

Maricel is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and pesticides. This loan will be her fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to support her family.

----------------------- About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers pesticides.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama A. is fifty–one years old. She is married and has given birth to six children: two sons and four daughters who are in the senior high, junior high and primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region of Ghana. Her husband is a carpenter. Ama is a trader. She trades in cereals such as maize and vegetables. She buys her goods from nearby communities at affordable prices and sells them in the market square in her community. She supplies to food vendors and retailers. Ama also treks to other markets to sell. She has been in business for over thirty years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. Ama aspires to expand her business and sponsor all her children to complete their education.

loans.use: To buy cereals to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Soty Cheam Village Bank Group

texts.en: The village bank consists of ten members and is located in Tareap Doun village, in the Kandal province. The group plans to use the loan that they have obtained for different purposes. Mrs. Soty C. has been selected by the Village Bank members to be the bank president.  She is a 33 year old mother, with a small child who is too young to either work or study.  She operates a small business as a fish seller. Her husband, Mr. Chhay Phana, is a motorbike taxi driver. He is also a fisherman and is in need of a boat to support his fishing business. Mrs. Soty C. has decided to request a loan to buy a boat for her husband.

loans.use: To buy a buy boat for her husband's fishing business

loans.name: Okamafo Jesus Group

texts.en:
Gilbert is a 42-year-old man. He is married and has four children, two girls and two boys. All his children are in school, and he works hard to provide for the children's education.

Gilbert is an achiever and a resourceful father for his household. He loves selling goods, the business through which he makes a living. He sells foodstuffs like bunches of plantains and cassava. He treks to surrounding villages in the community to purchase bulk stocks of cassava and plantains from the farmers. He also packages them and treks them to the city of Accra where they go for more money. For lack of adequate working capital, he is not able to pick up enough stock to make his business profitable to support his family. With the loan, he wants to purchase bulk supplies of plantains to enable him to scale up his business growth.

Gilbert is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Okamafo Jesus’ which literary means 'Jesus is our spokesperson'. He is the one sitting in front in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and/or farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase bulk supplies of cassava and plantains

loans.name: Macklina

texts.en:
Macklina is a member of the secondary borrower group in Ilala,Iringa.she is 30 yeras old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children.Her children are aged 14,12,and 8 years.

Mackilna started her own food business selling bites 12 years ago,she works 9 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 180,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Macklina`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 300,000 Tsh in order to buy more wheat,cooking oil.

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan Macklina hopes to save more money,pay school fess,get more food for family and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more wheat,cooking oil

loans.name: Korb

texts.en:
Mr. Korb K. is a battery charger. Aside from this work, he owns an "electric cow" (a machine that pulls a plough and runs on fuel). His electric cow is hired by the villagers to plow the fields. He needs money to buy a cart to connect with his electric cow for transportation. 
He is 26 years old and he now lives in Thnous village in TaK. province. His wife, Mrs. Un Mom, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. This couple has three children, one of whom is attending the local school while the others are just three and five years old. His wife is present on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cart to connect with his "electric cow" for transportation

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth Wacuka is a 41 year old lady married to Samson Ngaruiya, together they have three children who are all going to school. She has been doing small scale farming on her peice of land in the outskirts of Naivasha town for the last five years.

She got to know about KADET through various marketing and promotion activities done by KADET in Naivasha town. This is Elizabeth’s second loan from KADET and Elizabeth will use this loan to plough, buy seeds and prepare the land for the coming planting season.

Her future aspiration is to become a large scale farmer by buying a bigger piece of land and setting up a chain of green groceries shops where she can sell her farm produce to the entire Naivasha town. This will ensure her food security and stable income base.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Ploughing, buying seeds and preparing the land for the coming planting season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat de matériaux de construction

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria R. D.
texts.en:
Victoria lives in Old Cuscatlán which is a municipality in the La Libertad department. She is 64 years old and lives with her husband and her three adult children, all of whom are economically independent. Despite the financial help she gets from her children, she is a very hard working woman who can't imagine ever leaving her business which she has guided and seen grow and which now is very much in demand. She sells pupusas (a kind of stuffed corn dumpling) which are in high demand by the inhabitants of the town because the neighborhood where Victoria lives is well known for the variety of pupusas that can be found there. Weekends are Victoria's highest selling days and she is requesting this loan in order to purchase ingredients which will allow her to continue to produce her pupusas without having to face the inconvenience caused by running out of supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make pupusas (a kind of stuffed corn dumpling).

loans.name: El Cedrillo Group

texts.es: El grupo “El Cedrillo” esta representado por el señor Narciso y conformado por 12 miembros los cuales diferentes tipos D. negocios como la venta D. cosméticos por catalogo, moto taxista, venta D. ropa, venta D. comida, construcción, venta D. refrigerios o comida al paso y venta D. bebidas. En algunas actividades a las que se dedican los socios hay mucha competencia pero ellos saben como salir adelante ya que D. ello depenD. el sustento D. su familia. El destino del crédito es para la adquisición D. herramientas D. trabajo que ayuden a generar mejores ingresos así como para la adquisición D. mercadería e insumos para agrandar su negocio ya que del ingreso que generan depenD. toda su familia.  El grupo ya va cursando su segundo ciclo como grupo por lo que conocen muy bien la modalidad D. trabajo y saben como administrar bien sus fondos para generar mayores ingresos con el apoyo D. la Fundación  Agrocapital.
texts.en:
The group "El Cedrillo" is represented by the Señor Narciso, and is maD. up of 12 members who have a variety of businesses, including the sale of cosmetics through a catalog, motor taxi service, clothing sales, food sales, construction, sales of snacks or food (street vendors), and drink sales. In some of these areas there is a lot of competition, but they know how to advance their businesses, since the sustenance of their families depends on it. This loan will be used to acquire tools of the traD. that will help them to generate better incomes, such as the acquisition of merchandise and supplies to enlarge their businesses, since their families depend on the incomes that they generate. The group is pursuing its second loan cycle; the members of the group know their businesses very well and know how to administer the funds so as to generate increased incomes with the support of the Agrocapital Foundation.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital for operations

loans.name: Battulga

texts.en:
Z. Battulga is 47 years old and lives with his wife and four children in a house in Uvs province, Mongolia. His oldest son and daughter are both university students and his youngest son and daughter attend local secondary schools.

Battulga manages a meat and animal fat oil trading business in his town with the help of his wife. He sells a variety of meats and fat oil which he makes from the internal organs of animals. Animal fat oil is a popular product among residents who live far from the market and can't make frequent trips into town. They use it to make everyday foods such as buns and to fry potatoes. Battulga started his business in 2005 after working as a driver for a power plant since 1990.

Since he started, his business has grown quickly and has become quite profitable. He recently used his earnings to remodel his house. He says, "My business has enabled me to greatly improve my family's quality of life. I am now saving to buy a car which will help me operate my business in the future." Battulga is requesting a 750,000 MNT (~530 USD) loan to purchase animal fat and organs for his business.

loans.use: To purchase animal fat and organs for his business.

loans.name: Kossi Mawuyanya

texts.fr: Cet homme a appris la mécanique et s’est spécialisé dans l’électricité auto. Il a ouvert en 2006 son atelier dans le quartier d’Adidogomé. Il n’est pas marié et n’a pas non plu aucun enfant à sa charge. Cette activité lui permet de subvenir à la plupart de ses besoins. Il en profite également pour vendre des batteries d’alimentation auto à ses clients. Beaucoup de ses clients apprécient la rapidité et la qualité de ses services. Pour commander ces batteries, il sollicite de WAGES un crédit qui lui permettra de lancer cette demande.
texts.en:
This man learned mechanics and became specialized as an automobile elctrician. He opened his own shop in 2006 in the Adidogomé district. He is not married and has no children to support. This business enables him to meet most of his needs. He takes advantage of his shop to sell automobile power batteries to his customers. Many of his customers appreciate the speed and quality of his services. To order these batteries, he's requesting a WAGES loan that will allow him to initiate an order.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying power batteries for automobiles

loans.name: Marcial Enrique

texts.es: Marcial Enrique C. C. de 27 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Ahuachapán junto a su esposa, su hija y sus padres. Marcial posee un comedor, el cual cuenta con muy buena ubicación. En este negocio el trabaja junto a su madre elaborando la comida y sirviéndosela a sus clientes. Marcial es un hombre muy educado y atento el cual brinda un excelente servicio al cliente, razón por la cual muchas personas prefieren ir a comer a este negocio. El solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar carne, verduras, sodas y todos los productos de primera necesidad para la elaboración de la comida. Marcial con mucha esperanza espera iniciar este nuevo año con mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Marcial Enrique is 27 years old and lives in Ahuachapán with his wife, daughter, and parents. Marcial has a small restaurant in a good location. He works this business with his mother, preparing the food and serving it to the customers. Marcial is a well educated, attentive man who gives excellent customer service. This is why many people like to eat at this restaurant. He is requesting this loan so that he can buy meats, vegetables, soft drinks, and other ingredients. Marcial hopes to bring in the new year with greater earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy meats, vegetables, and food ingredients

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en:
N. Scovia is a businesswoman, 30 years old, and is the mother of three kids. She has a poultry business four kilometers from Abaita Ababiri. She started her business three years back.

Scovia is using the loan to purchase feeds, drugs and more chicks for her poultry farm. Her target is to have healthy poultry to attract customers.

Scovia’s future plans are to obtain a plot of land in her own name, to construct some rental houses for income generation and to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase feeds, drugs and more chicks for her poultry farm

loans.name: Norberta Veronica

texts.es:
El que aparece en la foto es padre de Norberta T..
Norberta es una persona emprendedora que esta dispuesta apoyar su papa en lo que ella pueda. El señor ya es de edad avanzada pero no quiere sentirse una persona inútil a pesar de sus años. Es por ello que Norberta lo apoya en poner un negocio de abarrotes que tiene 8 años establecido, pero por el momento quiere surtirse de mercancía con más variedad de artículos. 
El señor abre desde temprano y es quien atiende en negocio mientras su hija sale por las mañana trabajar en una maquiladora para tener mas ingresos ya que es madre de 2 hijos a quienes tamben tiene que ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
The person who appears in the photo is Norbeta T.’s father. Norbeta is an entrepreneurial person who is determined to support her father however she can. He is elderly, but he does not want to feel like a useless person in spite of his age. That is why Norberta helped him set up a grocery business, which was established eight years ago. Now she wants to stock it with a greater variety of merchandise. He opens very early, and he tends the business himself. His daughter leaves early in the morning to work in a factory to get more income because she has two children. She also has to give them a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for the business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary sells foodstuffs to make a living in Lagos State, Nigeria. She loves this business because it helps to meet the basic needs of her family members. She is 38 years old and married with 7 children. Her husband is a businessman and he also supports the home.

Mary hopes for the loan amount of NGN 70,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She is a LAPO client. Lift Above Poverty Organisation (LAPO) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. Mary says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Gillian's Group

texts.en:
Gillian P. is from the village of Mohon. She is 23 years old. Gillian is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Gillian is single and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Gillian owns & operates a  specialized retail store where she sells clothing & shoe products. Gillian has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2007, Gillian joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Gillian is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Gillian from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en: Rabih, a 22-year-old single man, worked for five years designing furniture with his uncle. In 2006, he started working on his own, taking private orders and building  a good business reputation.  Now Rabih is asking to borrow $1,000 so he can continue to expand his business and purchase woods to make a variety of products and meet the demands of his clients. He is certain that the loan will be very useful in improving both his business volume and his  family's economic status.

loans.use: To purchase woods

loans.name: Leda

texts.en: Leda P. is from the village of Dabong-dabong, Valencia City. She is 33 years old. Leda is widowed and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Leda owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Leda has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Leda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Leda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Leda from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Luis Guillermo

texts.es:
El señor Luis Guillermo H. C. es trabajador de la Alcaldía de Chinandega se desempeña como vigilante habita en el barrio la florida  es casado  y solo tiene un hijo en edad escolar.

El señor Luis Guillermo H. solicito el crédito para mejorar el piso de su casa ya que lo tiene un poco rustico de cemento, ya lleva cuatro años de trabajar con CEPRODEL  y ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable con sus pagos.
texts.en:
Luis Guillermo H. C. is an employee of the municipality of Chinandega where he works as a security guard. He lives in the La Florida neighborhood, is married, and has a school-aged son. Luis Guillermo is asking for a loan which will be used to improve the flooring in his house, which is currently made of cement and is rather basic. He has been working with CEPRODEL for four years and has shown that he is very responsible with repayment.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bricks, cement, and labor

loans.name: Buena Vista Group

texts.es:
El grupo Buena Vista está conformado por tres féminas trabajadoras una de ellas es la señora Cindy Yorlenis Arias C. quien vende cosméticos y ropa desde hace cinco años. El sueño de C. es mejorar su negocio.
Sus compañeras de grupo son Brenda Patricia Jarquín P. quien desde hace diez años vende ropa y Meylin del Socorro V. G. quien tiene una ferretería localizada en carretera norte, además de vender ropa por encargo.
texts.en:
The 'Buena Vista' group is made up of three hardworking women. One of them is Cindy Yorlenis Arias C., who has been selling clothes and cosmetics for five years. Her dream is to improve her business. Her fellow group members are Brenda Patricia Jarquín P., who has been selling clothes for ten years, and Meylin del Socorro V. G., who has a hardware store in the north and also sells clothes to order.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Cynthia R. le esta haciendo falta los acabados y el piso de concreto para tener terminada una parte de la casa. 
Pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora. 
La señora Cynthia R. tiene ya mas de tres años dedicándose a la decoración de salones de fiestas, también renta las fuentes de chocolate para las fiestas infantiles. 
Con el ingreso que obtiene de su negocio planea pagar el crédito. Ya que los gastos familiares su esposo el señor José Refugio Guerrero se encargara de los gastos de la familia.
Tiene dos pequeños hijos que actual mente están estudiando y desean que tengo un lugar mejor donde puedan vivir.
texts.en:
Cynthia R.’s house needs the finishings and a concrete floor to finish part of the house. But, she does not have the money needed to be able to buy the material and pay the person to make the improvements. Cynthia R. has been decorating party salons for over three years. She also rents chocolate fountains for children’s parties. She plans on paying the loan with the income she gets from her business. Her husband, José Refugio Guerrero, pays the family expenses. She has two small children who go to school. They want her to have a better place for them to live.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plaster the interior and put down a concrete floor

loans.name: Jhonson Paco

texts.es:
Jhonson tiene 42 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en el distrito de La Florida, un distrito de la sierra norte del país, pertenece a la provincia de San Miguel de la región Cajamarca, se encuentra ubicado a mas de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace ocho años a la fabricación de muebles, puertas y sillas en madera, el tiene un pequeño taller instalado en su domicilio donde confecciona sus productos para luego venderlos en diversos mercados de la zona norte del país, adicionalmente también elabora sus productos en base a pedidos, esta actividad es la unica mediante la cual percibe ingresos, por este motivo trata de mantener su negocio de la mejor manera posible.

Jhonson desea equipar su taller con una máquina cortadora, adquiriendo este equipo podrá mejorar la calidad de sus trabajos y también los realizará con mayor facilidad, para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Jhonson es una persona que siempre da lo mejor de si para sacar su negocio adelante, con las ganancias que percibe el sustenta sus gastos personales y ayuda al sostenimiento de su familia. En la zona el es conocido por su trabajo y por la responsabilidad con la que lo realiza.
texts.en:
Jhonson is 42 years old, single and has no children. He lives with his parents and siblings in the disctrict of La Florida, a district in the northern mountains of the country. This district belongs to the province of San Miguel in the region of Cajamarca. La Florida is more than two hours away from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region. For the past eight years, he has been building wooden furniture, doors and chairs. He has a small workshop in his home where he makes his products to sell later at different markets in the northern region of the country. Additionally, he also manufactures products based on orders. This activity is the only means by which he makes income. For this reason, he tries to maintain his business in the best way possible. Jhonson wants to equip his workshop with a cutting machine. Purchasing this equipment could improve the quality of his work and would allow him to carry it out more easily. To achieve this objective, he has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 Peruvian soles (2000 PEN). Jhonson is a person that always gives his best to move his business forward. With his earnings, he supports himself and helps support his family. In the area, he is known for his work and for the responsible nature with which he performs it.

Translated from Spanish by Tania Mazumdar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a cutting machine for a workshop to build wooden furniture.

loans.name: Bertilda

texts.es: Bertilda, de 38 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Cirilo de 39 años, quien trabaja en la municipalidad de Pichana, y sus 4 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles un mejor futuro. El trabajo al que se dedica, es el cultivo de plátano y café. Todos los días, muy temprano por la mañana, trabaja en su cultivo, puesto que sabe que las ganancias que reciba, dependerá mucho de la calidad de sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así vera que todo esfuerzo tiene su recompensa, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que desinfectar con productos químicos, ya que corre el riesgo que se enferme. Con el tiempo espera sembrar todas sus tierras, para obtener mejores ingresos. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, manifiesta que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su grupo comunal es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras, ya que es muy solidaria con ellas. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más insumos para evitar las plagas de sus campos de cultivo.
texts.en:
Bertilda is a 38-year-old woman who is very hard-working and responsible. She lives in her own home with her husband Cirilo, 39, who works in the municipality of Pichana, and their four beloved children, for whom they want to provide a better future. She makes a living cultivating bananas and coffee. She wakes up very early in the morning every day to work on her crops, knowing that her profits will depend heavily on the quality of her products. What she most likes about her job is harvesting her lands, since she gets to see all of her hard work bearing fruit. She has been doing this activity for 20 years, and considers disinfecting her crops with chemical products as the most difficult task, since she runs the risk of getting sick. With time she hopes to plant all of her lands and increase her income. This is Bertilda's fourth loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she tells us this will help her very much in making progress with her work. She is very beloved by the rest of her fellow community bank members, since she is very close with them. With the 800 nuevos soles she is requesting, she plans to purchase more supplies to rid her crops of pests.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies to rid her crops of pests

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 21-year-old single man living with his parents and 3 siblings. In 2007, he starts working in technology repairs, specialized in repairing computers, UPS, and  rechargeable mobile phones. He also works as a tattoo maker. He works in two jobs to make a good profit and provide a good life situation. Despite his young age, he has been able during 3 years to build up a good business reputation and good experience. 

He is requesting to borrow US$ 1000 to purchase a new tattoo machine to develop his business and attract more clients. And he plans in the future to open his own tattoo shop.

loans.use: purchase a new tattoo machine

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 21-year-old man from Jabalia, a city in the Gaza Strip. He had to start working immediately after high school to pay for his college tuition fees. Mahmoud worked at electronics shops and saved a good amount of money, which helped him to start his own shop.

Mahmoud sells electronics in the shop in which he appears in the photograph. He sells electronics and accessories, such as calculators, mobile phone accessories, speakers, computer accessories, etc. Mahmoud took a loan from FATEN to expand the items exhibited to include other types, and to increase the amount of goods he sells to respond to demand.

Mahmoud is looking forword to earning his degree and then building his own house.

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Servilla

texts.en:
Servilla N. is from the village of Brgy. Nagcuartelan, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 49 years old. Servilla is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Servilla makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Servilla has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 5800 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Servilla joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Servilla has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Servilla is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Servilla from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “HATUN SONCCO ”; El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosa., ella tiene  53 años de edad, es viuda;  La socia se dedica a trabajar haciendo el reparto de primera necesidad (carne blanca - pollos)  La socia trabaja proveyendo pollos a diferentes empresas, también ella tiene y una tienda abarrotes junto con su madre y ahora necesita el préstamo para implementar la tienda.  La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en implementar su tienda abarrotes.       
           
La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Hatun Soncco communal bank. The bank is located in Huanchac District, Cusco Province and Cusco Department. The member is Rosa. She is a 53-year-old widow. She works delivering staple goods (white meat chicken). The member works providing chickens to different companies. She also has a grocery store together with her mother and now needs the loan to stock her store. The member is asking for the loan to invest in stocking her grocery store. She is grateful for and appreciates the loan granted her through this medium, and she promises to make her payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her grocery store

loans.name: Fercelia

texts.en:
Fercelia E. is from the village of Soyung Echague. She is 29 years-old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Fercelia owns and operates a business raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Fercelia has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP whenever she sells one of her raised animals.

In 2010, Fercelia joined Kiva partner ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fercelia is requesting a first loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Tukolerewamu Association Bakijjulula-Mityana Group

texts.en:
It’s a priceless privilege to be warm-hearted in business terms. This kind of disposition will win spurs for any business person in terms of attracting customers in both the short and long term. 39-year-old K. Recheal who belongs to Tukolerewamu Association Bakijjulura group-Mityana can bear testament to the aforementioned. 

Recheal is a genial mother of 4 who works hard at administering and overseeing her food sales business in Bakijjulura-Mityana. Recheal mostly sells potato chips, doughnuts and soft drinks. She has used those good fundamental elements in her line of conduct to strike a chord with her customers over a period stretching to now 4 years. 

 Recheal is also a teacher and it’s with savings from this that she embarked on her first business which was selling agro produce. She dispensed with it later on after setting forth on this business. In a week, she makes profits that total up to 50,000 shillings and with this loan she wants to buy more potatoes and crates of soft drinks for resale.

loans.use: purchase of more potatoes and  crates of soft drinks

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita T. is from the village of Sta. Ana Echague. She is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Lolita owns a business making and selling native cakes, vegetables and other snacks. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month.

In 2006, Lolita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000 PHP from ASKI and is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Lolita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand the her business. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Dourng

texts.en:
Dourng N., 55, is married and resides with her husband and a child in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantation. N. is a grocery seller. Her husband is a police officer, earning an income of about USD 3.9 per day. 

N. has to spend USD 80 on food, USD 5 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 20 on other necessary expenses every month.  N. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase groceries to stock her store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  

This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Daudi Ndolo

texts.en:
Daudi Ndolo is a shopkeeper who is 48 years old. He is married to Rose Kalekye (age 50 years) who is a housewife. Together they have one 30-year-old daughter who is employed. 

Daudi’s shop is in Ngalasya market centre in Tala town, which has a good population for business. He has been running this business for the last 16 years and it generates a monthly income of Kshs 20,000. He was introduced to Kadet by the credit officer in charge of the Tala office.

Once Daudi gets the loan, he wants to buy sugar, cooking fat, flour and water containers to sell.

Daudi’s customers are happy with his business and the way he serves them with respect. He plans to save and have a wholesale business in the future.

Daudi describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking fat, flour and water containers to sell.

loans.name: Chille

texts.en: Chille C.'s main source of income comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, clothes conditioner, milk and choco drink in sachets or pouches, dried fish (like tamban and pinikas), fish paste and canned goods in her community. She is 33 years old, widowed and has three school-aged children. They are from the village of Poblacion, Dangcagan, Bukidnon. Chille has been in her business for over one year and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Chille joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Chille is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to buy and sell

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: La señora Maria, tiene 29 años. La señora Maria tiene su negocio de compra y venta de ropa nueva. Este negocio empezó hace 6 años con muy poco capital de trabajo, como una búsqueda de fuente de ingresos alternativos. Es una joven que tiene todas las ganas de salir adelante con su medio de vida. Esta no es la primera vez que solicita crédito. Actualmente con este financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de faldas, pantalones, trajes, vestidos ya que se acerca una buena temporada.
texts.en: Mrs. Maria is 29 years old. Mrs. Maria has a business which buys and sells new clothes. This business started 6 years ago with very little working capital as a search for a source of alternative income. She is a young woman with a lot of desire to get ahead in her line of work. This is not the first time she has asked for a loan. The financing she is currently asking for is to buy skirts, pants, suits, and dresses as the good season is approaching.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Batsaihan

texts.en:
Batsaihan C. is 45 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in the Arhangai Province of Mongolia. His two oldest sons attend a local high school, while his wife operates a construction business in the summer months. Batsaihan has timber trading and transportation businesses in his town.

Batsaihan started his transportation business between Arhangai and Ulaanbaatar, a capital city of Mongolia, in 1998 after purchasing a Russian jeep. He started his business with 450,000 MNT of working capital which has since grown to 6,000,000 MNT. After many years of successful operation, he was able to replace his vehicle with a much larger larger truck for 8,500,000 MNT.

Batsaihan, a very friendly man who has gained much experience both as a driver and businessman, is requesting a 2,300,000 MNT loan to enhance his transportation business.

loans.use: To enhance his transportation business

loans.name: Hoeung

texts.en: Hoeung L. is a 38-year-old woman who lives with another family member in Kompong Tom Province. To earn for living, she sells some chickens in the Krolang market, and makes a profit about $3 per day. She and her husband usually go to buy chicken in bulk at the cheapest price possible from rural people whose houses are full of poultry that they raise for selling. In addition, her husband is also a local farmer, and now he grows a few watermelons in his farmland. When it is mature, he always picks the finished product to sell in the busy market for extra fee. The coming rainfall is good for his crop, but now her husband doesn’t have capital yet to use on his farm. So that, Hoeung L. is looking for a loan for her husband to buy a cultivating machine to plow on farmland and to purchase fertilizers, and watermelon seeds for planting.

loans.use: To buy cultivating machine to plow on farmland and to purchase fertilizers, and watermelon seeds for planting.

loans.name: Karina Luzdelia

texts.es:
En la ciudadela San Eduardo, de la ciudad de Portoviejo, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Parque Ecológico, este lugar es conocido porque aquí hay un hermoso parque el cual es muy visitado por los turistas y personas de la localidad que quieren pasar un dia en contacto con la naturaleza.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Karina, ella tiene 28 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 5 y 3 años de edad, el mayor está estudiando en jardín de infantes. Su esposo es maestro en un colegio de la ciudad. Ella es Lic. En idiomas y trabaja en la Universidad Técnica De Manabí.

Se dedica a la venta de sabanas, su forma de  ventas es puerta a puerta y también por pedidos. Trabaja dos días en las noches y los fines de semana todo el día, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la compra en una distribuidora en Portoviejo, nos cuenta que ella aprovecha para venderles a sus compañeras de trabajo que la prefieren por el precio y la calidad que ella les ofrece. Lleva en este negocio ya  diez años y nos cuenta que esto le sirvió  mucho para sacar sus estudios adelante.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar sabanas y también un poco de ropa de temporada ya que también quiere dedicarse a vender esto. Es fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta porque hay bastantes facilidades de pago. Sus sueños son tener un nombramiento en la Universidad como maestra  en idiomas.
texts.en:
The members of the Parque Ecológico Communal Bank meet every fortnight in the San Eduardo neighbourhood of the city of Portoviejo. This place is known for its beautiful park, visited by many tourists and local people wishing to spend a day closer to nature.

This is where we met Karina, who is 28 years old and married with two children who are 3 and 5 years old. The eldest attends kindergarten. Her husband teaches at a school in the city. She has a degree in languages and works at the Technical University of Manabí. 

She earns a living by selling sheets door-to-door and on order. She works two nights a week and all day at weekends, offering her customers credit and collecting what they owe every fortnight. She buys her stock from a supplier in Portoviejo, and she tells us that she takes the opportunity to sell her goods to her work colleagues, who prefer them due to the price and quality she can offer. She has been in this business for ten years and tells us it has helped her move forward with her studies.

She will use this loan to buy sheets as well as a few seasonal clothes, because she also wants to start selling these. She is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because there are enough credit facilities. Her dream is to be employed by the University as a language teacher.

loans.use: To buy sheets and seasonal clothes.

loans.name: Mrs. Vorng Sarann Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. V. S. is the village bank president who has been selected by fifteen people who make up a village bank loan  located in Trapeang Young village in Takeo province. They will each use their portion of the loan in a way that will improve their family's living conditions.

 Mrs. V. S. is a weaver who is able to earn some income to support her family. Since her business is getting on well, she wants to expand. So to improve this business, Mrs. V. S. is applying for a loan to buy more silk for weaving. Her husband, Mr. Chanra Lor, is a construction worker and a farmer who owns a 1-hectare plot of land where he grows rice to sell to support his family. This couple supports three children, two of whom are students, while the youngest one is 4 years old.

loans.use: To buy more silk for weaving

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros M. is from the village of Brgy. Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 50 years old. Milagros is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Milagros owns & operates a general store.  She sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Milagros has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Milagros joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Milagros has successfully repaid a previous loan of 21,000 PHP from ASKI. That loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Milagros is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 11th loan taken out by Milagros from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions for her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

location.town: Brgy. Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Kotognontala Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Kotognontala, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 36 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Sirablekoro, préfecture de Dioïla ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, de pâte d’arachide, de poissons et de la restauration.                                                                                      
Les femmes du groupe Kotognontala sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire.                                                                         
AMINATA D., qui est la présidente du groupe, compte acheter un sac de 50Kg de riz pour la restauration au niveau du village. Elle effectue la restauration dans le village, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15.000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Kotognontala group are all married and 36 years old, with five children each. They all live in traditional extended families in the village of Sirablekoro, in the municipality of Dioïla, in the Koulikoro region (the second largest region of the Republic of Mali).
