They met through family and friendship links.  They sell condiments, peanut butter, fish and other food products. 
The women of the Kotognontala are on their fourth loan. 
Aminata D., the group's president, aims to purchase a 50kg bag of rice for food preparation. She sells prepared food in the village, for cash or credit sales to a customer base made up of men and women.
She aims to generate an average monthly profit of 15.000 FCFA which will be used to repay the loan, to pay for social ceremonies and to reinvest into the business.

loans.use: Purchasing rice

loans.name: Komlan

texts.fr: Monsieur Komlan  a 30 avec 2 enfants à charge.  Il est marié et habite quartier Bè Kpota.  Pour s’occuper de ses enfants, il fait la vente de pièces détachées  tout près de la  pharmacie Mathilda. Il achète les pièces au port autonome de Lomé et cumule 4 ans dans cette activité.  IL espère accroître son commerce et sollicite un prêt.
texts.en: Mr. Komlan is 30 years old and has two children to support. He's married and lives in the Bè Kpota neighborhood. In order to take care of his children, he sells spare parts next to the Mathilda pharmacy. He gets his supplies at the Autonomous Port of Lomé, and has four years of experience in this business. He's seeking a loan in hopes of bolstering his business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Danaya. Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  membres du groupe DANAYA  de l’association SAMBALAGNON sont  des femmes  toutes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 36  ans, et ont en moyenne  2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à OUAYERMA I un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali.) 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, le prêt passé a été bien remboursé. DIALIA D. fait le commerce de pomme de terre dans ce groupe de femmes DANAYA. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  4 sacs et demi de 100kg de pomme de terre. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Médine de la ville de Sikasso et dans les villages avoisinants Sikasso.
Elle les revend au grand marché de Sikasso ville et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 27.500FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de croître.
texts.en:
The seven members of the group DANAYA of the association SAMBALAGNON are all married women averaging 36 years of age and two children each. The women live for the most part in polygamous families in OUAYERMA I, a district in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  They are on their second loan with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their customers. The past loan has been repaid.

Ms. DIALIA D. does commerce in potatoes in this group of women. She intends to use her loan to buy 4½ hundred-kilo sacks potatoes. She gets her supplies at the Médine market in Sikasso City and in the villages surrounding Sikasso. She sells them at the big market of Sikasso City and at the family house. She accepts cash from a customer base composed of women and men. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 27,500 francs CFA. Part of the profits will be used to cover the loan interest, and the other part will be put into savings. 

Her ambition is to increase her turnover to further satisfy her ever-growing customer base.

loans.use: to buy potatoes

loans.name: Cipriano

texts.es:
El señor Cipriano tiene 74 años de edad, está casado con la señora Arminda González de 70 años de edad, tienen 5 hijos todos mayores de edad e independientes a ellos.
Don Cipriano emigró de la ciudad de Villeta hace muchos años a la ciudad de Itá donde abrió una despensa y una chipería, gracias a esas actividades logró costear los estudios de sus hijos.
El mismo manifiesta que lo consiguió con mucho sacrificio, actualmente sigue funcionando su despensa, allí surte a sus vecinos y a ocasionales clientes de arroz, azúcar, yerba, bebidas en general y otras mercaderías, per como desea mejorar su sotck de productos solicita el préstamo para la compra de dichos insumos, teniedo en cuenta que también opera con la Fundación Paraguaya desde el año 2.004 en forma excelente.
texts.en:
Cipriano is 74 years old and married to Arminda González who is 70.  They have five children who are all grown up and live independently.

Cipriano emigrated from the city of Villeta to the city of Itá many years ago.  He opened a grocery store and a small eatery.  Thanks to these business activities, he managed to pay for his children's studies.  He tells us that he managed this with a lot of sacrifice.

Cipriano continues to run his grocery store where he provides his neighbors and other customers with rice, sugar, yerba mate, drinks and other merchandise.  He would like to improve his stock and so requested a loan to buy the products he needs.  He has been working with Fundación Paraguaya since 2004 and has an excellent record.

loans.use: to buy baked goods, drinks, vegetables, cereals, sugar, condiments, etc.

loans.name: Lucia Esther

texts.es:
Lucia de 32 años, es una mujer trabajadora  que inicio su actividad en la venta de artículos por catálogos  para solventar los gastos del hogar. Es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 14 y 11 años que todavía estudian.

En la actualidad trabaja vendiendo bajo pedido mercadería todos los días. Su dificultad del trabajo es la delincuencia ya que recorre las calles para vender las sabanas. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con sus ventas pero por ahora quiere el préstamo para adecuar su hogar y asi terminarla y seguir trabajando duro para salir adelante y darle lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lucia is 32 years old.  She is a hard-working woman who started her business selling items through catalogs in order to cover her household expenses.  She is married and has two children aged 14 and 11 who are still in school.

Lucia currently works every day selling merchandise to customers upon request.  A difficulty she faces in her work is crime since she walks the streets selling her sheets.  She has many aspirations as regards her sales but, for now, she would like this loan so that she can do work on her home, finish it off and continue working hard so that she can get ahead in life and provide her children with the best.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and blocks

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 42 years old. She is married and has nine children.

Elvie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

Elvie has borrowed and paid back 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 9 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Elvie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Âgée de 39 ans, Madame Aminata vit dans une famille monogame avec son mari et ses  5 enfants dans le quartier Hamdallaye de la préfecture de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso).  
Elle n’ a pu faire d’études dû à des raisons sociales, elle s’est vite initiée aux activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa maman. Elle exerce diverses  activités génératrices de revenus  depuis maintenant 11 ans.  Elle est très bien sollicitée, a une bonne notoriété et reçoit des commandes à travers des associations féminines de son quartier.  
Pour l’élargissement et l’amélioration de son activité,  Madame n’a pas pris du temps pour faire recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis 4 ans.  Après avoir pris 4 prêts solidaires ( prêt de groupe ) tous remboursés  correctement sans difficulté, elle est à son 4ème  prêt individuel, après avoir correctement remboursés les trois précédents. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter, 7 pièces de moyen riche, 2 kg de potasse et des différents colorants à Bamako.  Elle effectue son activité dans la ville de Koutiala  à une clientèle mixte au comptant et à crédit.   
Elle compte sur un bénéfice mensuel de  120.000 FCFA qu’elle envisage d’utiliser pour le remboursement des  taux d’intérêts de Soro Yiriwaso et participer aux dépenses quotidiens de sa famille. 
Avec ce financement elle espère que sa perspective sera bonne  et qu’elle parviendrait  à satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
39-year-old Madame Aminata lives in a monogamous family with her husband and their five children in the Hamdallaye neighborhood of the Koutiala prefecture (Sikasso region).  She was not able to study for social reasons, but began learning business early on with her mother.  She has been pursuing various moneymaking activities for almost 11 years.  She is very much in demand, has a good reputation, and receives orders through various women’s associations in her neighborhood.

To increase and improve her business, Madame did not delay in turning to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso four years ago.  After four group loans, all paid back correctly without difficulty, she is on her fourth individual loan, after correctly paying back her previous three loans.  With this new loan, she plans to buy seven pieces of damask fabric, two kilograms of potash, and various coloring agents in Bamako.  She runs her business in the town of Koutiala for customers paying both cash and credit.

She expects a monthly profit of 120,000 FCFA which she plans to use to repay Soro Yiriwaso’s interest and help pay her family’s expenses.  With this financing she hopes that her future will be good and that she will be able to meet her clients’ needs.

loans.use: to purchase dye ingredients.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 38 years old and married with six children. Rosalina owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting taro for sale.  She has one year of experience in this business. 

Rosalina needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase knives, spades, wheel-barrow, sacks of fertilizers and gromozones to improve the standard of her business.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand her business.

In 2011, Rosalina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Rosalina's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase  knives, spades, wheel-barrow, sacks of fertilizers and gromozones to improve her business

loans.name: Dembereldavaa

texts.en: Dembereldavaa is 22 years old who lives with his mother and older sister in a house in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His mother is retired while her older sister manages a clothing trading business. He manages a taxi service business in his town. He started his business in 2010. He is a safe and reliable driver who provides comfortable service for his customers. He is planning to have repair done for his car in order to provide safe drive for his customers. He is a hardworking young man who says, "I am planning to continue business in the future." He is requesting a 800,000 MNT loan to purchase new parts for his car.

loans.use: To purchase to new parts for his car

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia has a pigpen and sells grown pigs. She has had this business for 12 years. Amalia is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Amalia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. She requested a loan of 14,000 Philippine pesos to buy feed for her pigs to be sold. In the future, Amalia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs to be sold.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 25 years old and single.  He raises poultry and has been in business for three and a half years.  Right now his monthly income from the business is KES.5,000.  He is requesting a loan of KES 8,000 to buy poultry feeds and medicine.

He plans to use the anticipated profit from the business to purchase more poultry for commercial purposes. This is his first loan.  His dream is to become one of the popular suppliers of poultry meat in Kenya.

loans.use: to buy poultry feeds and poultry medication.

loans.name: Ramos

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, tem 26 anos de idade, é casado não tem filhos, fez a 12ª classe. Vive na casa da mãe e responsabiliza se por ela e pelos seus três irmãos que vivem com ele em sua casa. 

Fez curso de professorado e por ser o mais velho da casa fica na responsabilidade da familia. É Docente e funcionario permanente ha mais de 8 anos com a categoria de Director da Escola auferindo mensalmente 9.060.00mt que aplica nas dispesas da casa.  Com o emprestimo Pretende antes  concluir a obra de uma casa para sua mãe para posteriormente iniciar a construcao da sua própria casa de materia convencional. Conta com ajuda da sua esposa que tambem é Docente.

Este é o segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção( chapas de zinco, cimento e areia) para dar continuidade da obra da sua mãe. O anterior de 10.000.00mt foi para habitação. Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo e pedir outro para iniciar a sua própria obra.
texts.en:
Ramos was born in Namaacha District. He is 26 years old, is married and has no children. He finished twelfth grade. Ramos lives in his mother's house and supports her and his three siblings, who live with him in the house.

Ramos took the teaching course, and because he is the oldest in the house he is responsible for the family. He is a teacher and has been a permanent employee for more than eight years, working as a school principal and earning 9,060 meticais per month, which he uses for household expenses. With the loan Ramos intends to first finish a house for his mother and then begin construction of his own house with conventional materials. He relies on the help of his wife, who is also a teacher.

This loan of 20,000 meticais is his second Hluvuku loan. He intends to buy construction materials (zinc sheets, cement and sand) to continue work on his mother's house. The earlier loan was for 10,000 meticais and was for housing. Ramos is confident that he will pay off this loan ahead of time and ask for another so he can begin his own house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (zinc sheets, cement and sand).

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana Maria tiene 37 años, su actividad es la venta de comida desde hace mas de 1 año que se dedica a este medio de vida, aunque no es fácil obtener a sus clientes contentos el esfuerzo que diariamente realiza Ana es muy admirable. Inicio este medio de vida por la necesidad de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar juntos tienen 2 hijos a su cargo. Es por este motivo que realiza este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima como arroz, frijoles, aceite, bolsas, platos desechables entre otros.
texts.en: Ana Maria is 37. She has sold food for over a year. Even though it is not  easy to keep her customers happy she makes an admirable effort every day. She started this business out of the necessity to help her husband with the household costs. Together they have two children to care for. For this reason, she is taking out a loan for the purchase of staples such as rice, beans, oil, bags, disposable plates, and other items.

loans.use: to purchase corn, beans, oil, bags, disposable plates and other items.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Uganda.  She is widowed and has four children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her sister and her sister's children).  

Margaret has a restaurant.  She has been in this business for five years, and she works six days out of every week.  Margaret sells her products at the market, by means of retail sales. She has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, rice, and sweet and Irish potatoes.  She also generates additional income by selling cold drinks.

The main business challenges for Margaret include defaulters and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked restaurant and see her business grow so big that she earns enough profit to build her own house. Margaret lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, food, and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, beef, rice, and sweet and Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa De Jesus tiene 52 años de edad, es soltera  no tiene hijos, vive sola,  en el Canton Chillanes Provincia de Bolivar.

La V.R.C se llama EL PLACER perteneciente al Canton Chillanes parroquia San Jose del Tambo esta ubicada a 60 minutos de la oficina, en esta ventanilla hay 24 socios que se dedican a la agricultura a la siembra de Platano, arroz, yuca, cacao, soya y naranja ademas crian animales de corral.

Teresa  se dedica a la siembra de arroz, maiz, naranja, soya y platano. Las compras las realiza en San Jose del Tambo y las Vende en el mercado de Chillanes los domingos en la feria.

El credito lo solicita para comprar de insumos agricolas y fertilizantes . El credito le ayudara como apoyo para mejorar la cosecha. Enfreta desafios como la salud. Su sueño es buena salud para seguir trabajando.

En los tiempos libres le gusta ir a misa.
texts.en:
Teresa De Jesus is 52 years old and is single with no children. She lives in the town of Chillanes in Bolivar Province.

Her rural community bank is called El Placer and is located in the town of Chillanes in San Jose del Tambo parrish. There are 24 members of the bank who work in agriculture growing plantains, rice, yucca, cocoa, soy beans, and oranges. They also raise livestock.

Teresa works growing rice, corn, oranges, soy beans, and plantains. She makes her purchases in San Jose del Tambo, and she sells them in the market in Chillanes on Sundays.

The loan will be used to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers. The loan will help her improve her crops. Her major challenges are her health. Her dream is to have good health and keep working. 

In her free time she likes to go to mass.

loans.use: insumos agricolas y fertilizantes

loans.name: Maria Candelaria

texts.es:
La señora Maria tiene 55 años D. edad, es madre soltera D. 5 hijos.

Ella se ha dedicado a la agricultura desD. hace 31 años, su papá fue quien le enseño este trabajo. La señora Maria se levanta todos los días junto con sus hijos a las 3:00 D. la mañana a darles D. comer a sus animales, para luego ir a trabajar durante 8 horas a sus cultivos que quedan a una distancia D. seis kilómetros D. donD. ella vive.

Para tener una buena cosecha, ella debe D. comprar insumos como fertilizantes, por lo que debe trasportarse a la ciudad en busca D. ellos. Para esto debe caminar a pie un kilómetro hasta la carretera principal y luego se desplaza en bus hasta la ciudad donD. adquiere sus fertilizantes.

Ella utilizará el préstamo para la compra D. fertilizantes, herbicidas y fungicidas, lo que le permitirá aplicarle los nutrientes necesarios a su cultivo D. maíz y poder obtener una buena cosecha. Esto le permitirá cubrir sus obligaciones crediticias y las necesidades D. su hogar.

Con los ingresos generados a partir D. la venta del maíz, ella tendrá la oportunidad D. volver a sembrar y podrá reparar el techo y las paredes D. su casa. El techo es D. lámina D. metal, y está muy deteriorado. Las paredes son D. adobe y ya están dañadas.

A ella le gustaría en un futuro comprar más ganado del que ya posee, para la producción D. leche y D. esta manera venderla y tener otra fuente D. ingresos. Otra fuente D. ingresos le permitiría proveer una mejor calidad D. vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria is 55 years old. She is a single mother of 5 children.

She has been farming for 31 years. Her father taught her this work. Maria gets up every day with her children at 3 in the morning to feed her animals, and then goes to work for 8 hours on her crops, which are located six kilometers from where she lives.

In order to have a good harvest, she needs to buy supplies such as fertilizers, and she must travel to the city in search of them. For this, she must walk one kilometer to the main highway and then travel on a bus to the city where she buys her fertilizers.

She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers, herbicides, and fungicides, which will allow her to apply the necessary nutrients to her corn crop and enable her to have a good harvest. This will allow her to meet her credit obligations and the needs of her household.

With the earnings generated from the sale of the corn, she will have the opportunity to plant again, and she will be able to repair the roof and walls of her house. The roof is sheet metal and is in very bad condition. The walls are adobe and are already damaged.

In the future, she would like to purchase more livestock than she currently has, in order to produce milk and sell it and have another source of income. Another source of income would allow her to proviD. her children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, herbicides, and fungicides for growing corn

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is 30 years old. He lives in Tsovagyugh village, Gegarkunik marz, with his wife and two sons. His older son attends a school and the younger one attends a kindergarten. Karen’s wife is jobless and helps her husband in animal breeding and land cultivation. 

Karen and his wife raise three cows, four calves, a pig and 15 chickens. They also grow potatoes for sale. They sell milk, meat and potatoes from their farm to their regular customers. 

To increase his family’s income Karen intends to start sheep breeding. He is asking for a 700.000 Armenian dram loan to buy five sheep. Also he wants to buy one more cow for his farm.  
  
This is Karen’s second loan from Nor Horizon.

loans.use: To buy five sheep and a cow for his developing farm.

loans.name: Chuluunerdene

texts.en:
Chuluunerdene is 34 years old and lives with his wife and three kids in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Hovd province of Mongolia. His wife stays at home and watches her youngest daughter while the older two children go to kindergarten. 

Chuluunerdene started his taxi service business in 2006 by buying his own car. Since then he has built his own garage and got many regular customers. Now that winter is approaching he needs his car to be repaired for the harsh winter in Mongolia. He is requesting 600,000 MNT to purchase spare parts and winter oil for his car.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts and winter oil

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is married and has two kids. She is 31 years old and resides in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. Grace manages her own venture selling fish in their barangay (neighborhood or village) to make a living. She has had this business for more than 12 years. Each month, she earns 8,000 Philippines pesos (Php) doing this kind of work. She has requested a loan in the amount of Php 10,000 to purchase additional fish to sell and materials for the boat. She has been a member of GDMPC for more than two years. In the future, Grace will use the profit for the needs of her two kids, especially for the educational plan of her kids. She will do more to make her business progress.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell and materials for the boat.

loans.name: Marta Sonia

texts.es:
Doña Marta continua con su venta de ropa de segunda mano, la venta de mochila, bolsos, que junto a su esposo, atienden en un mercado de la capital, pues en esta inversion, ha venido creciendo ya que son aprecios accesibles y de buena de calidad. Captando clientes.
Con este nuevo financiamiento, podra comprar pacas mixtas, carteras, bolsos, muchila, acercandose ya la temporada buena en las ventas, y por tal razon quiere surtir mas.
Pues en este negocio, no se deja de vender, aunque sea poco, siendo el objetivo aumentar su inversion, obteniendo mejores utilidades, trabajando bien  su capital.
texts.en:
Doña Marta continues selling second-hand clothing. backpacks, handbags at a market in the capital together with her husband as her investment has been growing since their prices are reasonable and their products are of good quality. They attract customers.

With this new financing she will be able to buy mixed bales of clothing, wallets, handbags, backpacks, as the good sales season is approaching and for this reason she wants to stock more.

As in this business, one always sells even if only a little, the goal being to increase her investment, obtain better profits and put her working capital to good use.

loans.use: to buy mixed bales of clothing, bags, wallets and backpacks to increase her sales.

loans.name: Wanjoya Shg C Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Wanjoya SHG C Group in Western Kenya! Naomi is the facilitator of the Wanjoya SHG C group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Naomi is a mother of three children. She joined One Acre Fund due to the best yield from the firm, thus wanted to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Naomi had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 18 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Naomi was only able to harvest 7 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Naomi and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Naomi will repay her loan and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Wanjoya SHG C group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Naomi is pictured with her group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish for her business.

loans.name: Achol

texts.en:
Achol is a 40 year old a married woman with four children.  Three of them are in school. She has had a food stall business in Bor, South Sudan for four years.

Achol requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase beans and onions for sale.

loans.name: Magu Group

texts.en:
Jamadini is in his late 40s and is single. He has been selling secondhand clothes for about four years now. He works from 8 am to 6 pm and he is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Jamadini’s third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loan to increase his stock of secondhand clothes and has paid back his loan successfully. He hopes for a loan to buy more stock of secondhand clothes. Jamadini’s dream is to one day build his own house.

Jamadini will share this loan with his loan group, "Magu", which includes 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more stock for his business

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is 54 years old. She lives with her husband, son, and daughter. Emma has been engaged in farming for nine years: she keeps a greenhouse. Emma has applied for a loan to cultivate the land and develop her greenhouse. With the help of the loan, she plans to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and fuel. This development of her farming will allow Emma to increase her income and insure a higher living standard for her family.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fertilizer, and fuel.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a 53-year-old, married woman with 7 children. She lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with her family.

Delia works in a fishing business. Her husband operates their fishing boat and Delia sells his catch at the market. Delia and her husband work together to provide food, clothes and other basic needs. Delia works hard to keep her family healthy and happy.

She has requested this loan to purchase additional fishing nets, hooks and other materials. This will help Delia and her husband to have more fish to sell.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets, hooks and other materials

loans.name: Thach

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Kampong Siem district, Thach is 31 years old and married with three children. The main sources of the family’s income are growing beans and working for others for a fee, which she and her husband have been doing for 11 years to make a living. 

Thach is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is applying for a loan to buy pesticides and fertilizers and pay for labor fees. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers and pay for labor fees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district
